column2:
>***Scroll down for English version***

S obzirom na veliku podršku u ostvarivanju ciljeva te činjenicu da smo ostvarili i drugi cilj, a pred nama je još 9 dana kampanje odlučili smo se za još jedan korak i ideju koja je samo čekala priliku za ostvarenje. Prikupljamo dodatnih 10 000 dolara, kako bismo u sklopu Buba Bara otvorili i kuglanu. S obzirom da je u prostoru predviđenom za Buba Bar već i ranije postojala kuglana, osim što ćemo zaposliti osobe s invaliditetom, vratit ćemo stari sjaj kuglani i poboljšati društveni život u Vinkovcima.

Naši Bubamarci u samo tri dana dostigli su cilj kampanje za uređenje prostora Buba Bara. S obzirom na ovaj uspjeh i preostalih 20 dana kampanja odlučili smo otići korak dalje i prikupiti dodatnih 5000$ kako bi u rad Buba Bara uključili još 5 Bubamaraca!
column4: >UPOZNAJTE NAŠE BUBAMARCE
column6:
'>Alen, Domagoj, Dario, Ivana i Marija već tri mjeseca marljivo vježbaju i bruse svoje vještine kako bi njihov početak rada bio što uspješniji. Spremni su iskazati se i svima pokazati svoje talente, a njihovo uzbuđenje zbog početka rada u Buba Baru teško je prenijeti riječima.

Domagoj ima 41 godinu i dosada nije imao priliku raditi. Posao u Buba Baru biti će njegova prva prilika za rad. ''Samo želim raditi i oženiti se'' – kaže Domagoj. To je njegov najveći san, i zapravo nije toliko različit od snova većine ljudi. Ekstra kromosom kavu će učiniti još posebnijom. Domagoj je vrlo vrijedan i želi svojoj obitelji olakšati financijsku situaciju.

Ivana dolazi iz Vukovara i ima najljepši kaputić. Voli pjevati, zajedno s Alenom, pa Buba Bar već ima svoje zvijezde u usponu. S njom nema previše rasprave, ako vam slučajno preko usta prođe kakva ''šporka'' riječ budite spremni od Ivane čuti jedan  veliki ''beeeeep''. Ivana je vrlo draga i uvijek nasmijana - pogotovo ako ju Alen škaklja.

Alen će vas bez problema upozoriti ukoliko ste popili koju čašicu previše. Obožava pjevati i izvoditi konobarske trikove. Alen radi u stakleniku poljoprivredne škole i rado će vam preporučiti da kupite maćuhice koje je sam uzgojio.

Marija ima 21 godinu. Nakon teške prometne nesreće i dugotrajnog oporavka dobila je priliku za svoj prvi posao u Buba Baru. S prvom plaćom želi kupiti auto i počastiti svoje prijatelje.  Najdraža gošća u Buba Baru Mariji će zasigurno biti njena sestra blizanka Katarina.

Dario je uistinu fin dečko. Kada je riječ o poslu, vrlo je ozbiljan. ''Najvažniji su red, rad i disciplina'' – kaže Dario. Usprkos ozbiljnosti u poslu, voli se šaliti i htio bi imati djevojku, ako je moguće stariju. Ako se pitate zašto, dođite na kavu i osobno ga pitajte za šankom!

To su naši ''Bubamarci'' – budući zaposlenici Buba Bara. 

Od ukupno 500 000 osoba s invaliditetom u Hrvatskoj, samo 2.4% je zaposleno.

column1: Alen, Domagoj, Dario, Ivana i Marija prvi će dobiti priliku raditi u Buba Baru!

Jeste li ikada upoznali osobu s Downovim sindromom i osjetili toplinu njihova srca? Mi vjerujemo da su osobe s Downovim sindromom divni zaspolenici koji mogu doprinijeti poslu ako im se pruži prilika. I s ekstra kromosomom napraviti ekstra kavu!

Naša je misija poboljšati kvalitetu života osoba s invaliditetom, te potaknuti društvo da osobe s invaliditetom prihvati kao svoje ravnopravne članove.

Želimo da Buba Bar probije led, i da uskoro svaki grad u Hrvatskoj ima svoj Buba Bar! Želimo mladima s invaliditetom pružiti priliku da žive život kao i svi ostali ljudi. Želimo da budu u mogućnosti raditi.


Što nam je potrebno?

Potencijal kafića Buba Bar prepoznala je i Gradska uprava, te nam je na korištenje dala atraktivan prostor u centru grada veličine 500 četvornih metara kojeg prethodno treba adaptirati.

Kao neprofitna organizacija financijska sredstva nismo u mogućnosti osigurati, stoga smo pokrenuli kampanju za njihovo prikupljanje. Kako bi Buba Bar čim prije stavili u funkciju potrebno nam je 10.000 dolara.

Kompletan iznos prikupljenih donacija uložiti ćemo u uređenje i opremanje prostora koji će u potpunosti biti prilagođen osobama s invaliditetom, a ugodan ambijent pružit će i široj lokalnoj zajednici mogućnost za kvalitetnim druženjem i zajedničkim aktivnostima.

Koja je vaša uloga u otvaranju Buba Bara?

Kafić „Buba Bara“ biti će mjesto najkvalitetnije kave  - kave servirane s posebnim osmijehom, mjesto koja će etablirati i na prvo mjesto ponovno vratiti osnovno ljudsko pravo -  pravo na rad.

Buba Bar je za Bubamarce ispunjenje njihovih snova, prilika da pokažu koliko vrijede i koliko su spremni biti ravnopravnim dijelom društva.

Želimo da podržite ovu ideju i uvijek ostanete naši vjerni gosti.

.

VREMENSKI TIJEK NAŠEG RADA

            

Budite uz naše Bubamarce!

„Buba Bar“ je projekt Udruge osoba s invaliditetom „Bubamara“ iz Vinkovaca iza kojeg stoji 1495 članova udruge. 

Pomozite nam da stvorimo mjesto jednakih mogućnosti za sve - nas sa one, i vas s druge strane šanka.

Hvala!
column2:
>*****

Meet ours Bubamars!


Alen, Domagoj, Dario, Ivana and  Marija are intensively practicing, for three months, to sharpen and polish their skills for a more successful start of work. They are ready to prove themselves and show off their talents. They are so excited, they will get to work at Buba Bar!

Domagoj is 41 and didn't have a chance to work so far. The job in “Buba bar” will be his first. „I just want to work and get married“ –  he said. This is his biggest dream, and is not that different from what most people want. Because that extra chromosome makes your coffee a little bit lovelier. Domagoj is very diligent and he wants to contribute to his family finances.

Marija is 21. After a heavy traffic accident and long lasting recovery she was given an opportunity to get her first job in “Buba bar”. With her first salary, she wants to buy a car and treat her friends. Her favorite and truest guest will for sure be her twin-sister Katarina.

Alen won´t have a problem to warn you if you had drunk a glass too much. He likes to sing and perform stunts in the true spirit of the waiter. He works at the greenhouse of the agricultural school and is very happy to recommend you to buy pansies he had grown by himself. He always has his true and loyal audience because his charm is difficult to resist. Just to mention, he likes two types of girls (as he says!) – city girls and village girls.

Ivana comes from Vukovar and has the prettiest coat. She likes to sing, together with Alen, so “Buba bar” has its rising stars. You can´t discuss much with her and if you use bad language in front of her, be ready to hear a “beeeeeeeeeep”. She is very lovely and always smiling and laughing, especially if Alen tickles her.  

Dario is a very nice guy too. He is very serious when we talk about work. “The most important things are order, work, and discipline” - he says. Despite the seriousness about work, he likes to make jokes and he would like to have a girlfriend, if possible older than himself. If you´re wondering why, you should come for a coffee and ask him directly at the bar!

These are our “Bubamarci” - how we call the employees of “Buba bar”. 

From a total of 500,000 people with disabilities in Croatia, only 2.4% of them are employed.

Alen, Domagoj, Dario, Ivana and Marija are the first five who will get the opportunity to work at the Buba Bar!

Have you ever met a person with Down syndrome and felt the warmth of their hearts? We believe that people with Down syndrome make wonderful employees who can make positive contributions to a business when given the chance. And make the extra coffee with that one extra chromosome!

Our mandate is to improve the quality of life for the intellectually challenged, and to evolve the Croatian societal views and acceptance of these individuals into society.

Our vision is that “Buba bar” will be the icebreaker and that we shall pave the path that soon every city in Croatia gets its “Buba bar”! Our vision is to give young adults with disabilities the possibility to live their lives just like every other person. We want them to be able to have their own job.

So how shall we do it and what is your role?

The administration of Vinkovci has recognised the potential of this social entrepreneurship project. They gave us to use for the bar a 500m2 space in the city center, but it needs adaptation.

For that, as a non-profit organization, we cannot ensure funds needed. We need your help to raise 10.000 $ and enable “Buba bar” to work.

This money will be invested in space arrangement and furnishing. The Bar will be completely adapted for people with disabilities and the pleasant ambience will be useful for wider local community, providing the possibility for spending some quality time and common activities.

Coffee shop „Buba bar“ will be the best coffee place – coffee served with a special smile. We all have the right to work, for Domagoj, Marija, Alen, Ivana and Dario it has a special meaning. For them, “Buba bar” means a dream come true and a big chance to show how much they are willing to work and be treated as equal society members.

We want you to support this idea and to be our always welcome guests.

Buba Bar is a project from the Association of people with dissability ""Bubamara"" from Vinkovci that has 1495 members. 

Help us build the place of equal possibilities for everyone -  on both sides of the bar.

Make it possible!

Thank you!
 

","***Scroll down for English version***S obzirom na veliku podršku u ostvarivanju ciljeva te činjenicu da smo ostvarili i drugi cilj, a pred nama je još 9 dana kampanje odlučili smo se za još jedan korak i ideju koja je samo čekala priliku za ostvarenje. Prikupljamo dodatnih 10 000 dolara, kako bismo u sklopu Buba Bara otvorili i kuglanu. S obzirom da je u prostoru predviđenom za Buba Bar već i ranije postojala kuglana, osim što ćemo zaposliti osobe s invaliditetom, vratit ćemo stari sjaj kuglani i poboljšati društveni život u Vinkovcima.Naši Bubamarci u samo tri dana dostigli su cilj kampanje za uređenje prostora Buba Bara. S obzirom na ovaj uspjeh i preostalih 20 dana kampanja odlučili smo otići korak dalje i prikupiti dodatnih 5000$ kako bi u rad Buba Bara uključili još 5 Bubamaraca!UPOZNAJTE NAŠE BUBAMARCEAlen, Domagoj, Dario, Ivana i Marija već tri mjeseca marljivo vježbaju i bruse svoje vještine kako bi njihov početak rada bio što uspješniji. Spremni su iskazati se i svima pokazati svoje talente, a njihovo uzbuđenje zbog početka rada u Buba Baru teško je prenijeti riječima.Domagoj ima 41 godinu i dosada nije imao priliku raditi. Posao u Buba Baru biti će njegova prva prilika za rad. ''Samo želim raditi i oženiti se'' – kaže Domagoj. To je njegov najveći san, i zapravo nije toliko različit od snova većine ljudi. Ekstra kromosom kavu će učiniti još posebnijom. Domagoj je vrlo vrijedan i želi svojoj obitelji olakšati financijsku situaciju.Ivana dolazi iz Vukovara i ima najljepši kaputić. Voli pjevati, zajedno s Alenom, pa Buba Bar već ima svoje zvijezde u usponu. S njom nema previše rasprave, ako vam slučajno preko usta prođe kakva ''šporka'' riječ budite spremni od Ivane čuti jedan  veliki ''beeeeep''. Ivana je vrlo draga i uvijek nasmijana - pogotovo ako ju Alen škaklja.Alen će vas bez problema upozoriti ukoliko ste popili koju čašicu previše. Obožava pjevati i izvoditi konobarske trikove. Alen radi u stakleniku poljoprivredne škole i rado će vam preporučiti da kupite maćuhice koje je sam uzgojio.Marija ima 21 godinu. Nakon teške prometne nesreće i dugotrajnog oporavka dobila je priliku za svoj prvi posao u Buba Baru. S prvom plaćom želi kupiti auto i počastiti svoje prijatelje.  Najdraža gošća u Buba Baru Mariji će zasigurno biti njena sestra blizanka Katarina.Dario je uistinu fin dečko. Kada je riječ o poslu, vrlo je ozbiljan. ''Najvažniji su red, rad i disciplina'' – kaže Dario. Usprkos ozbiljnosti u poslu, voli se šaliti i htio bi imati djevojku, ako je moguće stariju. Ako se pitate zašto, dođite na kavu i osobno ga pitajte za šankom!To su naši ''Bubamarci'' – budući zaposlenici Buba Bara. Od ukupno 500 000 osoba s invaliditetom u Hrvatskoj, samo 2.4% je zaposleno.

column1: Alen, Domagoj, Dario, Ivana i Marija prvi će dobiti priliku raditi u Buba Baru!

Jeste li ikada upoznali osobu s Downovim sindromom i osjetili toplinu njihova srca? Mi vjerujemo da su osobe s Downovim sindromom divni zaspolenici koji mogu doprinijeti poslu ako im se pruži prilika. I s ekstra kromosomom napraviti ekstra kavu!Naša je misija poboljšati kvalitetu života osoba s invaliditetom, te potaknuti društvo da osobe s invaliditetom prihvati kao svoje ravnopravne članove.Želimo da Buba Bar probije led, i da uskoro svaki grad u Hrvatskoj ima svoj Buba Bar! Želimo mladima s invaliditetom pružiti priliku da žive život kao i svi ostali ljudi. Želimo da budu u mogućnosti raditi.Što nam je potrebno?Potencijal kafića Buba Bar prepoznala je i Gradska uprava, te nam je na korištenje dala atraktivan prostor u centru grada veličine 500 četvornih metara kojeg prethodno treba adaptirati.Kao neprofitna organizacija financijska sredstva nismo u mogućnosti osigurati, stoga smo pokrenuli kampanju za njihovo prikupljanje. Kako bi Buba Bar čim prije stavili u funkciju potrebno nam je 10.000 dolara.Kompletan iznos prikupljenih donacija uložiti ćemo u uređenje i opremanje prostora koji će u potpunosti biti prilagođen osobama s invaliditetom, a ugodan ambijent pružit će i široj lokalnoj zajednici mogućnost za kvalitetnim druženjem i zajedničkim aktivnostima.Koja je vaša uloga u otvaranju Buba Bara?Kafić „Buba Bara“ biti će mjesto najkvalitetnije kave  - kave servirane s posebnim osmijehom, mjesto koja će etablirati i na prvo mjesto ponovno vratiti osnovno ljudsko pravo -  pravo na rad.Buba Bar je za Bubamarce ispunjenje njihovih snova, prilika da pokažu koliko vrijede i koliko su spremni biti ravnopravnim dijelom društva.Želimo da podržite ovu ideju i uvijek ostanete naši vjerni gosti..VREMENSKI TIJEK NAŠEG RADA            Budite uz naše Bubamarce!„Buba Bar“ je projekt Udruge osoba s invaliditetom „Bubamara“ iz Vinkovaca iza kojeg stoji 1495 članova udruge. Pomozite nam da stvorimo mjesto jednakih mogućnosti za sve - nas sa one, i vas s druge strane šanka.Hvala!*****Meet ours Bubamars!Alen, Domagoj, Dario, Ivana and  Marija are intensively practicing, for three months, to sharpen and polish their skills for a more successful start of work. They are ready to prove themselves and show off their talents. They are so excited, they will get to work at Buba Bar!Domagoj is 41 and didn't have a chance to work so far. The job in “Buba bar” will be his first. „I just want to work and get married“ –  he said. This is his biggest dream, and is not that different from what most people want. Because that extra chromosome makes your coffee a little bit lovelier. Domagoj is very diligent and he wants to contribute to his family finances.Marija is 21. After a heavy traffic accident and long lasting recovery she was given an opportunity to get her first job in “Buba bar”. With her first salary, she wants to buy a car and treat her friends. Her favorite and truest guest will for sure be her twin-sister Katarina.Alen won´t have a problem to warn you if you had drunk a glass too much. He likes to sing and perform stunts in the true spirit of the waiter. He works at the greenhouse of the agricultural school and is very happy to recommend you to buy pansies he had grown by himself. He always has his true and loyal audience because his charm is difficult to resist. Just to mention, he likes two types of girls (as he says!) – city girls and village girls.Ivana comes from Vukovar and has the prettiest coat. She likes to sing, together with Alen, so “Buba bar” has its rising stars. You can´t discuss much with her and if you use bad language in front of her, be ready to hear a “beeeeeeeeeep”. She is very lovely and always smiling and laughing, especially if Alen tickles her.  Dario is a very nice guy too. He is very serious when we talk about work. “The most important things are order, work, and discipline” - he says. Despite the seriousness about work, he likes to make jokes and he would like to have a girlfriend, if possible older than himself. If you´re wondering why, you should come for a coffee and ask him directly at the bar!These are our “Bubamarci” - how we call the employees of “Buba bar”. From a total of 500,000 people with disabilities in Croatia, only 2.4% of them are employed.Alen, Domagoj, Dario, Ivana and Marija are the first five who will get the opportunity to work at the Buba Bar!Have you ever met a person with Down syndrome and felt the warmth of their hearts? We believe that people with Down syndrome make wonderful employees who can make positive contributions to a business when given the chance. And make the extra coffee with that one extra chromosome!Our mandate is to improve the quality of life for the intellectually challenged, and to evolve the Croatian societal views and acceptance of these individuals into society.Our vision is that “Buba bar” will be the icebreaker and that we shall pave the path that soon every city in Croatia gets its “Buba bar”! Our vision is to give young adults with disabilities the possibility to live their lives just like every other person. We want them to be able to have their own job.So how shall we do it and what is your role?The administration of Vinkovci has recognised the potential of this social entrepreneurship project. They gave us to use for the bar a 500m2 space in the city center, but it needs adaptation.For that, as a non-profit organization, we cannot ensure funds needed. We need your help to raise 10.000 $ and enable “Buba bar” to work.This money will be invested in space arrangement and furnishing. The Bar will be completely adapted for people with disabilities and the pleasant ambience will be useful for wider local community, providing the possibility for spending some quality time and common activities.Coffee shop „Buba bar“ will be the best coffee place – coffee served with a special smile. We all have the right to work, for Domagoj, Marija, Alen, Ivana and Dario it has a special meaning. For them, “Buba bar” means a dream come true and a big chance to show how much they are willing to work and be treated as equal society members.We want you to support this idea and to be our always welcome guests.Buba Bar is a project from the Association of people with dissability ""Bubamara"" from Vinkovci that has 1495 members. Help us build the place of equal possibilities for everyone -  on both sides of the bar.Make it possible!Thank you!",13.0,0,"1 Campaign

Let’s do your hair and talk about life.

We're opening doors at 207 Quimby Street in the Creston Neighborhood of Grand Rapids, MI this May. Here's our dream for Sharp Corners:

Transparent, accessible hair care...what we offer is what you get! We’ll always talk you through what we’re doing and what we can offer, because we genuinely care.

Every time is a happy time. It’s more than just getting your hair done. We want you to leave feeling like your truest self.

A beautiful space (with windows! and air conditioning!) where we can all be ourselves and enjoy each other’s company as we figure out this messy life.

Most of all, we look forward to being a vibrant part of both Creston and the greater Grand Rapids community.  

What We Need

We want to open doors and have an amazing space that leaves people feeling inspired. By making a donation, or purchasing services in advance, you help us do exciting things like have sinks, plumbing, and maybe even a microwave to make lunch in! Most of all, you’re helping create a vibrant community space where we can be ourselves and have great hair.

Where exactly the money goes to.

• $250 / Dishwasher

• $600 / Shampoo Sink

• $80 / Vacuum Cleaner
• $300 / Ikea couch

We are Rise &
column2: Root Farm! We are farmers, educators, community organizers and food entrepreneurs with deep roots in New York City and an unwavering commitment to engaging rural and urban communities through food and farming.  Collectively we have decades of farming and gardening experience, both rural and in the city. We are committed  to increasing opportunities for all people to grow and eat good food.

column1: The six of us came together with a common dream to continue our food justice work by growing food, building community, and creating a healing, nurturing place for ourselves and others.  This year we’re breaking ground and starting a new farm on 3 acres of land in the Black Dirt Region of Orange County New York!
To make this dream come true, we need your support.

Through Indiegogo, we hope to raise part of our start up costs to ensure we have a solid foundation and the tools we need to begin a successful operation. We plan on working hard and just as importantly, being smart about how we use our time. Many of our start up costs are tools that will make our work more efficient, including a two wheeled tractor with implements, weeding equipment (a real need in the fertile black dirt!), and greenhouse supplies. We also have location-specific needs like a pump, which is essential to prevent flooding. Our campaign goal is $50,000, which will help us meet more of our financial needs.

We have some great perks available to thank you for your contribution to our campaign. Everyone who donates $25 or more will receive a customized farm refrigerator magnet and special donor listing on our website.  Additional perks include plenty of opportunities to visit our farm, benefits from the farm's bounty and a chance to have a special farm item named after you! Supporting our campaign also gives you bragging rights forever - the chance to say “you were there when they got started.”  And most importantly, your contribution is a chance to feel great about the fact that you are making a real difference in growing the roots of our farm and helping us continue the work that we are doing.
Who we are
We are Rise &
column2: Root Farm! Among our farmers are founders, graduates and teachers of New York City’s Farm School NYC, four graduates of the internationally acclaimed Ecological Horticulture Apprenticeship program at the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS), a 2014 James Beard Leadership Award recipient, two former directors of NYC urban farming non-profits, and the Founder and Chef of Crock &
column3: Jar.  In 2012, our whole farm team participated in Grow NYC's Farm Beginnings program, developing our farm vision and building the foundation of our business plan. With our collective knowledge, skills and experiences of working with food from seed to table, we are excited to create a farm that will reflect our values for growing ethically and sustainably on the land while providing healthy food to our communities and growing our local food economy.

column1: Part of our farm plan includes the already existing company, Crock &
column3: Jar is a value-added and food preservation company focused on supporting local farmers while sharing the craft of fermenting and preserving foods. In 2015, Rise &amp
column4: Root Farm will provide crops for Crock &amp
column6: Jar will develop new products based on our farm’s specialties.

column1: As a group, we wear our farmer hats with very clear intentions about our farming practices, building healthy relationships with both the land and with our community partners. Rise &
column2: Root Farm will serve as an education site for current partners in New York City and the local community, providing workshops and volunteer opportunities once we are established. To increase opportunities for people to have a more holistic farm experience, at some point in the future, we will also offer overnight farm stays for visitors.

column1: Finally our farm group is made up of women and includes people of color and LGBTQ people. We are proud of who we are and what we want to accomplish. Historically, all of the above mentioned groups have been discriminated against and had to fight for many of the rights that we benefit from today. We will always remember to honor our foremothers for their strength, resiliency and determination to rise above these challenges. By starting Rise &amp
column2: Root Farm, we are creating a welcoming and safe space where people are free to be themselves.

Risks &

Some of you may be familiar with the challenges that come with farming: unpredictable weather (droughts, hurricanes, floods), increasing land prices, demanding physical labor, and low wages, just to name a few. We are determined to make the farm succeed, be profitable and pay ourselves a living wage, while continuing to provide food to and collaborate with underserved communities. We realize that we are stronger together than individually.  By farming as a cooperative, each of us brings individual skills and experience that fortifies our collective efforts.

On top of that, we’re crossing what feels like a great divide of moving from the city to the country.  Several of us have lived in NYC for decades, some a lifetime. We love the communities we’re a part of, the culture and vibrancy of the city, the diversity and access that the city provides.  And all the while we've dreamed of being part of something more. Each of our journeys has brought us to reconnect with land in the city, which has then helped us to reconnect with rural communities. We’ve learned that the challenges in both the urban and rural food system are related and that we need each other. And part of our goal as a farm is to help bring rural and urban together to collaboratively grow a healthy and just world through food.

Stay in touch!
Stay in touch with us!  Please follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest.  You can also find Crock &
column2: Jar at the Fort Green farmers market and stay tuned for future market locations.

column1: We will have plenty of volunteer opportunities on the farm and workdays, so please sign up for our mailing list if you are interested in hearing more.

More About Our Founding Team
Maggie Cheney - Maggie brings decades of farming experience to the team,
including two seasons at <span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
column4: > the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS) and her recent role as Director of Farms &

column1: Ecostation: NY. She is currently both the Vegetable Farm Manager and the Youth Education Coordinator at Sol Flower Farm, a diversified market farm and CSA in Millerton, NY.
Lorrie Clevenger - In addition to being a farmer, Lorrie is an
educator and organizer around food and justice, founding the Black Urban Growers and co-founding Farm School NYC. She most
recently returned from the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food
Systems (CASFS), where she taught more than 30 apprentices at the farm &
garden.
Michaela Hayes - Michaela is the Founder and Chef of Crock &
preservation company focused on supporting local farmers while teaching  the craft of preserving foods. Michaela brings extensive
experience working in restaurants such as Gramercy Tavern, where

she founded their pickling program. She is the co-founder of NYC Ferments, a monthly meetup group for the fermentation community. When she is not preserving food, Michaela is also a talented food stylist.
Jane Hodge - As the founding Director of Farm School NYC, Jane helped to train residents in

urban agriculture by growing food, leaders, and community in NYC. She received a Certificate in Ecological Horticulture from the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS). In the past two years, Jane farmed at Obercreek Farm, Snug Harbor Heritage Farm, and Roxbury Farm.
D. Rooney - D is a farmer, teacher, carpenter, and a lover of all things culinary.
She is a Farm School NYC graduate, and her most recent experience is as
an urban farmer with Bushwick Campus Farm. She teaches classes for
Kingsborough Community College and Farm School NYC, and she specializes
in teaching carpentry for beginners, especially for women.
Karen Washington - Recently dubbed
""Urban Farming's Grand Dame"" by the New York Times, Karen spent the last few decades founding, working with, and mentoring countless
community gardens across New York City. Because of her ability to
inspire others around growing food, she received the 2014 James Beard Leadership award.  Karen has been
a backyard and community gardener for decades, and she received a
Certificate in Ecological Horticulture from  the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS).  Karen is also co-founder of Black Urban Growers and Farm School NYC.
","Summary

We are Rise & Root Farm! We are farmers, educators, community organizers and food entrepreneurs with deep roots in New York City and an unwavering commitment to engaging rural and urban communities through food and farming.  Collectively we have decades of farming and gardening experience, both rural and in the city. We are committed  to increasing opportunities for all people to grow and eat good food.

The six of us came together with a common dream to continue our food justice work by growing food, building community, and creating a healing, nurturing place for ourselves and others.  This year we’re breaking ground and starting a new farm on 3 acres of land in the Black Dirt Region of Orange County New York!
To make this dream come true, we need your support.

Through Indiegogo, we hope to raise part of our start up costs to ensure we have a solid foundation and the tools we need to begin a successful operation. We plan on working hard and just as importantly, being smart about how we use our time. Many of our start up costs are tools that will make our work more efficient, including a two wheeled tractor with implements, weeding equipment (a real need in the fertile black dirt!), and greenhouse supplies. We also have location-specific needs like a pump, which is essential to prevent flooding. Our campaign goal is $50,000, which will help us meet more of our financial needs.

We have some great perks available to thank you for your contribution to our campaign. Everyone who donates $25 or more will receive a customized farm refrigerator magnet and special donor listing on our website.  Additional perks include plenty of opportunities to visit our farm, benefits from the farm's bounty and a chance to have a special farm item named after you! Supporting our campaign also gives you bragging rights forever - the chance to say “you were there when they got started.”  And most importantly, your contribution is a chance to feel great about the fact that you are making a real difference in growing the roots of our farm and helping us continue the work that we are doing.
Who we are

We are Rise & Root Farm! Among our farmers are founders, graduates and teachers of New York City’s Farm School NYC, four graduates of the internationally acclaimed Ecological Horticulture Apprenticeship program at the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS), a 2014 James Beard Leadership Award recipient, two former directors of NYC urban farming non-profits, and the Founder and Chef of Crock & Jar.  In 2012, our whole farm team participated in Grow NYC's Farm Beginnings program, developing our farm vision and building the foundation of our business plan. With our collective knowledge, skills and experiences of working with food from seed to table, we are excited to create a farm that will reflect our values for growing ethically and sustainably on the land while providing healthy food to our communities and growing our local food economy.

Part of our farm plan includes the already existing company, Crock & Jar. Crock & Jar is a value-added and food preservation company focused on supporting local farmers while sharing the craft of fermenting and preserving foods. In 2015, Rise & Root Farm will provide crops for Crock & Jar’s products, and Crock & Jar will develop new products based on our farm’s specialties.

As a group, we wear our farmer hats with very clear intentions about our farming practices, building healthy relationships with both the land and with our community partners. Rise & Root Farm will serve as an education site for current partners in New York City and the local community, providing workshops and volunteer opportunities once we are established. To increase opportunities for people to have a more holistic farm experience, at some point in the future, we will also offer overnight farm stays for visitors.

Finally our farm group is made up of women and includes people of color and LGBTQ people. We are proud of who we are and what we want to accomplish. Historically, all of the above mentioned groups have been discriminated against and had to fight for many of the rights that we benefit from today. We will always remember to honor our foremothers for their strength, resiliency and determination to rise above these challenges. By starting Rise & Root Farm, we are creating a welcoming and safe space where people are free to be themselves.
Our Founding Team Includes: (to learn more about each click on their name, or scroll to the end of this page)
Maggie Cheney
Lorrie Clevenger
Michaela Hayes
Jane Hodge
D. Rooney
Karen Washington
Risks & Challenges

Some of you may be familiar with the challenges that come with farming: unpredictable weather (droughts, hurricanes, floods), increasing land prices, demanding physical labor, and low wages, just to name a few. We are determined to make the farm succeed, be profitable and pay ourselves a living wage, while continuing to provide food to and collaborate with underserved communities. We realize that we are stronger together than individually.  By farming as a cooperative, each of us brings individual skills and experience that fortifies our collective efforts.On top of that, we’re crossing what feels like a great divide of moving from the city to the country.  Several of us have lived in NYC for decades, some a lifetime. We love the communities we’re a part of, the culture and vibrancy of the city, the diversity and access that the city provides.  And all the while we've dreamed of being part of something more. Each of our journeys has brought us to reconnect with land in the city, which has then helped us to reconnect with rural communities. We’ve learned that the challenges in both the urban and rural food system are related and that we need each other. And part of our goal as a farm is to help bring rural and urban together to collaboratively grow a healthy and just world through food.
Stay in touch!
Stay in touch with us!  Please follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest.  You can also find Crock & Jar at the Fort Green farmers market and stay tuned for future market locations.
We will have plenty of volunteer opportunities on the farm and workdays, so please sign up for our mailing list if you are interested in hearing more.
More About Our Founding Team
Maggie Cheney - Maggie brings decades of farming experience to the team,
including two seasons at  the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS) and her recent role as Director of Farms & Education with
Ecostation: NY. She is currently both the Vegetable Farm Manager and the Youth Education Coordinator at Sol Flower Farm, a diversified market farm and CSA in Millerton, NY.
Lorrie Clevenger - In addition to being a farmer, Lorrie is an
educator and organizer around food and justice, founding the Black Urban Growers and co-founding Farm School NYC. She most
recently returned from the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food
Systems (CASFS), where she taught more than 30 apprentices at the farm &
garden.
Michaela Hayes  - Michaela is the Founder and Chef of Crock & Jar, a value-added food
preservation company focused on supporting local farmers while teaching  the craft of preserving foods. Michaela brings extensive
experience working in restaurants such as Gramercy Tavern, where

she founded their pickling program. She is the co-founder of NYC Ferments, a monthly meetup group for the fermentation community. When she is not preserving food, Michaela is also a talented food stylist.
Jane Hodge - As the founding Director of Farm School NYC, Jane helped to train residents in

urban agriculture by growing food, leaders, and community in NYC. She received a Certificate in Ecological Horticulture from the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS). In the past two years, Jane farmed at Obercreek Farm, Snug Harbor Heritage Farm, and Roxbury Farm.
D. Rooney - D is a farmer, teacher, carpenter, and a lover of all things culinary.
She is a Farm School NYC graduate, and her most recent experience is as
an urban farmer with Bushwick Campus Farm. She teaches classes for
Kingsborough Community College and Farm School NYC, and she specializes
in teaching carpentry for beginners, especially for women.
Karen Washington - Recently dubbed
""Urban Farming's Grand Dame"" by the New York Times, Karen spent the last few decades founding, working with, and mentoring countless
community gardens across New York City. Because of her ability to
inspire others around growing food, she received the 2014 James Beard Leadership award.  Karen has been
a backyard and community gardener for decades, and she received a
Certificate in Ecological Horticulture from  the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS).  Karen is also co-founder of Black Urban Growers and Farm School NYC.",9.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Chester, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-us-rise-root/pica

Who We Are

Our group “Wags to Riches” is a group of six students from The University of Tennessee, Knoxville, and we are raising funds and awareness for the local non-profit organization Young-Williams Animal Center. Although our team ranges from freshman to senior, and our majors range from kinesiology to supply chain management, helping our furry friends is at the top of our list.
Why the Young-Williams Animal Center?

Young-Williams is a local shelter in Knoxville that helps all kinds of animals and families every single day. Their mission is to “To lead the community to end pet homelessness, promote animal welfare, and enhance the human-animal bond.” They have already completed one of their goals of becoming a no-kill shelter, but they need your help for everyday care and treatments. For more information about the Young-Williams Animal Center, visit https://www.young-williams.org
Why Should You Care?

Young-Williams is a local shelter in Knoxville that helps all kinds of animals and families everyday. During such an unprecedented time of COVID-19 our furry friends have always been by our side and have helped so many of us get through these difficult times. Every year, Young-Williams is faced with thousands of animals needing treatment such as spay and neuter surgeries, behavioral help, unpredicted surgeries, and other accommodations. Animals within this shelter depend on community donations and grant funding to make what Young-Williams does happen every day. This wouldn’t be possible without the care, treatment, and accessibility Young-Williams Animal Center has given to the people of Knoxville.
What Are the Benefits of Donating to Young-Williams?

Donating towards the “Wags to Riches” campaign not only helps a local non-profit animal shelter, but also gives hope to the many people involved with Young-Williams. However you donate, you are helping Young-Williams to become one step closer to their goals. With each donation, our furry friends are one step closer to finding their forever homes. The money donated also keeps the shelter open, which allows for more animals to receive care. There are many benefits for you as well! These benefits include choosing from our many perks, and knowing that you helped out a few furry friends!
What Your Money Goes Towards

All donations that are received will go directly to Young-Williams to help them provide quality care to all of their animals. This money will help the shelter buy anything they need to help maintain and keep the shelter open including food, beds, and necessary treatments. These furry friends need your help to live their best lives and find their forever homes!
Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t able to donate money to our campaign, don’t worry because there are other ways you can help! Young-Williams has many volunteer opportunities, so if you are willing to spare some time to help these furry animals you can do that. Young-Williams also has a fostering program where you can look after dogs or cats temporarily. They also accept almost any type of donation such as food and blankets. Young-Williams has many more ways you can help and support these animals listed on their website, so if you are interested take a look!

column7:
>Community Connection is partnering with folks like you to purchase a new technology called Community Platform to help the community meet local needs more strategically. 

What is Community Platform?

This technology provides national, state, and local data on nonprofits and community infrastructure, as well as web tools for community collaboration and action. Bottom line - Community Platform can help us connect the dots between local needs and resources. 

Some of the features include:

GIS mapping of local needs and resources
column9: />Build the local knowledge base
column11:
/>Track program outcomes

Share nonprofit resources online
column13:
/>Map resources near schools

Analyze nonprofit finances

What We Need 

The Athens Area Community Foundation has generously decided to match half the cost of the platform. Now, we are calling on local individuals and organizations to help us change our city with this new technology by funding the remaining $3,500 within 45 days. This will allow us time to launch the event in fall of 2014.  

We will keep you updated on the progress of this project and every dollar you give will go toward the purchase of Community Platform - even if we do not reach our goal. 

The Impact

Through a contribution of any size you can:

column1: • help better meet the needs of your community
• help funders like yourself make more strategic philanthropic decisions (bigger bang for your buck!)

• help local nonprofits better collaborate to avoid overlapping of services

    • Several other cities across the country have adopted this technology and are seeing results!
<li>
Aspen Community Platform - Aspen, CO
<li>
Connect Brevard - Brevard County, FL
<li>
Serve DC Connects - D.C.
<li>
Fargo Community Platform - Fargo, ND and Moorhead, MN
<li>
The Link - Jacksonville, FL
<li>
Lehigh Valley Community Platform - Allentown and Bethlehem, PA
<li>
The Midlands Community Platform - Nebraska and western Iowa
<li>
SHARE New Mexico, New Mexico
<li>
The Sarasota Community Platform - Sarasota, FL
<li>
Central Susquehanna Valley Community Platform - Central Pennsylvania
<li>
LINCC - Louisiana Initiative for Nonprofit and Community Collaboration
<li>
LAMP The Lutheran Asset Mapping Project

Other Ways You Can Help

    There are still ways to contribute even if you are unable to make a gift:

• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about Community Platform.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

• Volunteer for a local organization through Community Connection.

    • A community-level movement must occur to address community problems, fight poverty, improve education, and reach our city’s potential. But before we achieve movement, we need to know how to move. Community Platform is designed to show us exactly that. 

    So let's get moving!

We're back! And closer to opening than ever! 

We have found the purrfect premise for our furry friends! 375 Queen Street, Melbourne 3000, is a stunning heritage listed building next to the Queen Victoria Market. The cafe will be on the ground floor, and the cats will have the entire first floor all to themselves, including five rooms, a hallway, and a large staircase to play and lounge around in. With the love that you and other visitors will lavish on the cats, we have no doubt this premise will be the purrfect home for our rescue shelter kitties. However, the premise does need a bit of TLC and care during the refurbishment and this is why we are reaching out with one last campaign to assist us in covering renovation costs.

We will keep you in the loop as the refurbishments progress, and more importantly, we can share the experience of finding the purrfect fur-friends once the cat areas are refurbished! We still hope to be opening in July, and as we get through each stage of refurbishment and Council applications we will let you know a more accurate opening date.

Our last campaign received a lot of interest and publicity. We were featured on Channel 9's Today Show, had articles in The Age, the Herald Sun, online Frankie Magazine, and several more website blogs, and we were interviewed on 3AW and 2ser's radio stations. With the cat cafe's opening imminent we hope to increase awareness of this campaign and with your help we can all contribute to Australia's first cat cafe's refurbishment and forthcoming opening.   

Thank you again for all your continuing support and a special thanks to those who have contributed. Please continue to help by spreading the word. We hope to see you soon at Cat Cafe Melbourne! 

For those of you unaware of what a cat cafe is, here's more information:
column5: >Cat Cafe Melbourne will offer a whole new social environment never before experienced in Australia. We will provide a fun, comfortable, and most importantly, kitty filled space for you to relax and play with several lovely cats from rescue shelters. It is very important to us that our cats will be from animal rescue shelters and we will also be raising money at our Cat Cafe to donate to local shelters. The cats will live at the premises, therefore they will have everything they could possibly ever need right at their paw-tips.
column9: >ing premises to the tailored needs of several kitties does not come cheap and we do not want to spare any expense in providing the best environment for our resident rescue cats. We need your help to spread the word and raise awareness of this project (and offer you some awesome perks along the way!).
column11: >Cat Cafes are becoming known worldwide, the first opening in Taiwan in 1998, and since spreading to Japan, Vienna, Russia, Germany, China, Thailand, the UK, France, and more! The success of Cat Cafes is due to several reasons, the main one being that cats are awesome. In city centres it can be difficult to rent a flat that allows animals, and owning an animal for its entire life is a big responsibility and costly, therefore Cat Cafes are a great solution to these problems. It has also been proven that interacting with cats can lower high blood pressure, stress, and anxiety.
column23:
/>

If your after any single items of Cat Cafe Melbourne merchandise, it is also available through our website www.catcafemelbourne.com

Meet your therapist

        Hello, my name is Shauna Wassmer. I am on my way to being a
first time business owner of a massage office called Me Time Massage Therapy! I
have been a therapist for 7 years
column2: I started while I was still a senior in high

column1: school. I am so thankful for my drive at a young age because massage therapy
has really help me grow in developing a
passion for a healthy lifestyle for myself and those around me
me see people in a light of understanding and compassion

career that has an energy that promotes wellbeing and relaxation.

     My campaign is to help me start off my office with power so that I may give everything my clients deserve to have an amazing session and that I can run my business the right way from the start.

     Your contribution will help me immensely! It is vital to me that I have all the proper equipment and everything on my business side working at the top level because that I how I conduct my services.

What I Need &
column2:
What You Get

I am looking to raise $1500. That money will be going to buy:

                  For massage use- essential oils, towels, sheets, face cradles, bamboo heating pad, more bamboo tools, hot stones, hot stone heater, massage oils, antifugal spray, product for various services, prenatal pillow, pillow cases, figure body wraps.

                 For the office-advertising, website, quickbooks, shelves, rug, bathroom essentials, paper, ink, business cards, a sign for my office.

                               

Other Ways You Can Help

           Letting your friends know about my business is a great way you can help! If you could share with the people around you that I am opening an office and suggest they give it a try, it would help me out so much. Let them know that I will be using and selling 100% pure essential oils that have a multitude of uses from relaxation to joint pain relief and so much more. I have a unique bamboo massage called mu xing which is great for deep tissues or runners who like to have their legs stripped out or even just a relaxing massage. With a request, couples massages can be arranged. Massage can be great for kids too, especially athletes!

My name is Daniela and ever since I was a little girl I wanted to open an Italian Restaurant.  This is my chance! 

I was born and raised in Southern Italy, with a passion of cooking and sharing my heritage with the world.

I chose to name my restaurant Mamma Rosa to honor my grandmother Rosa.

Mamma Rosa is an Italian Restaurant that is coming to the
Historical Kerr Building in Downtown Coldwater in early 2015.  I am very excited
to be opening the doors to my restaurant!  Here is a little more about why Mamma Rosa is
the chosen name.
Many have asked me why I have chosen Mamma Rosa as the name
for my restaurant.  Rosa was my
grandmother (or Nonna in Italian).
Nonna Rosa’s house was a barn remodeled into a home. It was
rustic and very old, but it was also very welcoming and cozy.
I spent many days there throughout the year and most of my
summers.  Nonna Rosa always made the
grandchildren fresh bread, with fresh olive oil from the fields we owned.  I loved spending time with her.
It was in that beautiful space, at my grandmother’s side,
that I learned how to make sauce and fresh pasta from scratch and how to be a
good host. There wasn’t a person who was walking by Nonna’s, that didn’t get invited in for a
fresh bevanda (drink) and a bowl of pasta.
That was my grandma. She enjoyed cooking, and most of all she enjoyed sharing her delicious meals with everyone
who crossed her path.
Mamma Rosa passed away shortly after I moved to the United
States. I remember those
warm Italian summers spend with her, and I cherish the memories of Nonna
standing in her kitchen teaching me about
good food and how to cook.  It has
been a dream of mine to someday open my restaurant doors and share her
delicious recipes.
I want to create for patrons of Mamma Rosa’s that cozy,
rustic environment and that
sense of being home and to share the
wonderful flavors that only fresh ingredients can bring to the dining
experience.
I want to share what my grandmother gave to me.
Welcome to Mamma Rosa's Ristorante---a warm, welcoming place to relax and

have some good food with good friends! I hope you enjoy spending time with us!

In order to launch the restaurant I need to find $150,000 in capital to help.  I am planning on finding loans through the Small Business Administration, but could use some help!

Why should you help me?  If you love food, if you want to see people enjoy fresh ingredients, healthy foods, and most importantly if you share my values of bringing freshness and a wholesome experience to patrons, then you should help me bring a restaurant to Coldwater!

I have been working in the restaurant setting since I was 16  years old. Cooking and being with people is my passion!  I can't think of anything better than this wonderful opportunity!

I want to share my passion with my team. I hope to find great people that will work with me and that will help me give the customers that awesome experience!

If you can't contribute, please help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!

Grazie mille

Daniela

e-mail me at mammarosa2014@gmail.com for any questions!

I have been working in the restaurant setting since I was 16  years old. Cooking and being with people is my passion!  I can't think of anything better than this wonderful opportunity! I want to share my passion with my team. I hope to find great people that will work with me and that will help me give the customers that awesome experience!If you can't contribute, please help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!Grazie milleDanielae-mail me at mammarosa2014@gmail.com for any questions!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

How will this book project get done?

column1: Shoot +
Develop + Process + Lab Print + Edit + Edit again + Scan + Design +Text +
Layout + Edit one last time = PRINT

What will the funding support?

From this
successful INDIEGOGO campaign, the money received will pay for lab
processing, prints, and professional high resolution scans. The funds will also cover the payment fees to the
designer, writers, photo editors and the copy editor. And most significantly,
the donations will complete the final stage and cost of printing and publishing the first edition of Block Party – Soul of Summer.
I hope that while looking
at these photos, it brings back memories for all people. I hope that people are excited to see their
block represented and that it inspires others to have their own Block Party. I
am really proud of this series because it captures a quintessential New York
phenomenon in a way that can be shared with the world.
I am incredibly
lucky to have visited so many parties, and I think that through these photos
you will see how special the New York block has become.
I want to dedicate this book to the city of New York
for all it has given to me
column2: to the people on all the blocks I visited who

column1: allowed me to share their space. And last but not least, everyone who has been
following my career throughout the years.

Thank you


","What is Block Party - Soul of Summer book project about?

Block parties are the heart and soul of New York City summers. I have been documenting this great NYC tradition since 2005, capturing over 200 block parties in all of their revelry.  I traveled to every borough with a quest and a camera, capturing the interaction between the youth and the elderly, dominos and cards, open fire hydrants and the infamous NYC grill.
The goal of my project is to self-publish Block Party - Soul of Summer. Currently, there are no books documenting the history of NYC block parties
column2: there is a need for this work to be shared. Importantly, Block Party - Soul of Summer celebrates New Yorkers across race and class, sharing regional pride from different neighborhoods.

Who we are..

99 Issues Comics is a locally owned comic shop trying to provide a service to the lower Alabama area. We are a place for artists to come and showcase themselves to the Mobile and Baldwin County market. We are a store but we are trying to be more than that. 99 Issues is a strong supporter of artists/writers/creators of all genres. 99 Issues has created a place for people to come and meet all of their
favorite artist. Legendary artist have flown from New York and driven
from Dallas just to hang out with customers at the shop. We have built a
name for ourselves in the comic industry in just ONE YEAR. Imagine what

we could do with your support. We are trying to launch careers by selling local and independent books. We have events for these locals and veterans to showcase themselves and their talent on a broader scale. But... we are out of room. 99 Issues loses money every time we throw an event. So we can not afford to expand to the necessary size to continue these events without your help. We do the events for the artist and the community so now we need just a little bit of help so that we can continue to do them.

What We Need &

• All funds raised will completely go towards expansion. We are trying to raise $5,000 which is half of what we need to move forward. We are not asking that you guys pay for everything.. just enough to put us at our goal.

• If we are able to raise the money needed, we can continue to grow our events in the Mobile area. We will have the space needed to showcase more local talent as well as bring in more known names and creators.

The Impact

  • Expansion would provide the outlet for local artist to mingle and meet more
established veteran comic creators and maybe make a connection that

could launch their artistic careers.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Just help by letting others know about us and what we are trying to do.

Thank you.

Hi Friends!
<li><div style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Arial, sans-serif !important
column8:
>My name is Rae, and as many of you know I have my own handmade crystal jewelry company called Sea of Possibility. This has been a lifelong dream of mine, and I finally started it a year and a half ago. I have an Etsy shop and I also vend at festivals and events. I am so grateful for the way this business has grown, and really excited to continue on this path!
  • The purpose of this campaign is to provide the financial support necessary for me to get all of the supplies I need for the coming year at the Springfield Gem and Mineral Show this August 8th-10th. This is the only gem show with a wholesale area that I have access to and it only happens one weekend a year.

column1: • With this financial support I will be able to pick out all the best crystals and beads from a wide range of options. I'll be able to stock up on essentials and find unique pieces. This one trip will supply me for a whole year of making new and exciting jewelry for you all to wear. This is especially essential at this point in my business where I feel a lot of momentum building. I want to be able to rise to demands, keep growing my stock, and fulfill the wants of my customers.
What I Need &

• With $555 I will be able to buy a variety of drilled quartz points, brass mini deity statues, many different types of stone beads, chain, wire, jewelry boxes, and cabochons. I will be able to buy higher quality materials so that I can create higher quality products for you all! A small portion of the money will also go towards the entrance fee to the gem show, which is $6 a day. Any money that I have left over will go towards vending fees for festivals and events that are coming up in the fall. This is a flexible funding campaign, so if I don't reach my goal I will still go to the gem show and see what I can get with what I've been able to raise.

• To show my gratitude for your support I'm offering some really exciting perks! Multiple levels of discounts on jewelry, tarot readings, reiki sessions, and custom made artwork! You can find out more information about tarot readings and reiki sessions on my website. I'm especially excited to offer a limited number of Spiritweb paintings!
<span class=""Apple-style-span"" style=""font-size: 24px

• I create all of my jewelry with loving intention and I provide people with metaphysical information about the crystals in each piece. It has been an immensely gratifying experience to watch people in my community and worldwide using the jewelry that I create for adornment, crystal healing, and sacred ritual wear. It is my greatest honor to be able to make a sacred healing tool that will be worn and cherished for years to come.
  • I feel my business taking off in truly exciting ways right now! Over the past few months my production levels have increased, my etsy sales have increased, and I have been presented with more opportunities to vend my work. I have made sales in 5 different countries and fulfilled many custom orders. I continue to add new jewelry styles to my stock and am constantly picking up new skills.
  • With the funds to replenish my supplies at the gem show, I will truly be able to continue growing my business and make a positive impact on the world while doing something I love.

Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you're unable to contribute financially at this time, you can still get involved!

• You can share this campaign on social media sites with the Indiegogo share buttons.
  • You can share Sea of Possibility on Etsy with anyone who you think may be interested.

Thank you so much for you time and support!!

In love and gratitude,

Rae Maltz (a.k.a. Raenbow Dandelion)

""Green"" Wine Tours in Sonoma and Napa
The mission of Obsidian Wine Tours is to connect wine lovers and vintners with a shared passion for the land, stewardship, and equity
column2: provide accurate information about sustainability and natural, organic, and biodynamic grape growing and winemaking
column3: and of course, to share distinctive wines.

column1: Who, Why and What
<div>
Obsidian Wine Tours is the brainchild of Anna Brittain, a Napa Valley native.
The only child of a single mother, Anna worked hard to secure a scholarship to Williams College in Massachusetts where she graduated with a double major in Political Science &
column2: Environmental Studies. She then spent a decade doing environmental management and policy work on every level from local to international, including climate policy in Vietnam and Switzerland, as well as four years working in the U.S. with ViewCraft  as a sustainability consultant for wineries and state and regional wine organizations.

column1: In 2011, Anna received her Master of Environmental Science and Management from the Bren School at UC Santa Barbara. And most recently, managed the Center for the Management of Ecological Wealth at the environmental economics think tank Resources for the Future in Washington, DC.

After realizing that she wanted to leave the world of policy making and become more personally involved in her field of expertise, Anna made a bold decision. She returned to the Napa Valley to develop a business that would actively capitalize on her unique knowledge of sustainability within the wine industry, build relationships with progressive wine leaders, and directly educate people one “green” wine tour at a time!
At this juncture, Anna is poised to tap a growing market niche but she genuinely needs your help to make it happen!!
<div><span style=""background-color: initial
<div>

column3: >This isn't just a chauffeur service
column6: >Anna serves as a local friend and guide who engages guests in a dialogue about what the heck it means for a wine to be sustainable, natural, organic, biodynamic, and everything in between.
column7: >Obsidian Wine Tours
column8: > gets visitors past the commercial veneer and off the beaten track to meet artisan winegrowers and winemakers and have down-to-earth conversations about making wines that are truly an expression of place.

column1: <div style=""text-align: center
<blockquote>

I want to introduce visitors to the heart and soul of wine country – to smaller-scale producers and family farmers who make stunning wines using a holistic approach, investing in healthy soils and a diverse environment.
Obsidian Wine Tours will be unique in three ways:
<div>
<ul>
<li>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >First, no one else in this region is offering

column1: tour with an environmental specialist visiting progressive vineyards and wineries.
<li>
<span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif

column7: >– she's actually joining visitors throughout
column9: > the day to help answers questions

column1: and participate in discussions.
<li>
<span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
column3: >And third, Anna can provide a picnic lunch

column1: and other producers! She can even make local food a part of the tour!

There is more and more evidence that consumers are interested in learning about and purchasing “green” wine. And there are quite a few meaningful sustainability certification programs for both vineyards and wineries. Here in California there is broad participation in state, regional, and local programs. But very few wineries are talking about the great things they're doing and helping consumers understand their motivations and how these conscientious practices can influence the wines.
Obsidian Wine Tours will help
address this disconnect by helping wineries be broader educators, making sure their employees and customers
know about their environmentally and socially progressive practices.

Your Contribution at Work

Anna needs to raise a minimum of $5,000. This crowdfunding support will fund several regulatory, networking, and marketing needs:
<ul>

• Anna has already invested over $2,000 in the unique charter party livery insurance necessary to secure the TCP-S permit from the California Public Utilities Commission, but she needs another $2,000 to fully fund this huge expense.
• Your support will also enable Anna to join three Chambers of Commerce - Napa, Sonoma, and Healdsburg - expanding the networking and marketing reach for Obsidian Wine Tours.

• Finally, your contribution will allow Anna to participate in the Napa Chamber of Commerce's Business Expo, the largest annual business expo in the Napa Valley, and the Napa Valley Grapegrower's Rootstock conference, building strategic relationships and foundational business for Obsidian Wine Tours!
<b style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Anna's ultimate goal is to raise $8,000
column3: >, making it possible for her to pursue broader networking and marketing during the critical business launch phase, including exhibiting at targeted Bay Area events (e.g. the Green Festival, Bioneers Summit Conference), and ensuring she can participate in the Unified Wine &
column4: Grape Symposium and Women of the Vine Global Symposium.

column1: The Perks of Getting on Board!
Anna has designed some great benefits for each level of support!
<div>
<ul><li>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Anna is a photographer and she will send you a selection of 10 wine country photographs to choose from, then send you a fabulous print! The premium metallic finish gives photos an amazing vibrance and saturation!

<ul><li>
<span style=""background-color: initial

column3: Sonoma,"" and choose a bamboo or organic cotton
column4: >Obsidian Wine Tours

column1: <div>
<ul>
<li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2:
>

Or you can up your contribution to $400, get the above benefits, AND come on an Obsidian Wine tour!! Have friends or family who might join you? Consider the $600 or $800 contribution levels! Anna will definitely be a new friend by the end of the day!

column1: • For the ultimate custom green wine experience go for the Salmanazar Level (Salmanazar refers to a 9.0L bottle of wine - equivalent to 12 standard 750 mL bottles or a case of wine!). Anna will curate TWELVE spectacular bottles of wine based on your preferences and travel to you to provide a personal wine tasting soiree for you and up to 14 guests! Have a birthday or other special occasion coming up? This will be an AMAZING party!!
Challenges &
column2:
Risks

The biggest challenge right now is to identify the best ways to get the word out and market Obsidian Wine Tours to potential visitors. Obsidian Wine Tours is preparing a press release for regional media and press organizations, tourism bureaus, chambers, and vintner and grape grower associations. We'll be meeting with concierges, particularly at ""eco"" resorts such as Solage, Bardessono, and Auberge du Soleil, to introduce our services and offer an incentive for recommending Obsidian Wine Tours to their guests. We believe Bay Area day-trippers offer a promising market so we'll be expanding our reach through events in Marin, Oakland, and San Francisco. We are also investing in social marketing through Facebook and Twitter.

column1: Obsidian Wine Tours is extremely fortunate to have the support of Marie Gewirtz of Marie Gewirtz Public Relations, who has more than 30 years of experience in wine industry marketing and PR!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute your hard-earned dollars that doesn't mean you can't help!

• Please SHARE this campaign with anyone in your network you think may be interested!
  • Please LIKE us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/obsidiantours) and Follow us on Twitter (https://twitter.com/ObsidianTours), and recommend your friends do the same!
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! And now, let the wild rumpus start!
","""Green"" Wine Tours in Sonoma and Napa
The mission of Obsidian Wine Tours is to connect wine lovers and vintners with a shared passion for the land, stewardship, and equity
column2: provide accurate information about sustainability and natural, organic, and biodynamic grape growing and winemaking
column3: and of course, to share distinctive wines.

column1: Who, Why and What
Obsidian Wine Tours is the brainchild of Anna Brittain, a Napa Valley native.

The only child of a single mother, Anna worked hard to secure a scholarship to Williams College in Massachusetts where she graduated with a double major in Political Science & Environmental Studies. She then spent a decade doing environmental management and policy work on every level from local to international, including climate policy in Vietnam and Switzerland, as well as four years working in the U.S. with ViewCraft  as a sustainability consultant for wineries and state and regional wine organizations.

In 2011, Anna received her Master of Environmental Science and Management from the Bren School at UC Santa Barbara. And most recently, managed the Center for the Management of Ecological Wealth at the environmental economics think tank Resources for the Future in Washington, DC.

After realizing that she wanted to leave the world of policy making and become more personally involved in her field of expertise, Anna made a bold decision. She returned to the Napa Valley to develop a business that would actively capitalize on her unique knowledge of sustainability within the wine industry, build relationships with progressive wine leaders, and directly educate people one “green” wine tour at a time!
At this juncture, Anna is poised to tap a growing market niche but she genuinely needs your help to make it happen!!

This isn't just a chauffeur service - Anna serves as a local friend and guide who engages guests in a dialogue about what the heck it means for a wine to be sustainable, natural, organic, biodynamic, and everything in between. Obsidian Wine Tours gets visitors past the commercial veneer and off the beaten track to meet artisan winegrowers and winemakers and have down-to-earth conversations about making wines that are truly an expression of place.

I want to introduce visitors to the heart and soul of wine country – to smaller-scale producers and family farmers who make stunning wines using a holistic approach, investing in healthy soils and a diverse environment.
Obsidian Wine Tours will be unique in three ways:
First, no one else in this region is offering this type of boutique
tour with an environmental specialist visiting progressive vineyards and wineries.
Second, Anna isn't just dropping people off – she's actually joining visitors throughout the day to help answers questions
and participate in discussions.
And third, Anna can provide a picnic lunch sourced from local farmers, cheesemakers,
and other producers! She can even make local food a part of the tour!

There is more and more evidence that consumers are interested in learning about and purchasing “green” wine. And there are quite a few meaningful sustainability certification programs for both vineyards and wineries. Here in California there is broad participation in state, regional, and local programs. But very few wineries are talking about the great things they're doing and helping consumers understand their motivations and how these conscientious practices can influence the wines.
Obsidian Wine Tours will help
address this disconnect by helping wineries be broader educators, making sure their employees and customers
know about their environmentally and socially progressive practices.
Your Contribution at Work Anna needs to raise a minimum of $5,000. This crowdfunding support will fund several regulatory, networking, and marketing needs:

Anna has already invested over $2,000 in the unique charter party livery insurance necessary to secure the TCP-S permit from the California Public Utilities Commission, but she needs another $2,000 to fully fund this huge expense.
Your support will also enable Anna to join three Chambers of Commerce - Napa, Sonoma, and Healdsburg - expanding the networking and marketing reach for Obsidian Wine Tours.

Finally, your contribution will allow Anna to participate in the Napa Chamber of Commerce's Business Expo, the largest annual business expo in the Napa Valley, and the Napa Valley Grapegrower's Rootstock conference, building strategic relationships and foundational business for Obsidian Wine Tours!

Anna's ultimate goal is to raise $8,000, making it possible for her to pursue broader networking and marketing during the critical business launch phase, including exhibiting at targeted Bay Area events (e.g. the Green Festival, Bioneers Summit Conference), and ensuring she can participate in the Unified Wine & Grape Symposium and Women of the Vine Global Symposium.
The Perks of Getting on Board!
Anna has designed some great benefits for each level of support!

Anna is a photographer and she will send you a selection of 10 wine country photographs to choose from, then send you a fabulous print! The premium metallic finish gives photos an amazing vibrance and saturation!

For contributions of $120 or more you can snag ""Anna's Insider Guide to Boutique Green Wineries with STELLAR Wines in Napa & Sonoma,"" and choose a bamboo or organic cotton Obsidian Wine Tours ""Wine S.N.O.B"" t-shirt or tote bag.

Or you can up your contribution to $400, get the above benefits, AND come on an Obsidian Wine tour!! Have friends or family who might join you? Consider the $600 or $800 contribution levels! Anna will definitely be a new friend by the end of the day!

For the ultimate custom green wine experience go for the Salmanazar Level (Salmanazar refers to a 9.0L bottle of wine - equivalent to 12 standard 750 mL bottles or a case of wine!). Anna will curate TWELVE spectacular bottles of wine based on your preferences and travel to you to provide a personal wine tasting soiree for you and up to 14 guests! Have a birthday or other special occasion coming up? This will be an AMAZING party!!

Challenges & Risks The biggest challenge right now is to identify the best ways to get the word out and market Obsidian Wine Tours to potential visitors. Obsidian Wine Tours is preparing a press release for regional media and press organizations, tourism bureaus, chambers, and vintner and grape grower associations. We'll be meeting with concierges, particularly at ""eco"" resorts such as Solage, Bardessono, and Auberge du Soleil, to introduce our services and offer an incentive for recommending Obsidian Wine Tours to their guests. We believe Bay Area day-trippers offer a promising market so we'll be expanding our reach through events in Marin, Oakland, and San Francisco. We are also investing in social marketing through Facebook and Twitter.
Obsidian Wine Tours is extremely fortunate to have the support of Marie Gewirtz of Marie Gewirtz Public Relations, who has more than 30 years of experience in wine industry marketing and PR!
Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't contribute your hard-earned dollars that doesn't mean you can't help!

Please SHARE this campaign with anyone in your network you think may be interested! Please LIKE us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/obsidiantours) and Follow us on Twitter (https://twitter.com/ObsidianTours), and recommend your friends do the same!
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! And now, let the wild rumpus start!",6.0,0,"1 Campaign

Barnabas
Clothing Co. is a positive lifestyle brand
that gives a portion of each sale to The Living Room International in Kipkaren,
Kenya. Barnabas Clothing Co. encourages all of those who wear our clothes
to boldly live A Life Worth Imitating. We give a portion of all of our sales
to The Living Room because we think their staff embodies that statement. We
believe that everyone should use their lives to impact the world around them
for good. We here at Barnabas Clothing Co. are taking up our own challenge,
and traveling overseas to Kenya to serve the staff and community of the Living
Room.
