<tr>
<td colspan=""5"" height=""80"" valign=""top"" width=""553""><font color=""#666666"" size=""2"">Our
team consists of Founder/CEO/President, Alexander Aquino, Co-owner/Vice President
Julie Pocino, educators/writers, and a videographer. The members of our team
all have a heart to serve others and love working with kids, and they bring
their years of experience, passion, and excitement to give back to community.
</tr>
<tr>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan=""2"" height=""40"" valign=""top"" width=""455"">
<hr/>
</tr>
<tr>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan=""6"" height=""347"" valign=""top"" width=""556"">
The
Living Room International is a non-profit organization based in Western
Kenya that provides comprehensive care to those men, women and children living
with HIV/AIDS and other life threatening illnesses. They are a community that
honors life and offers hope and they do so by becoming family to those who are dying. The organization has a 26 bed inpatient hospice facility that allows
them to provide compassionate medical, emotional and spiritual support for
the patient in their final days of life. The environment and atmosphere is
that of a home - everyone is welcome, everyone is loved, and everyone belongs.
No one is left to face their pain or fears alone. Outside of the facility,
the staff also makes home visits, bringing critical care and compassion to
house-bound patients. In addition to hospice care, the Living Room is a training
institute on HIV/AIDS prevention and in collaboration with other organizations
provides education and resources to the surrounding community.
Barnabas
Clothing is inspired by the work the Living Room International organization
continues to do in Kenya. We see their compassion, their dedication, and their
commitment to hope, even in the face of suffering and death, as extraordinary.
They are truly modeling A Life Worth Imitating. The Barnabas team would
like to encourage the staff and share their story. Our time in Kenya will
be spent serving and helping the staff at The Living Room, as well as running
after school programs for the children in the community.
</tr>
<tr>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan=""10"" height=""434"" valign=""top"" width=""574"">
Backpacks
The community where The Living Room is located in Kipkaren, has a great deal
of children. Funds and supplies are much more limited there for children to
get the resources they need for school. We will be supplying each child we work
work with a backpack that contains all of the necessary school supplies for
a year of education.
Funds
to run activities
We will have to purchase the supplies for the after school activities that
we organize and run for the children in the Kipkaren community. Some of these
activities will be educational work, and others will be sports and games.
We would like to leave all resources and supplies there with the community
for the children to continue to use after we leave.
Funds
to help the Barnabas team travel to Kenya
Any funds that we raise above the cost of the backpacks and purchasing supplies
for children will go to help our team pay for travel expenses to get to Kenya,
as well as the extra fees associated with bringing the backpacks to the children.
All of our team members will be giving their own time and finances to travel
to Kenya. We are hoping to raise above and beyond our budget to help team
members pay for the expensive airfare and travel to Kenya, as well as give
extra funds to The Living Room.
</tr>

<td colspan=""12"" height=""1986"" rowspan=""2"" valign=""top"" width=""579"">

We have introduced community income in social apps
Over the past few years we have observed two frustrating trends related to social platforms on the internet:
• While many people make a living online (bloggers, paid forumers, etc.) those people who actually contribute the most to social platforms don't get paid. Nothing at all.
<li>Despite having many question &amp
column2: answer applications around people are still helpless in many situations.

column1:
To tackle both problems at the same time we have come up with the 'Ask a Stranger' mobile app.

Ask a Stranger users actually earn money for helping each other as quickly as possible when needed.

A fair share of the app revenues is distributed as COMMUNITY INCOME among the users, based on their social activity. The more one contributes to the community the higher his/her share of community income is. The revolution has started.

Help us building a large community and let’s participate in the community income together!

It's time to secure your share of the revenues

Help us expanding to more platforms and secure your share of the community income at the same time!

Our initial funding was only enough to make
column2:
mt=8"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">Ask a Stranger available for the iOS mobile platform. This naturally limits the number of people who can join the community.

By contributing to the development of the Android platform app you help to build the community which itself is a social activity to be rewarded. So we believe you deserve a fair share of the community income as well!

Therefore our PERKS enable you to receive community points (the basis of income distribution) upfront when the Android app is launched.

column1: <li>
HeadStarter: gives you fair starting point balance
<li>
Equalizer (limited availability): gives you the opportunity to get into the ring with the average point balance of all users
<li>
TopDog (limited availability): elevates you into the top league. Your starting point balance will be matched to the highest existing point balance of any single user in the iOS version of the app

In case of not reaching the entire goal, your perks will still be applicable, although only on the existing platforms.

Let us expand the community together

Creating
an Android app together will expand the reach of our platform

enormously. Help can arrive quicker and it can be more useful.

The
larger the community, the larger the community income, too. Active

helpers' rewards will rise and the platform becomes more valuable.

Ask
a Stranger can become the largest community with the goal of helping each
other. The place where questions and requests are not being ignored and

active help is rewarded.

Make noise about Ask a Stranger

There are a lot of ways you can help beyond providing funds:
<li>Join the helping community by downloading the app in its current iOS version <a href=""https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/ask-a-stranger/id796927226?ls=1&amp
• Share our link: askastrangerapp.com
• Share this campaign link or use Indiegogo's sharing tools
Make noise about Ask a Stranger!

column4: >*PERK NOTE: The $19 Perk entitled ""Monthly Subscription"" is not a subscription. If you choose this Perk you will receive one box in October (5 Snacks - all Gluten-Free) to try our service out. If you like the snacks and want to continue receiving them monthly, you can go to our website (currently under construction) and sign up for the monthly subscription. Thank you!!*

column1: Quiglees was founded
by three college friends who were passionate about active lifestyles, healthy
eating and loving life. We wanted to start a business that had a positive
impact on people's well-being while also making it enjoyable for both ourselves
and our subscribers. Six months ago we set up shop in one of our basements and
after months and months of sweat, tears and hard work, (it wasn’t too bad

there was a Foosball table) Quiglees was born.

How It Works
Quiglees is a snack
food subscription company where members will receive a box of healthy snacks

(non-GMO, low sodium, no trans fat, etc.) once a month, delivered right to their door. Here are just a couple of examples of our awesome snacks. Check out our image Gallery to see more information about health benefits, ingredients, and sample products.
column20:
/>


Why We Need Your Help

We are launching this

column1: campaign to raise funds for better snack options for all of our subscribers and
gauge interest. We are very passionate about living healthy and we want to know
if you are as well! All of the money raised from this campaign will go directly
back into the company. We want to provide better looking boxes, a wider variety
of snacks (we have about 100 vendors and 200+ snacks at the moment), and cooler
promotions for you the subscriber! Trust us, if it were up to us each box would
arrive at your doorstep accompanied by fireworks and fog, we just need the

funds.

Awesome Perks!
The Perks on this page
all contribute to this goal. You can simply sign up for our monthly
subscription (all the cool kids are doing it) or for just a small amount more
you can get one of the awesome bonuses listed with your first box! Even if we
don’t reach our goal, don’t worry, we aren’t going to take your funds and buy a
yacht leaving you empty handed. You will receive your first box whether we
reach our goal or not. There is no risk involved if you choose to contribute to
our campaign. You will get your first box to try and if you like it, you can

continue to receive boxes from Quiglees and we will become best friends!

Other Ways To Help

If you don’t have the
money to sign up for a subscription right now, no worries, there are other ways
you can help. Share this campaign link on your personal social sites, yell the
link out loud in a crowded train station, write it on the inside of a bathroom
stall*, there are endless ways you can spread the word about Quiglees!
(*Quiglees does not support or condone

public vandalism*)

Seriously...
All
joking aside, this is a lifelong dream of ours and something that we are so
close to realizing. We truly, from the bottom of our hearts, appreciate

anything you can do to help. Thanks!

*If you have any special allergy or dietary needs such as Gluten Free, Soy Free, Nut Free, etc. Please email us directly at contact@quiglees.com and we will be sure to take care of you.*

Short Summary

• Hello, We are SereniTEA Party . SereniTEA Party has been based in Atlanta for 4 years. SereniTea Party is a boutique event planning firm that specializes in tea service. Whether you are planing exclusive board luncheons or social receptions,let SereniTea Party provide you with pristine, white glove service. From the low-country coast to the Atlanta skyline, we bring a luxurious tea party to you!
  • Over the last couple of years we have notice a problem. Their have been on average 10 clients a year. That will not booked an event with our company solely, because we DO NOT have an event venue.  We find our selves at a growth crossroad where we MUST expand.
  • With your funds we will be able to open an event space, and multiply our profits. We can increase on our hospitality staffing. SereniTEA Party can also  broaden the onto more national events.
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get


  • SereniTEA Party is asking for $45,000 in funding. We need an event space that is a ""shell"". (Meaning little to no build out) Yet, we do need some equipment for a small kitchen. The event space would be based in Metro-Atlanta.

column1: PERKS
$1 Dollar Karma Love
There is a difference from 99 and 100. Every little bit helps!
$5 Virtual Thank You
Get a special note full of gratitude.
$10 Sticker!
Get our cool Pineapple-Pot logo!
$20 Cocktail plate
Our limited edition custom cocktail plate.
$75 Bone China Teapot
and many other GREAT perks!
If we do not raise all the funds we need we can still, expand on our hospitality staffing do more local advertising.

The Impact

As a small business we have meet with a lot of challenges. The only one we have not been able to conquer is major funding. The Banks. Financial institutions do not give out loans to business. SBA loans are also very hard to acquire. We need your support to take our company to the next level.
Other Ways You Can Help
• Give us a social media shout!! #SereniTEAcurrency

And that's all there is to it.

<h2><span style=""font-size: 1.17em
column2: >Everyone loves the Tesla Model S but not everyone can afford to buy one.  We want to give you a chance to drive your dream car!

column1: Step 1:  Contribute to lock in your permanent rental rate of $30 an hour plus the option to take the Model S for a spin!
Step 2:  Tell your friends!
Step 3:  After the campaign ends we will contact you to let you select the date and time of your first rental (if you contributed $100 or more)
Step 4:  Rent a Model S anytime you want!
Our plan is very straight forward - Raise money to help pay for a fleet of 2-5 Teslas. Then rent them out full time for personal or business use.
We plan to charge an hourly rate as apposed to a daily rate. We won't charge a per mile fee, and the renter does not have to worry about spending money on gas!
Inspiration -
<div>

We were inspired by the websites and businesses that allow people to rent out their cars by the hour while they normally would just be collecting dust. But when we searched in our area to rent a Tesla... we found ourselves completely out of luck.

In fact the closest Tesla Dealership is 4 hours away in Chicago. So we decided we needed to bring some Telsas closer to home and rent them out so everyone in our area can actually get their hands on a Model S. Whether you need it to run some errands, or for a weekend trip, or even just a short test drive, we want to make it happen!
<div>
<h3><span style=""font-size: 1.17em
column2: >I made a contribution, how soon can I drive the Model S?

column1: You will get to pick your rental dates in order based on the perk level you conributed to (highest to lowest) and the order in which everyone contributed (first to last). We will collect all the information in the proper order as soon as this campaign is over.

The indiegogo renting will start on January 1st (2014) with every single hour of the year available.  The cars will be open for renting to the public during any open spaces that weren't selected by our contributers.
<h2><span style=""font-size: 1.5em
column2: >For any contribution more than $1000 on this indiegogo campaign <span style=""text-decoration: underline
column3: >we will deliver the car to you for your rental period as long as you are within 8 hours of Ann Arbor Michigan!

We've successfully prototyped and tested the world's first implantable NFC

column3: > and sterilized in ethylene oxide gas. It is compatible with all NFC compliant devices such as mobile phones, tablets, etc. and can be used to launch URLs, share contact details, unlock phones, etc. The xNT is also ISO14443A compliant, so it can also be used with several types of commercial readers to unlock doors, start cars, log into computers, and more!

column1: Successful Prototypes

We've built and successfully tested 4 prototypes. Each of those prototypes have been implanted into Dangerous Things beta testers and are currently being used to unlock phones, open doors, and share contact details with friends.
<h1>What We Need &amp
Implantable technology like this appeals to a niche group of adventurous people
column2: electronics hobbyists, biohackers, grinders, etc. Some of the materials used to build these tiny devices (special antenna cores, die cut transponder ICs, etc.) require very large minimum order quantities from manufacturers. We have enough capital to secure most of these materials, but we need your help to fund the assembly and manufacturing process.
>We're looking to raise $8000 to top off production costs. With your support we can introduce the world's first NFC compliant RFID implant.

column1: The Perks Keep Coming

Part of the fun of having an implant like this is being able to use it in your daily life. We will continuously find and develop new devices, software, and services you can use your xNT implant with. Whenever possible, these projects will be open sourced, allowing the community to customize systems and build new solutions. Keep an eye on our Facebook page (you don't need a Facebook account) for up-to-date information: facebook.com/dangerousthings

column4: >Get the word out on tech blogs, hackerspace groups, etc. and help make noise about the campaign!

column1: Amal's RFID Implants

My first RFID implant was installed in my left hand by a cosmetic surgeon in March of 2005 using a scalpel. A couple months later, my family doctor (featured in the campaign video) used an pet chip injector assembly I'd sourced from a local veterinarian to implant a second, more advanced RFID tag into my right hand. I've used at least one of my implants almost every single day since then to do things like get into my house, unlock my car, and log into my computer.

Since then I've written a book called RFID Toys, answered questions on the rfidtoys.com reader forum, written guides on RFID security and safe implantation methods, and helped hundreds of people from around the world find glass tags that are safe to implant. About a year ago I decided to found Dangerous Things in order to provide safe equipment and safe procedure guides. Several months ago we started building a global partner network of professional body piercers and body modification artists in order to facilitate safe, professional installation.

I recently spoke at TEDxSFU about the role of Biohacking plays in the future of human evolution. I believe strongly that our bodies are our own, to do with what we want. I'm excited we're all taking this journey together.

The xNT NFC Implant

Let's produce the worlds first NFC compliant RFID implant, together! Near Field Communication or NFC specifications contain a set of standards which are applied to a specific set of RFID technologies, and it's taking the world by storm in the form of devices like mobile phones and tablets. We've successfully prototyped and tested the world's first implantable NFC technology - we call it the xNT.

The xNT is a 2mm x 12mm, fully NFC Type 2 compliant RFID tag encased in a cylindrical Schott 8625 bioglass ampule and sterilized in ethylene oxide gas. It is compatible with all NFC compliant devices such as mobile phones, tablets, etc. and can be used to launch URLs, share contact details, unlock phones, etc. The xNT is also ISO14443A compliant, so it can also be used with several types of commercial readers to unlock doors, start cars, log into computers, and more!
Successful Prototypes

We've built and successfully tested 4 prototypes. Each of those prototypes have been implanted into Dangerous Things beta testers and are currently being used to unlock phones, open doors, and share contact details with friends.
What We Need & Why
Implantable technology like this appeals to a niche group of adventurous people
column2: electronics hobbyists, biohackers, grinders, etc. Some of the materials used to build these tiny devices (special antenna cores, die cut transponder ICs, etc.) require very large minimum order quantities from manufacturers. We have enough capital to secure most of these materials, but we need your help to fund the assembly and manufacturing process.

Whenever possible, these projects will be open sourced, allowing the community to customize systems and build new solutions. Keep an eye on our Facebook page (you don't need a Facebook account) for up-to-date information: facebook.com/dangerousthings
Other Ways You Can Help

Amal's RFID Implants

My first RFID implant was installed in my left hand by a cosmetic surgeon in March of 2005 using a scalpel. A couple months later, my family doctor (featured in the campaign video) used an pet chip injector assembly I'd sourced from a local veterinarian to implant a second, more advanced RFID tag into my right hand. I've used at least one of my implants almost every single day since then to do things like get into my house, unlock my car, and log into my computer.

Since then I've written a book called RFID Toys, answered questions on the rfidtoys.com reader forum, written guides on RFID security and safe implantation methods, and helped hundreds of people from around the world find glass tags that are safe to implant. About a year ago I decided to found Dangerous Things in order to provide safe equipment and safe procedure guides. Several months ago we started building a global partner network of professional body piercers and body modification artists in order to facilitate safe, professional installation.

I recently spoke at TEDxSFU about the role of Biohacking plays in the future of human evolution. I believe strongly that our bodies are our own, to do with what we want. I'm excited we're all taking this journey together.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Seattle, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-xnt-implantable-nfc-chip/pica

Reginald Jackson-Hudson was a bright and ambitious 22 year old man that was a Chicago resident and graduate of Holy Trinity High School. He effortlessly gained many friends in grammar school and high school because of his selfless attitude and loving personality. Reginald's infectious smile lit up any room that he walked in. He touched the lives of his four siblings, his mother, girlfriend, aunts, uncles, cousins, friends, teachers, classmates, and all those whom he came in contact with. Reggie was very laid back, with a HUGE heart.

Although, our natural reaction tells us that he left this earth to soon, but as we know God makes no mistakes. The family is thankful that Reggie was a believer in Jesus Chist and that he has transitioned to be with the Lord our God in heaven.

We are asking that family, friends, and those who feel it in their heart to give be a financial blessing to the Jackson-Hudson family. We are asking for $10,000 that will cover his burial, funeral service, and memorial. We are very thankful for each and every donation that will help put Reggie to rest.
God Bless.
Below is the excerpt from the Chicago Tribune
http://my.chicagotribune.com/#section/-1/article/p2p-77751610/
A man was shot found to death in an alley in the West Garfield Park neighborhood Thursday night, police said.

Reginald Jackson, 22, was found shot in the 4400 block of West Adams Street about 7:45 p.m. After an autopsy today, the Cook County medical examinwr's office said the cause of death was a gunshot wound to the back.
Police were called to the scene to investigate a report of a person shot and found the man shot in the back in an alley, Alfaro said.

Police said officers nearby heard the gunfire and found the man dead. The man collapsed in an alley between Adams and Wilcox and five shell casings were found at the corner of Adams and Kilbourn, in the street.
The man was dead on the scene at an address in the 4400 block of West Wilcox, near Kilbourn Avenue, according to a Chicago Fire Department spokesman.

>Crowd Fund a political party that is not controlled by the ruinous illegal monopolies!  

America and the world have reached a dangerous time wherein government has been purchased by racketeering and special interest collusion. The Free Energy Party is the first People-Funded Political Party of its kind in the world.  Our Tripod platform is 1) Free Energy (energy from free sources like geothermal  and wave power are an example) to end war over oil and environmental destruction. 2) Cures for Disease (many proven cures are being suppressed by monopoly).  3) Organic Permaculture (help us save seeds and stop the GMO and poison company destruction of our environment).

 We are only trying to raise $100,000.00 to campaign across America.  Do you want a government of the Monopolies or a Government of the People? Let us put our money where our patriotism is and join together to bring these REAL issues to the political process.  The campaign consists of all volunteers and all donations will be used 100% for campaigning across the nation to offer America a third party option designed to bypass the monopolies and elect a people funded third party.
column6:
>How will candidates be selected?   Anyone willing to stand up for the above Tripod can run for President,  the final candidate to be selected at a National Convention.  In the thirties and forties and fifties Americans bragged that “anyone”  could grow up to be President yet the same Bushes and Clinton's have represented the Petrochemical Cartel in Washington for over thirty years.  It is time to reclaim the American Dream.  Several celebrities have also expressed interest! Our final candidate might be someone very famous that will rally the world behind our simple Tripod world improvement platform.

Join us today and return the power to the people with a decentralized grid making each homeowner the new power producers!

There are multiple technologies that will allow each homeowner to have a new business selling power back up grid eliminating the need for war over oil. This will return the wealth to the people and help stop the march toward perpetual war. By joining in together we can bring on the future that is being hidden from us. Welcome aboard the New Paradigm Shift Toward Abundance!

Sending Help
<div>

For a couple of years now I have been following several organizations in their global relief efforts with tsunami, earthquake, typhoon, and other natural disasters. It is devastating to watch these events take place and see the amount of destruction that can happen from a natural disaster.
What's more amazing is to see groups of selfless people come from around the world to help and respond to such events. They volunteer their time and efforts to rebuild these areas.
I believe I can go and help contribute. I am currently applying to volunteer for Project Cagayan de Oro and want to help families rebuild their homes.
<div>
Project Cagayan de Oro - Typhoon Washi
The island of Mindanao was hit by Typhoon Washi back in 2011. Several organizations have sent relief efforts to rebuild the nearly 50,000 homes that were destroyed.

The All Hands Volunteers organization have been on site since January 20, 2012 and have recently extended their relief efforts and have reopened applications for volunteers. You can get more details of the project here.
The Campaign

The fundraising campaign is to help support my travel expenses to get to the project site along with the necessary supplies needed. Donations after these expenses will all go towards additional equipment and supplies they will need in their efforts.
*update* I just received an email confirming my acceptance. I will be there from October 20th - November 9th!
Please help support my campaign and the people of Cagayan de Oro. I will represent you as we bring families back into their homes.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Please spread the word to other people that could help this campaign.
If you want to make a direct donation, you can go to their website. They are a wonderful organization.

Short Summary

Hi friends!!  Tis the season to love, give, and support others!! I am Lauren Azevedo of the YouTube channel LarynMichael. I am here to ask for your support in raising funds for the youth programs at the YWCA - Young Women's Christian Association! The YWCA offers amazing opportunities for our young people to learn, grow, and expand their knowledge in tech, leadership, economics, and so much more. When I was a kid, my mom frequently volunteered for the YWCA and their Women helping Women program and I always loved helping her out! It was a great feeling to know that we were helping other women get the wardrobe they needed for job interviews and to help them feel confident in their job search.

I grew up embracing the importance of recreation and having a creative outlet for myself - arts and crafts - while also focusing on my academic and leadership goals. With the PEARL program at the YWCA, youth are given the tools to achieve greatness and overcome obstacles they face in everyday life.
Here is some additional information about the programs they offer:
Prevention: provides youth with positive options to conflict and violence in their lives.

Empowerment: develops self-esteem and resiliency through active learning and exploration of cultural awareness, positive body image, financial literacy, technology awareness, career exploration, and college and employment preparation.

Academics: this component allows youth the opportunity to heighten academic interest and develop effective study skills through homework assistance, tutoring, academic enrichment and computer literacy.
Recreation: develops youth's social and recreational skills through performing arts, health and fitness, social clubs, hobbies and arts/crafts.
Leadership: provides opportunities to practice leadership in the promotion of community action and service, racial justice, gender equity, public policy, peer mediation, and the YW Youth Council.
Youth Services includes the following programs:
<ul><li>

Afterschool Program: We provide a safe haven and supervised environment for students during critical hours after school. The afterschool program is comprised of three major components: Academic Assistance, Enrichment, and Recreation. This free program is offered to all students enrolled in participating schools.
<ul><li>

Youth Club: Youth Services provides a variety of activities on school campuses in the area of Youth Violence Prevention. These include effective peer mediation training in the middle and high schools, contests and classroom work groups during Week Without Violence and throughout the school year, self defense classes and an annual Anti-Violence Conference for young girls.
<ul><li>
Techgyrls: Aimed at raising the interest, confidence and competence in technology, the Techgyrls program provides hands-on computer exploration to under-served girls.
<ul><li>
Girls, Women $: This economic empowerment program is designed to teach mothers and daughters economic literacy.
<ul><li>

GAB (Girls Advisory Board): This program is designed to encourage leadership development and community advocacy.Please help us help at-risk youth and their families thrive and achieve their goals and dreams!

What I Need &
column4: >I am seeking $5,000 to donate to the YWCA youth program.

column1: With your contribution, you are helping young people broaden their horizons and unlock their passions for greatness. We all deserve a safe place to grow and learn and this is exactly what you will be helping provide for them. Let's work together to ensure that no one gets left behind!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't donate at this time, please consider donating your time by mentoring or even volunteering at a YWCA center.
  • Please remember to share our campaign with your friends and family so they can get involved as well!

Greetings and thank you for checking out my campaign! My best friend and bandmate, Nicola, recently had her keys stolen while in a doctor's surgery, and then subsequently her car was then stolen from the shopping centre where the doctors are located. This is the second time within months that Nic has had personal items stolen from her. 

As much as this was devastating enough for Nic, she now has to use a large part of her savings which she had been saving for 2 years for a trip to the USA. Along with having to go through all the stress of filing a police report and trying to track down the car and offender/s, and raising an insurance claim. We all know how much of a pain in the arse these can be, am I right?

What We Need 

Basically, the money pledged for this cause is going directly to the insurance company to pay for the excess, and to replace some very personal items that were stolen along with the car, such as a GPS, clothes and expensive, hard to find footwear. $600 will cover the excess, with the other $400 to cover the GPS, clothes and footwear.

We're only really asking for a minimum pledge of $10 per person (about the price of  2 beers in a pub, not much :-P) or a maximum pledge of $20. But if you would like to pledge more, we would greatly appreciate it and our thanks will be shown. We don't care about incentives as we are not trying to lure you in to make you pay more, that is just wrong in this situation.
Other Ways You Can Help

I very much understand the fact that not all of you will be able to pledge money to this, but even just spreading the word for us and sharing this cause would be very much appreciated!

G-man

column23: >3/17 Update: We did it! Thank u all so much.  Time to get to work and make it real.  The revolution has begun! We still got time so spread the word. Amazing.  THANK YOU!
column32: >Welcome to LocoL. We're chefs Roy Choi (Kogi BBQ) and Daniel Patterson (Coi SF), and we want you to join us in tackling the fast food industry.

column1: <span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >LocoL is about real fast food made with the heart of a chef.  That's where we start.  And we're opening our first first two locations in

column1: We fundamentally believe that wholesomeness, deliciousness and affordability don't have to be mutually exclusive concepts in fast food.   We believe that fast food restaurants can truly empower the communities they currently underserve. We believe that the giant corporate force that feeds most of America has degraded from decades of suits maximizing profits.  We believe that chefs should feed America, and not suits.

In short, we're aiming to revolutionize the fast food industry as we know it in America.  It's going to be long, difficult and damn near impossible journey.  If that doesn't scare you, this is where we take the first step.
Welcome to the revolution.
<div style=""text-align: center

column2: >- Roy, Daniel, and The LocoL Crew

column2: >Our food system is broken.  And most of the damage is done in the form of fast food.

>The food world has never been more celebrated, and yet at the same time, we're feeding our children corrosive chemical waste.   Food science can be used for wonderful, creative, nutritious, delightful creations.  But put in the wrong hands, the same science can be used for wrong -- getting people psychologically and physically addicted to just the worst quality, terribly sourced, straight harmful food.

>This kind of fast food is the only viable options in the growing food desserts of America.  And it's not just a problem for the communities on the ""wrong"" side of the tracks.  Even some of the toniest suburbs of America are defined by their rows and rows of chain restaurants.

column2: >Bad food—the empty-calorie, industrial-farmed, processed-everything-Value-Meal-Family-Deal—hurts everyone, yet it’s the most ubiquitous restaurant option out there. It exacts a toll on the planet, including on the people who make and consume it. It is not actually cheap.

>We didn't eat like this just two generations ago.  Our grandparents' generation, they ate read food.  But now this is who we've become.  We've been brainwashed.  And our whole diet has become polluted.
>But it doesn't have to be this way...

column1: <h3 style=""text-align: center
<h3 style=""text-align: center
The LocoL Vision
<span style=""text-align: left

Our vision with LocoL is to create a fast food concept that's delicious, but do it with the heart of a chef.  As chefs, we're approaching it just like we would another restaurant - design, function, systems, fee and costs, organizations, sourcing, product, farmers, ingredients, recipes, training, all that stuff.  Then on the other side of it is being very aware of what fast food is and what it's become in America, and why it's so important, popular, and powerful. Not trying to throw all of those things away.

The inspiration for LocoL came from our previous cooking efforts.  Daniel started a non-profit, The Cooking Project, to offer free classes, teaching young people how to cook and the value of gathering around the table.  While volunteering and teaching people from the streets how to cook good food inexpensively, and the value of gathering around the table.  So many of the kids had subsisted their whole lives on processed food, and it was a revelation to see how positively they responded to real food that they made themselves.

Then he met Roy, co-founder of Kogi—food trucks that serve tasty, hard-to-categorize food.  As Kogi’s reputation and success grew, so did Roy’s drive to feed more people. He began opening brick and mortar places that improved their communities, like 3 Worlds Cafe, a fruit and juice bar in South Central.
They laid the foundation for a new fast food concept, and announced it to a cheering audience of fellow chefs last August at MAD4 Symposium.  Full video here:

column2: >People love a Big Mac, people love a Quarter Pounder, people love KFC and Church's and Popeye's. People love that. It doesn't help if we're going to just try to say, ""Don't eat any of that stuff.""

column1: We can sit here and blast all day long about fast food, but the fact is they're winning.

column2: >It would be ignorant and stupid of us to not acknowledge and understand all that. LocoL is a small bridge
column3: to use the familiar to our advantage to bridge us over to healthier, wholesome ways.

column1: We're just trying to take it back to basics. A lot of these fast food chains weren't evil before.  Somehow along the line as businesses grow, money and things start to change your decisions. Then before you know it, sometimes you don't know which way is up anymore. Our philosophy in this is to always know which way is up.  As chefs, we would never get to the point where we would be serving poison to people.

Maybe by creating our own business, we can exist side-by-side, so even if they won’t listen we can work as a competitor to make them listen. We can create real change, in this case by building a better business.
<h2 style=""text-align: center

As much as thoughtful articles, books, and speeches are important in shifting how we think, they are not going to solve the food problems we have in our country. Our government certainly won’t solve them either. We have to act if we want change. If we can open profitable restaurants that are inexpensive and serve delicious food made with real ingredients
column2: if we bring new options to places that currently lack quality food
column4: if we create an environment of warmth, generosity, and caring
column5: and if we value the people with less money just as much as the ones with plenty, we can make a difference.

column1: <h2 style=""text-align: center
LocoL Burger, Tartine Bun, and ""Chicken Nugs"" with Chef Daniel's awesome sauce.

We know that the cornerstone of the American fast food chain is the burger and the sandwich and the fried items. We're going to take a look at all of that and dissect it and then revisit it. So the first example of that is our burger. How do we take that burger and not make it a gourmet burger, make it a burger that feels, tastes, looks, smells, and sits in your hand just like a Quarter Pounder.
Chad Robertson of Tartine will help us bake the bread. Chad makes the best bread in America and for LocoL he'll make a bun that is soft and squishy just like the fast food bun.

We're taking each element and breaking it apart and asking ourselves, How can we find the price point, but challenge the status quo? The burger — cutting it with grains and the tofu — is finding a way because we don't have the power to get our meat at the same prices that these chains do yet.
There is one fast food tradition we're outright rejecting: NO SODAS!  We feel strongly about this.  Agua Frescas Por Vida!

FAQs

What are some other strategies for keeping food costs low and quality high?
It doesn't have to be all meat. We can't use the same method, so we have to be creative about it. How are we going to get it 99 cents, and if we can't do it by buying straight meat, then you know what, let's use grains and tofu and cut things. Let's use rice, let's figure those things out. That's kind of some of the strategy that we're using.

We aren't re-inventing the wheel. There are people out there doing great food in the fast food sector like Shake Shack. Chipotle has been doing their thing, In-N-Out. The main thing is even with a lot of those chains, their food is still not 99 cents and McDonald's is 99 cents. That's really the difference in what LocoL is. It's not trying to compete with Shake Shack and Chipotle or other kinds of semi-gourmet fast food chains.
How will the two chefs work together?
column4: >We're a duo, so it's one guy might do one thing, one guy might do another, but ultimately we're one being.
column8: >We just try to up-play everything we're good at. But then at the same time, bring it together as one thing.

column1: Roy is part of a street food revolution.  He is out there on the streets, cooking with people. He has a lot of bold flavors and knows how to create food that has an identity, an iconic voice. Daniel really trusts Roy to have a cultural finger on the nerve.

Daniel is extremely gifted and smart and well-versed in the sciences of cooking and the methodology of cooking.   Roy doesn't like to get bogged down with the business stuff too much. He just believes and considers himself a hippy in that way. Daniel knows business and so he's looking at those things. We fill in each other's blind spots.
Will you guys still fulfill the perks to backers if you don't reach your goal?
Of course!
Where and when do I tell you what size and items I want (and other fulfillment details)?  I didn't see it in the check out.

Good question.  Indiegogo doesn't allow us to get those items in the checkout flow.  So we will be sending an email with a link to fill out those questions once the campaign is over.  So please please please keep an eye out for that email when the campaign is done!
Why are you guys crowdfunding?

","We're open! Come say hi and browse our merch at --> www.welocol.com3/17 Update: We did it! Thank u all so much.  Time to get to work and make it real.  The revolution has begun! We still got time so spread the word. Amazing.  THANK YOU!___________________________________________________________________________Welcome to LocoL. We're chefs Roy Choi (Kogi BBQ) and Daniel Patterson (Coi SF), and we want you to join us in tackling the fast food industry.
LocoL is about real fast food made with the heart of a chef.  That's where we start.  And we're opening our first first two locations in LA Watts and San Francisco Tenderloin.

We fundamentally believe that wholesomeness, deliciousness and affordability don't have to be mutually exclusive concepts in fast food.   We believe that fast food restaurants can truly empower the communities they currently underserve. We believe that the giant corporate force that feeds most of America has degraded from decades of suits maximizing profits.  We believe that chefs should feed America, and not suits.

In short, we're aiming to revolutionize the fast food industry as we know it in America.  It's going to be long, difficult and damn near impossible journey.  If that doesn't scare you, this is where we take the first step.
Welcome to the revolution.
- Roy, Daniel, and The LocoL Crew
LocoL chefs from L to R: Chad Robertson (Tartine), Daniel Patterson (Coi), Roy Choi (Kogi BBQ), and Rene Redzepi (Noma, MAD Symposium)
Here's the Problem
Our food system is broken.  And most of the damage is done in the form of fast food.

The food world has never been more celebrated, and yet at the same time, we're feeding our children corrosive chemical waste.   Food science can be used for wonderful, creative, nutritious, delightful creations.  But put in the wrong hands, the same science can be used for wrong -- getting people psychologically and physically addicted to just the worst quality, terribly sourced, straight harmful food.

This kind of fast food is the only viable options in the growing food desserts of America.  And it's not just a problem for the communities on the ""wrong"" side of the tracks.  Even some of the toniest suburbs of America are defined by their rows and rows of chain restaurants.

Bad food—the empty-calorie, industrial-farmed, processed-everything-Value-Meal-Family-Deal—hurts everyone, yet it’s the most ubiquitous restaurant option out there. It exacts a toll on the planet, including on the people who make and consume it. It is not actually cheap.

We didn't eat like this just two generations ago.  Our grandparents' generation, they ate read food.  But now this is who we've become.  We've been brainwashed.  And our whole diet has become polluted.
But it doesn't have to be this way...
The LocoL Vision

Our vision with LocoL is to create a fast food concept that's delicious, but do it with the heart of a chef.  As chefs, we're approaching it just like we would another restaurant - design, function, systems, fee and costs, organizations, sourcing, product, farmers, ingredients, recipes, training, all that stuff.  Then on the other side of it is being very aware of what fast food is and what it's become in America, and why it's so important, popular, and powerful. Not trying to throw all of those things away.

The inspiration for LocoL came from our previous cooking efforts.  Daniel started a non-profit, The Cooking Project, to offer free classes, teaching young people how to cook and the value of gathering around the table.  While volunteering and teaching people from the streets how to cook good food inexpensively, and the value of gathering around the table.  So many of the kids had subsisted their whole lives on processed food, and it was a revelation to see how positively they responded to real food that they made themselves.

Then he met Roy, co-founder of Kogi—food trucks that serve tasty, hard-to-categorize food.  As Kogi’s reputation and success grew, so did Roy’s drive to feed more people. He began opening brick and mortar places that improved their communities, like 3 Worlds Cafe, a fruit and juice bar in South Central.
They laid the foundation for a new fast food concept, and announced it to a cheering audience of fellow chefs last August at MAD4 Symposium.  Full video here:
Tackling Fast Food
People love a Big Mac, people love a Quarter Pounder, people love KFC and Church's and Popeye's. People love that. It doesn't help if we're going to just try to say, ""Don't eat any of that stuff.""
We can sit here and blast all day long about fast food, but the fact is they're winning.
It would be ignorant and stupid of us to not acknowledge and understand all that. LocoL is a small bridge
column2: to use the familiar to our advantage to bridge us over to healthier, wholesome ways.

column1: We're just trying to take it back to basics. A lot of these fast food chains weren't evil before.  Somehow along the line as businesses grow, money and things start to change your decisions. Then before you know it, sometimes you don't know which way is up anymore. Our philosophy in this is to always know which way is up.  As chefs, we would never get to the point where we would be serving poison to people.

Maybe by creating our own business, we can exist side-by-side, so even if they won’t listen we can work as a competitor to make them listen. We can create real change, in this case by building a better business.
Why LocoL?

As much as thoughtful articles, books, and speeches are important in shifting how we think, they are not going to solve the food problems we have in our country. Our government certainly won’t solve them either. We have to act if we want change. If we can open profitable restaurants that are inexpensive and serve delicious food made with real ingredients

Choi and Daniel Patterson.
Roy is the co-founder and co-owner of Kogi BBQ trucks, Chego, 3 Worlds Café, Alibi Room, Sunny Spot, A-Frame, Pot, Line Hotel.
Daniel is the founder and owner of Daniel Patterson Group, including restaurants Coi, Alta, Plum, Plum Bar, and Haven.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a="""">My name is Chris Oduok and I am from Akwa Ibom state, one of the 36 states in Nigeria. I am very passionate about the plight of children in some parts of Africa who are falsely accused of witchcraft. These stigmatised children are beaten, tortured and maimed before being ostracised from their homes. Some of these kids are rescued (Thank God) by charitable organizations such as CRARN in Eket and given shelter while others roam the streets . However, the government of Akwa Ibom State of Nigeria felt that by exposing this ugly practices to the outside world, the ""state's image is being damaged"" and therefore has clampdown on the charity organizations that take care of these children, it also has driven  most funding sources away, thereby drying up funds for the up keep of these children. This has resulted in children roaming the streets and scavenging for food in trash bins and exposing themselves to child predators and pedafiles.  More than 450 children were rescued to the CRARN centre and almost 300 reunited with families after an exhaustive counselling session with a signed undertaking by the parents/caretakers to protect the children.

Bacause these abuses are still going on, we are determined more than ever to do whatever we can to continue the rescue and protection of these children from both thier ill informed parents/caretakers and the government. Most people harm their children out of ignorance by believing that children are the source of their bad omen through witchcraft. Our desire is to carry out advocacy and enlightenment campaign in the communities to get the people educated enough to understand that children are not witches and can/will not harm them or any individual through the use of spiritual or magical powers. Advocacy and enlightenment campaigns will be done on a weekly basis, including monthly townhall meetings, to dissuade parents and family members from ostracising or torturing their children through exocism or whatever guise.

UNICEF reported that there are about 10,000 children accused of witchcraft in Akwa Ibom alone, while UK channel 4 TV reports that more than 15,000 child witch stigmatized children exist in Cross River and Akwa Ibom States combined. With poor quality of education, the number of stigmatized children is growing. There are mushroom underground shelters scharttered all over the state without adequate support for  the rescued children, we would like to support these shelters through your support. CRARN shelter has a functional borehole provided by the Latter Day-Saints Charities, a multipurpose complex which comprises of the girls hostel, dinning room, counselling area and a mini kitchen provided by UNICEF and Zenith Bank. A hostel for the boys and play ground is also available. All these structures are crumbling if they are not continously maintained, your support will make a difference in maitaining this shelter as well.

There is an urgent need to rush several items in support of these children, with just 67 cents a day or $20 a month for each child, we can vigorously address the different issues involve in the child witch saga and save these children from being falsely accused, tortured and even killed. <div>
Short Summary

My name is Bradley Findeis. I'm 24 years old. Recently I've been applying for jobs and realized how horrible it is and how painful the process is. What I've done is thought of a killer good idea that will allow anyone and everyone to apply for jobs online in a more effective and enjoyable way.

Resumateme.com is going to be the go to website to get job applications done faster and more effective. If you have applied for jobs lately you know what I'm talking about. You have roughly 75 fields (i.e. work history, references, education, personal information, etc....) that are the exact information the previous application asked for. By the time you finish all that boring information you hardly have the patience to write a good cover letter, which is your key to at least getting an interview.

What resumateme.com would do would be to store your resume on your profile and allow you to click and drag the correct information into the correct field on your application. This would save you oodles of time and frustration. Doing this will allow the person to focus on what matters most, their cover letter.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

We need roughly $550.00 to get all the web development done. Anything helps! I would really like to just simply get a functioning version up and running. By doing so I'll be able to collect a lot of consumer data and be able to change and tweak it exactly how you want it to work. All I need is the funding to get my idea off the ground and into the world.
Anything helps! If you can't put down some big bucks no worries, a dollar will end up helping me out a ton to get this project off the ground and helping people everywhere apply for jobs.
<div>
The Impact
The way economists view unemployment is
column2: anyone who is actively seeking a job. That means that there are people in this world who are NOT actively seeking jobs. Economists call those people ""discouraged workers.""

column1: Unfortunately there are a lot of discouraged workers and unemployed in the world. I'm not saying that the application process is why there are so many discouraged workers or unemployed but, what I am saying is that if the process was easier, faster, and more efficient, maybe we can help bring that number down.
This isn't just a product i think would be useful and I could make money on. This is something I would love to use. That being said i think it would be very beneficial for anyone to use as well.

My name is Bradley Findeis. I'm 24 years old. Recently I've been applying for jobs and realized how horrible it is and how painful the process is. What I've done is thought of a killer good idea that will allow anyone and everyone to apply for jobs online in a more effective and enjoyable way.

Resumateme.com is going to be the go to website to get job applications done faster and more effective. If you have applied for jobs lately you know what I'm talking about. You have roughly 75 fields (i.e. work history, references, education, personal information, etc....) that are the exact information the previous application asked for. By the time you finish all that boring information you hardly have the patience to write a good cover letter, which is your key to at least getting an interview.

What resumateme.com would do would be to store your resume on your profile and allow you to click and drag the correct information into the correct field on your application. This would save you oodles of time and frustration. Doing this will allow the person to focus on what matters most, their cover letter.
What We Need & What You Get

We need roughly $550.00 to get all the web development done. Anything helps! I would really like to just simply get a functioning version up and running. By doing so I'll be able to collect a lot of consumer data and be able to change and tweak it exactly how you want it to work. All I need is the funding to get my idea off the ground and into the world.
Anything helps! If you can't put down some big bucks no worries, a dollar will end up helping me out a ton to get this project off the ground and helping people everywhere apply for jobs.
The Impact
The way economists view unemployment is
column2: anyone who is actively seeking a job. That means that there are people in this world who are NOT actively seeking jobs. Economists call those people ""discouraged workers.""

column1: Unfortunately there are a lot of discouraged workers and unemployed in the world. I'm not saying that the application process is why there are so many discouraged workers or unemployed but, what I am saying is that if the process was easier, faster, and more efficient, maybe we can help bring that number down.

This isn't just a product i think would be useful and I could make money on. This is something I would love to use. That being said i think it would be very beneficial for anyone to use as well.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","alpine, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/resumateme-com/pica

Blue Camp help volunteers.

We are helping volunteers around world. There are so many volunteers and many private organizations in the world. They had to relief works, to volunteer works and to guarantee the rule of law and better protect the rights of the people. Most of them are unnamed volunteers and private organizations. So they have no chance to call for help. Because they are tired of this work already.

Blue Camp look for them and active support to them. 


 

North Korean Refugee

North Korea is an impoverished nation and most closed countries. Many North Korean escape to other country looking for bread and freedom. But it’s no easy. Besides the fact that it isn't an easy journey, most nations don't guarantee refugee status. Now, there are 100,000 people stay in near countries. All of them are illegal foreigners. But also their’s children are 50,000 with them. All defectors from any oppressed nation have the right to be protected under Universal Human Rights. And citizens and world leaders have an obligation to protect the human rights of everyone on Earth. But nobody protect defectors. They have no citizenship now. If they were arrested, they have should enforced repatriation to North Korea. Once returned, defectors face harsh punishment. The world report said the first group faced the capital punishement after being caught by the North Korean authorities after trying to flee concentration camps where people who escaped the country but later repatriated by China were detained. The dictator also ordered escapees shot to death on the spot last summer.

China has long maintained it has handled the defectors according to the domestic and international laws as well as humanitarian principles, but the defectors' testimonies show otherwise. Even acknowledging the special relationship between Beijing and Pyongyang, the time has long passed for the Chinese government to treat these virtual refugees as such. And many nations also urged the North`s neighboring countries not to forcefully repatriate escapees from the impoverished communist state. Many of the defectors in China face punishment or even death in the North's prison camps following deportation. Seoul should strengthen diplomacy with foreign countries in order to prevent their deportation. Such countries as Thailand, Vietnam and Mongolia are also routes that defectors use before moving to the South.
column4:
>

How North Korean escapees lived

They secretly live in neighboring countries. The women are forced to marry Chinese. But they are just kids laying machine. Among them, men are shackled and exploited in forced labor on opium poppy fields, while women are forced to work at local restaurants and unlicensed liquor factories and are used as prostitutes for locals and Chinese. Defectors are mostly poor people who have survived life threatening conditions. ""We were slaves, or worse than that, treated like animals,"" said a defector describing her life in hiding in China, marked by the exploitation of labor, sexual abuses and human trafficking. Those who came here via other third countries also looked back on subhuman conditions in detention camps where they couldn't use toilets after dark or even had to ‘buy’ sitting space."" 



A Korean human rights activists

Let me introduce you to a Korean. He is a protestant pastor and he is a human rights activist. He also worked hard to help other North Korean escapees. He exile help more than 2,600 North Korean escapees for 8 years. He got arrested for helping North Korean in China. He forgo in prison for 5 years. He was tortured with water and electronic shocks for 3 months. He have become disabled after torture. He cannot use his legs and has to sit on a wheelchair all the time. He still working for North Korean Refugees although he is handicapped.

He run a few refugee camps in neighboring countries for North Korean refugees. Scores of refugee camps have been established in neighboring countries like neighboring countries, but the conditions of the camps are very poor. There is very poor and they are starving. Words alone do not convey the untold misery endured by people in these refugee camps.


Above all, let's help defectors adapt to new life. Other countries should try to help the refugees in any way possible. And not every refugee will be a burden to society. By guaranteeing refugee status to fleeing North Koreans, it may help save many lives.

 

Blue Camp is waiting for your hands. Blue camp help them for bread and bed first.

column1:
Blue Camp is waiting for your little hands. It’s our big pleasure.
Thank you.

Girls on the Run Capital Region

We are starting a local chapter of this international organization that inspires young girls to be joyful and healthy. The games and activities help 3rd through 8th grade girls get a better understanding of who they are and what's important to them. We look at the role of teams and healthy relationships. And, we explore how girls can positively connect with and shape the world through a community service project.

The program includes:

• Our 24-lesson curriculum teaching life skills through group processing, running games and workouts. The three-part curriculum is taught by certified Girls on the Run coaches and includes understanding ourselves, valuing teamwork and understanding how we connect with and shape the world at large.
• Teams consist of 15 girls and each team is led by at least 2 trained coaches.
<li>
Power Through Service: The teams also design and conduct a community service project.
• At each season's conclusion, the girls complete a 5k running event as a group (and celebrate!)

At Girls on the Run, running is not just a metaphor. We use this activity to inspire and motivate girls, encourage lifelong health and fitness, and build confidence through accomplishment. At each season's conclusion, the girls and their adult running buddies, complete a 5k running event. In some cities this is a huge community-wide event and in others, it's an intimate and inspiring gathering of friends and family. The results are the same-- making the seemingly impossible, possible. 

Help

us Kick Off Our Spring 2014 Season

at Keane Elementary in Schenectady and

Elsmere Elementary in Delmar!

scholarships to cover the program registration fee.

we're sorry that donations are not tax-deductible.

Hi my name is Katie! I am a rising junior social work student at a college is Boston. Spring Break of my senior year I traveled with thirteen others from my high school to Jamaica. This trip was one I will never forget. Working hand-in-hand with the people of Jamaica, feeding the hungry, clothing the naked, caring for the sick, visiting the lonely, and welcoming the strangers all as God has asked from us. The opportunity has arrived for me to return to Jamaica this summer and with your help I want to make it possible!

I am currently a sophomore at Regis College studying social work and there is nothing I would rather due then spend my summer serving the people of Jamaica. I will be traveling back to Kingston, Jamaica, taking part in a service/immersion experience with Mustard Seed Communities., a Catholic social service agency. Over the course of 2 months I will be working with abandoned children with special needs, teen mothers who have been kicked out of their homes, and orphaned children with HIV/AIDS. While there, I will be learning about the Jamaican culture, politics, economics, and the struggles that the island has faced developing as an independent nation.

It is my belief that service experiences are an invaluable part of my education. An international trip such as this one exposes me to a reality of Third World poverty and encourages me to critically analyze and evaluate its causes and possible solutions. Over the course of the two months I will have many opportunities to put a face to the issues I learn about in school. It is my hope that I will grow in my ability to love, sacrifice, and show compassion during this trip. I believe this will truly been a life-changing experience as it has been in the past.

The old African proverb says, “It takes a village to raise a child”, and making this educational service trip become a reality will take the help of everybody in our many villages. It is my hope that my teachers, family and friends, as well as small businesses and companies, will be able to help my opportunity become a reality. The estimated cost for my trip will be around $2000. All donations are tax-deductible, and will go directly to my flights, room and board, supplies for me to educate and work with the children, and all extra will be given as a monetary donation to Mustard Seed.

Mustard Seed Communities (MSC) requires volunteers to raise donations for two reasons: fundraising puts the volunteer in an uncomfortable position of asking for support just as the people of MSC have had to beg for their daily survival before being taken care of by MCS, and because it raises such needed awareness of the needs of the people of MSC. I hope you understand that your donation is not helping me but rather it will help put a smile on the face of a child, food on their table and shoes on their feet. Your gift will help these children who have no mother to tuck them into bed at night, have never had a mother sing a lullaby, or put a Band-Aid on a boo-boo. Over the course of my trip I would like to be a mother-like figure to these children, and with your donations I can hopefully make this possible. Please remember I am not asking for any certain amount of money from anyone, but anything you would be able to give would be greatly appreciated! Whether you want to give up your coffee for a week, or make your lunch instead of buying it, it is the little things that add up!

If this is not possible for you, please spread the word and keep me in your thoughts and prayers!

The B. Foundation
<i>B<span style=""font-weight: normal
Help Women Heal, Then Thrive!
My name is Kaati and I
live in Westminster, CO just north of Denver. As a recovering victim of sexual
assault, I'm committed to helping other women who have been victims of sexual
or domestic violence through the recovery and healing process and on to better lives.
Through the long
struggle, over many years, to regain my confidence and sense of self, I have learned the value of
consciously reclaiming my body through exercise and self-care. Not enough can
be said about the value of this process and the implications it has for
emotional healing.
My goal is to start
and run a non-profit to help women repossess their bodies from their
abusers/attackers through a program that utilizes meditation
practice, exercise and nutrition.

The goal of the organization would be to lead exercise and cooking classes at women's shelters and other women's organizations. And, to encourage victims to join our ongoing support groups which would feature exercise, encouragement, life-coaching, healthy eating and guided meditation and relaxation techniques.

The funds will be used to complete the legal process of setting up and registering a small nonprofit organization and to pay a licensed therapist to partner in designing a program that will be the most beneficial to recovering women. I'm also seeking funds to complete my Holistic
Nutrition Therapy Certificate from the Nutrition Therapy Institute in Denver
and to obtain a personal training certificate from NASM.
Where does your contribution go?
<ul>
<li>Consulting with Licensed Counselor to Design a Strong and
Viable Program: $5,000
• Legal/Registration Fees and Liability Protection: $5,000
• Website, Marketing Materials, Logo Design: $2,000
<li><span style=""line-height: 1.45em
<li><span style=""line-height: 1.45em
If we don’t reach our funding
goal, the funds will be used to design the program <b>first
column2: then, to register as a nonprofit. (Even if I do not complete

column1: my schooling,  I can hire volunteers with certifications to do the
work until I catch up.) The most valuable thing we can create is a program model
that can help women heal. The end goal would be a program that can be
duplicated to help women across the country and around the world.
Is this really important? Is there a need for
this? Who does this help? Are there programs like this?
One out of every six
American women has been the victim of an attempted or completed rape in her
lifetime. Among all victims, about nine out of ten are female. Every two
minutes someone in the United States is sexually assaulted.
We want to help women
heal, free of charge!  (After my assault, I had to pay for counseling.
Sometimes, I couldn’t afford the counseling I most definitely needed. Even when
the Victim’s Compensation Fund kicked in it didn’t cover the full cost.) Women
who are emotionally injured by violent events should not be forced to cope
without help because they can’t afford counseling. While our program would not
replace one-on-one counseling with a trained therapist, it could fill a gap
when no services are available.
There are many rape crisis centers across the nation. (I visited one myself and the
service they provide is invaluable.) However, the healing process is years,
decades, a lifetime long. We want to provide help to women who want to own
their lives again. Our services will be available to women with no time limits.
In other words, if a woman was victimized last week, last month or 10, 30 or 40
years ago, we want to help.
I do not know of a
program in my area that provides the help that we plan to offer. Nothing like this was
available to me.
Other Ways You Can Help
Share, share, share! Help
us raise the money we need to help women in need by telling everyone on all of your social networks!
Keep us in mind for a
volunteer opportunity in the next year.

A few years ago the Nicholas Madrid's daughter Adriana Madrid was diagnosed with a Neuroblastoma a form of childhood cancer. Upon further examination Adriana was found to have had a tumor growing in the abdomen which was pushing on her kidneys and lungs and causing her a great deal of pain.  She fought throughout the entire ordeal and managed to put the cancer into remission. Unfortunately due to other complications, Adriana's mind and body just couldn't keep up with the fight any longer. Our Lord and Savior looking down at her just couldn't bare for this child to continue on with the pain and removed her spirit to be with her in forever glory and happiness.
column3:
>While her family grieves I would like to start a fundraiser to help them with the funeral costs.


Please share this and lets help raise $3,200 to help them cover the funeral costs. Every little bit helps and we appreciate everything, thank you from the bottom of all our hearts.

Upon further examination Adriana was found to have had a tumor growing in the abdomen which was pushing on her kidneys and lungs and causing her a great deal of pain.  She fought throughout the entire ordeal and managed to put the cancer into remission. Unfortunately due to other complications, Adriana's mind and body just couldn't keep up with the fight any longer. Our Lord and Savior looking down at her just couldn't bare for this child to continue on with the pain and removed her spirit to be with her in forever glory and happiness. While her family grieves I would like to start a fundraiser to help them with the funeral costs.Please share this and lets help raise $3,200 to help them cover the funeral costs. Every little bit helps and we appreciate everything, thank you from the bottom of all our hearts.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

column1: |","Phoenix, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/adriana-madrid-s-funeral-expenses/pica

Who is Kehinde Ishangi and The Ishangi Institute for Dance and Movement Science?

I am Kehinde Ishangi: Dancer, choreographer, dance and movement scientist, educator, and creator of The Ishangi Institute for Dance and Movement Science. I created The Ishangi Institute because I realized that most people want to live life with graceful control over their physical body – not only dance artists and athletes. Sure it is true that physical well-being is the livelihood of a dancer/athlete. But what I realized is that for all people, healthy movement allows the precious gift of a grandfather to walk and play freely and fully with his grandchild. Or, for another, a walking enthusiast, to always be able to enjoy the serenity of hiking and nature trails. Or for each of us to be able to maintain rudimentary actions independently, such as brushing our hair without the limitations of a physical pain. All individuals want some sense of control over their physical bodies. Many people are not aware of how to move effectively nor efficiently, yet everyone wants to preserve their physical autonomy throughout their lives. The work I do helps individuals move with ease and effortlessness, but, most importantly, to take their control back with greater physical health, as well as confidence knowing their bodies are well.
How what I do benefits others?

My work helps clients move better, feel better and live in a happier state within their physical body. Many of my clients have chronic pain and stressful lives that cause physical pain or are elite athletes who need to keep their body operating at optimum levels so that they can be relevant and successful in their careers. My work helps clients regain motor function, balance, flexibility and strength in their movement.
Why I do this?

Helping clients brings me the most joy. I am most fulfilled when I can aid a client  in achieving his/her goal of returning to a hobby that they missed practicing due to physical constraints or simply helping them to perform everyday physical activities with greater ease and grace. What makes me know that my work has been successful is not just that their physical goals have been met, but their whole being changes. They are more confident, poised and at ease in their bodies. They experience their strength and I get to witness their success. I take pride in my work and pride in seeing my clients overcome their physical limitations. 

How your contribution will help?

As a start-up business there are many costs that come up. These proceeds will be used to purchase the GYROTONIC® Pulley Tower, a machine needed to help clients both move and feel better.  With your support, $3000 will buy this equipment. Acquiring this equipment will also allow me to shift my revenue expenditures to marketing, in order to locate other individuals who would benefit from the services offered by The Ishangi Institute. Thank you for helping me reach my goal and continuing to do the work that I love and cherish.

Are you a busy,
health-conscious cook, plant-based food fan, or aspiring vegan? Imagine being
able to visually scan a curated collection of easy, tasty, and accessible
recipes on your phone or tablet, either while picking up some groceries on the
way home from work, or while standing at the fridge, wondering what to make
from ingredients you have on hand. Help bring our popular web resource into the
21st century with this campaign aimed at building VegKitchen’s app for planning
and making healthy meals easier and more fun.
I'm Nava Atlas,
the author of many well-known vegetarian (in the past) and vegan (more recently
and going forward) cookbooks. This year is not only the 30th anniversary of the
publication of my first book, Vegetariana,
but I’ve been running VegKitchen.com, a comprehensive recipe and health site
since 1996. We’re now entering our
19th year — an eternity in internet terms! What started as “In a Vegetarian
Kitchen” transitioned to simply VegKitchen in 2010 when the site went
completely plant-based. As a vegan myself since 2001, I wanted the site to
reflect my values.
VegKitchen offers
an abundance of content, featuring some 80 voices from around the healthy food
realm with new content being added almost daily. We’d like to see VegKitchen be
part of the vanguard of the vegan revolution, and are pleased that so many
authors, chefs, and nutrition experts choose to be part of our mission.
What We Need &
To build an
easily navigable app, first we need to upgrade the photos for the recipes to be
included. Clear yet delicious-looking photos that read well even on a phone or
tablet will be how cooks navigate the categories, answering the never-ending
question of how to make healthy meals in the midst of a busy life. Categories will include
pastas, sandwiches and wraps, main-dish salads, soups and stews, veggie-packed
pizzas, grain and bean specialties, and more. Touch the photo of what appeals
to you, and up pops its recipe along with a shopping and pantry list, plus a
suggestion on how to complete the meal.
When navigating
our app, photos need to jump out, because what the hungry cook sees will help
them decide what they want to make at that very moment!
We’ve started to test photo makeovers, which help make the recipes already on VegKitchen’s web site more accessible and appealing to readers: Here’s one example:
column8:
/>

Chana Masala, before and after (after photo by Hannah Kaminsky)

column1: Next, we’ll work
closely with an app developer who has already created software in close
alignment with how we envision that our app will function. Though much work
still goes into this phase, existing software will streamline the process and
make it more economical than a from-scratch app build. Having this framework
will allow us to project the launching of our app for Spring 2015.
With a projected
250 recipes in this app — the size of a generous cookbook — our budget for this
phase of the project includes photographing the target recipes so that they are
clear and readable when presented on a device as small as a smartphone, along
with the initial beta build of the app.
