VegKitchen pdf e-books, up through a signed set of first editions of my two
earliest books,
now considered classics) along with signed original illustrations from those
books. And in between, signed copies of my vegan titles, including the most
recent,
will also include a copy of my forthcoming, highly anticipated book,
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column4: >Even if we don't reach our entire goal, any

column1: amount raised can and will go to continuing to develop this app. Whatever we
raise will be used to this end, and greatly appreciated.

The Impact

VegKitchen isn't just for vegans
column2: hundreds of thousands of eaters of all kinds find our recipes and articles through search. We're here to show how easy and tasty plant-based eating can be for anyone who's interested
column3: enticing photos would definitely amp up the experience.

column1: • Shifting to a vegan diet or at least a more plant-based diet has been shown to improve health and reduce risk of major disease.
• Animal agriculture has been proven to exacerbate climate change. Shifting to plant-based eating has a far greater impact than changing light bulbs!
• Land and water resources as well as the oceans are being decimated by the world's growing appetite for animal foods. And we all know that factory farming is one of the cruelest practices on earth.

• All this being said, VegKitchen's overarching mission isn't about convincing people to go vegan, but to help them find plant-based info easily and enjoyably. With every meatless meal, you're making the world a better place and voting with your fork, as the saying goes.
Other Ways You Can Help
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column3: >Even if you choose not to donate to this campaign, I hope you'll visit VegKitchen.com for easy, tasty, and healthy recipes and tips:

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column3: >And join the lively conversation on our (also exponentially growing) Facebook page:

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column3: >If you like this campaign, please spread the word with your Indiegogo sharing tools.

Passionately Producing Sustainable Suds
Hi! My name is Kristen, and this is my friend Monyca. And we want to start a soap company.
column3:
/>

Together we will be working to create a women’s

column1: cooperative: bringing homemade, organic, sustainable, local soaps to the people
of Santa Cruz as well as creating opportunities for new means of income and
education on sustainable soap making.
We were inspired to start this project for a few reasons
• We noticed the the lack of availability of environmentally friendly soaps
• A desire to share education of sustainability throughout the community through soap-making workshops
• We wanted to empower women in the community by teaching them a trade
We have excitedly started making soap and selling it at market, but do not
have the means to keep up with demand and performing workshops without

your help.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

There are a couple of things we need before we can make this dream a reality:

column1: THINGS TO PUT IN THE SOAP! A bulk purchase of ingredients (such as coconut oil, cacoa butter, local herbs and essential oils) is needed to make bigger batches of
soap for both the local community and an online marketplace. $650
THINGS TO PUT THE SOAP IN! Soap making supplies are a must, such as soap molds, mixing bowls, spatulas, pots, thermometers, hand blenders, scales, etc. $400

A PLACE TO MAKE THE SOAP! So far I have been borrowing kitchens when available from friends to make the soap and storing it in my small room. A workplace will give us unlimited kitchen access, storage for the soaps and supplies, and a place to prepare orders to be shipped. $1300
A PLACE TO SELL THE SOAP! We will be launching a website where we can sell the soap internationally, and also be traveling to markets in different communities. $150

Grand fundraising total: $2500

If all of the funds are not met, DO NOT FRET! We will still be making soap, but will have to buy fewer ingredients and slowly work towards becoming a larger scale operation. And now, what you all have been waiting for....

SUPER AWESOME PERKS!

As if helping out the community and empowering women isnt enough of a reward, we have tons of goodies to give out as well:
• Handwritten, personalized thank-you cards from both Monyca and I
• Organic, natural, 100% local Guatemalan soap made from Coconut Oil, Cacoa butter, and other luscious ingredients that are guaranteed to make your skin silky smooth
• Customized bars of soap
• Pictures of the soap making workshops in action
• Handmade organic scarves from a local womens co-op
• Delicious fair-trade coffee from the Lake Atitlan

The Impact


The vision is to create a natural, organic, local soap company that directly impacts the community. 

Not only are our soaps making a positive difference in your shower experience...

Our soaps will be helping to empower women by giving them access to learning a trade, thus increasing their economic opportunities.

By increasing their economic opportunities, this helps to end the cycle of poverty.

Our soaps are environmentally friendly

The ingredients for the soaps are all bought locally, which stimulates the local economy


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute financially, that is A-okay! We need to get the word out about this campaign, so if you believe in what we are trying to do, PLEASE share with friends, family, and anyone you know that loves soap!

Get to Know Us:

Greetings, my name is LaTisha Page. I am a certified Ayurvedic Wellness Consultant from Ann Arbor, MI now living in the cornfields of Fairfield, IA. Blended Bliss Bar is a combination of my passions and created to be a beacon of BLISS for the community. As one of our core values, we live and promote a healthy lifestyle because healthy people are happy people. The best part about our juices is that the combinations are chosen according to Ayuvedic principles. Ayurveda is used as a tool to recognize and celebrate everyone's unique differences, supporting our customers varied needs to help maintain balance mentally and physically. With your support we are raising the funds for our start-up costs. This includes:
<ul>
• 2 durable commercial grade juicers
• A wheatgrass juicer
• Supplies- cups, lids, napkins, straws, ect.
• Inventory- organic fresh produce
• Overhead- we gotta pay the rent

Our goal is to raise 7k for Blended Bliss Bar's opening date, April 1, 2013. This is where the magic happens as a dream becomes a reality with the help of your support. Every contribution is greatly appreciated and will be rewarded with a complimentary gift. If a monetary contribution is not possible, that's great too, make your contribution by helping to spread the word. Share our link with friends and family, the more the merrier. Thank you and Be Blissed!

Experience the lively streets of Katutura in a new exciting and environmentally friendly way. KatuTours offers guided tours by bike through the culturally and historically rich township of Katatura, Windhoek’s former ‘blacks only’ suburbs during Apartheid rule. Experience the vibrant soul of Windhoek from the immediacy and intimacy of a bicycle and get a  taste of Namibia that you could never have from a car.

Katutura was built 10 kilometers outside of 'white' Windhoek to keep the black population from mixing with the white population.  There is limited public transport to get out to Katutura which can mean many tourists and visitors to Namibia miss out on an important cultural experience.  We wish to meet our cleints where they are and provide them with a service that is lacking - transport to get out and see the hearbeat of Windhoek.  We hope even to reach local Namibians who have never taken the opportunity to visit this cultural gem tucked 15 minutes outside their home city!
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp
Break it down for folks in more detail:

We are looking for a vehicle to help expand our custumor reach, which is turn will help  grow our business.  We are aiming to make the purchase by this next Northern Summer and will be using the $15,000 towards vehicles purchase and maintenance as well as any bicycle maintenance that is needed.

Help out a local women owned  entrepreneaurial business here in Windhoek.  We will make sure to take care of you when you come and visit the land of the mighty Namib.  There are also some 100% Namibian t-shirts available for the first people who are kind enough to fund us.
If we do not reach our goal, any funds raised will help us grow our business by expanding our marketing base, buying more bicycles and training our staff in advanced bicycle maintenance.
<div>
The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

Many times tourists and Namibians alike will neglect an entire side of Namibian culture because they are not comfortable with going to a township, even though they pass by it on a regular basis.  We aim to bridge this divide and foster deeper understanding amongst people who otherwise would not have any interaction.
We are currently sitting at #7 of the top 20 attractions in Windhoek on Tripadvisor.com.  We are also the #2 women owned businness in Namibia according to the Lions of Namibian annual competition.

column2: >Being set outside of Windhoek city centre, it proves difficult sometimes for people to access our offices when they don't have their own vehicle.  Our goal with these funds is to be able to provide transfer service from the backpackers in central Windhoek to Katutura to visit.

column1: <div>
Please like our page on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/KatuturaTours
and visit us on www.katutours.com

Our Story
LaVonya Dicus raised four little girls in her house in Kansas City, Missouri. She has lived there for almost four decades.

It is her home. Her children have grown up and moved out, but all have fond memories of their time there. Lavonya has been receiving foreclosure notices and was too proud to tell her children. We've contributed as much as we had to give and have run out of funds. Now we're in a crunch and have a month to raise enough money to save our childhood home and keep our mom with a roof over her head in the little house she loves. With your help, we could raise enough money to pay the remainder of the money owed.
The Impact

With the money you donate, we can save our mother's house. It is the home we all grew up in and that her grandchildren know and love. Your donation can keep LaVonya in her house for another four decades! It has a garden in the backyard that she built from the ground up. It is her hobby and passion.
<h3>What We Need &amp
column2:
What You GetWe need $3,000 by the end of the month to keep my mom from losing her house and being forced to move out and lose all her belongings. Any amount you can give will help us reach our goal and save the home we all love dearly.

For your contribution to the cause, you get an e-book of original writing and art from LaVonya's daughters, Amber and Arliss. It's an attractive e-book that you can read on the go or at home. It has a variety of short stories, poetry, and art created over the years by Amber and Arliss. They're talented ladies and you can enjoy the fruits of their labor. If you'd like to read a sample of the awesomeness you could be downloading, please visit the Help Momma Dicus Save Her Home Blog on blogger.com. You can read samples of their writing and see some of the art there.

column1: Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't give, don't let our story die. Tell your friends about this page! Spread the word! And then go call your mom and tell her you love her. :) She probably wants to hear from you!

ViviendasLeon starts small, women-run businesses in the indigenous region of Sutiava, Leon, Nicaragua.  This is part of a long term, integrated plan to create sustainable development for hundreds of families living in rural poverty.  The Sewing Co-op is the first of many planned projects that provide the first-ever, women operated employment in this region.

The campaign seeks funding for six new electric sewing machines that will greatly increase productivity, create permanent employment and expand the market for this co-op.  Without this support, the co-op will not reach a level of production that will provide for the women who work there, throwing them back into the poverty they want to escape.

$5,000 will purchase the new sewing machines, and provide for a much needed infusion of operating funding to purchase large quantities of raw materials at favorable prices.  A secure work place has been acquired.  The only remaining piece is the funding for equipment and materials.  All funds acquired through this campaign will go to supporting the co-op and its operations.

ViviendasLeon has a track record of success in programs ranging from school construction, education support, reforestation and agro-forestry, and arts education.  See our work and programs at:  www.viviendasleon.org
Share this campaign with your friends.  Use the IndieGoGo share tools.
Like us on Facebook:  http://www.facebook.com/ViviendasLeon

Hi,
I am Yvonne, the U.S. coordinator for this tribal widow broom
business project in the Andhra Pradesh state of India. Yvonne has
been working with tribal leaders since 2013. We host a weekly
Thursday night online meeting to monitor our team effort and
progress.
Yvonne
is a former computer software consultant and
24-year-ancient single mom.
In the past 15 years, She
has been on teams to countries including Austria,
Cambodia, Cameroon, Central
China, Cuba, Egypt, Israel,
North Korea, Philippines,
South Russia, Sri Lanka, Thailand, United
Arab Emirates and more. From year 2007 till present time she
has been to India seven times.
Now,
Yvonne and team (Barnabas, Jonathan, Silas and Sonya) are embarking on their
first-ever crowd funding campaign for the people they are passionate
about.
Tribal Widowhood
In
India's Caste system, all tribal people belong to the lowest,
despised caste and are nicknamed 'the untouchables.' Most
AP tribesmen live in huts (mud houses) without bathrooms.
Women are deemed
inferior to men. Widows are often blamed for their husbands' death.
Young widows most likely can never be remarried. In 2014, Yvonne
found tribal women's illiteracy rate to be nearly 100%. In Andhra
Pradesh, a tribal woman's labor work earns her about USD 50 cents a day
which is half of a tribal man's pay. A widow has great difficulty
feeding herself and children.
In
the photo above, 25-year-old Budamma lost her husband in a
goat delivery truck accident on January 2, 2016. She received the
truck insurance company's indemnity of USD$600. As a widow, Budamma
needs to raise her three and five-year-old boys alone.
The Generational Impact
So
you see this is why we are passionate about finding seed money to
help tribal widows create a broom business. The ladies and their
children will have a livelihood and possibly send their children to
school. They are not asking for handouts. They simply need love and
generosity to help them take on a new beginning and thrive against
all odds in a hostile culture and social system. This project will
create generational impact on the tribal families.
Would
you help these families?
Business Scenario
There are about 60
tribal widows. Leaders plan to start with 10 in five villages. They
can make brooms from March to May. After the broom season they can
find cultivation work between June and August.
Analysis:
<ul>
<li>
<blockquote>Ten
widows can, on average, produce seven brooms per day. Each will be
paid 10 rupees per broom and thus 70 rupees a day (about USD $1).
<li>
<blockquote>Raw
materials for 4,000 brooms will cost about USD $3,000. Ten widows
will need about two months to make them. When all sold proceeds will
be about $4,250.
<li>
<blockquote>Profit
<li>
<blockquote>Profit
may be used as 1) bonus to the widows, 2) reinvestment into the next
business project, and 3) recruit more widows to join the business.
The Seed Money
We are raising $3,000 to start a broom business prototype with 10
widows.  This is a historical and entrepreneurial effort in the AP
tribal region.
Yvonne has been coordinating donation effort and handling money transfer
from the U.S. to local Indian leaders for over two years. She is
involved in the International House of Prayer, Orange County in Santa
Ana, and Grace Mission Church International in Anaheim. Both
organizations reside in Southern California.
Your funds will be handled by FirstGiving,
Indiegogo's payment processor. FirstGiving will disburse money
directly to IHOP OC on a monthly basis. No matter how much funds may be raised, ALL, after standard
fees, will be transferred to the tribal region to start the broom business.
Will you help these women to take the challenge of being financially
independent?
Your
Fulfillment
Love
transforms lives! Your love and contribution transforms lives! Need
we say more?
In
turn, may your life be transformed!
On
behalf of tribal widows and leaders we thank you for your love, care
and generosity.
Risks
and Challenges
As
mentioned earlier... This is a historical and entrepreneurial effort
in this tribal region. Although seemingly a small project, we still
wonder if all brooms will be sold quickly. By taking a relatively low
risk we will find out what works and what doesn't.
Other
than the women who will make the brooms there are other men and women
who act as liaisons, handle storage and shipment of raw material and
finished products. All of them will have on-the-job training and grow
in business leadership.
Yvonne
has worked with a key local leader couple (shown in photo above) for over two years through
weekly communication and on-site visits. We are confident no matter
what challenges arise our team will embrace and resolve them
with openness and integrity.
More
Ways You Can Help

Please click and contribute now! Sow a seed and show your love to many transforming families in India's Andhra Pradesh tribal region.

Whether you donate or not, if you find this campaign worthwhile, please
spread the word in your circle of influence and share this campaign in your social media networks!
From the bottom of our hearts... Thank

you, thank you and thank you.

Sincerely,

Yvonne
Source
of Indian broom image:
http://www.arnajharna.org/English/Broom_Types_of_Brooms.aspx
Source
of animated gif:
http://www.docsity.com/en/news/biology/plant-physiology-related-processes-explained-gifs/

column2: >When people come together over tea, powerful bonds are formed and a sense of community emerges. As our society grows more reliant on digital communication the importance of personal connection becomes more and more apparent. Tea provides a safe and stimulating environment in which people from all walks of life can connect.
>Wei Long Dong is the brainchild of Texas tea ambassadors So-Han Fan, Christopher Caballero and Tamara Spach.

>So-Han Fan is a Chinese-American born in New Orleans and raised in Texas.  His love of tea began in childhood, drinking aged pu-er while eating dim sum with his family.  After discovering the art of Gong Fu Cha while studying marine biology at university, he began teaching tea classes in Santa Cruz through the Free School.  He found that serving tea in the Gong Fu style was a perfect way to share his culture with others while providing a fascinating and social experience.  After graduating he moved to Austin in 2008 and got his feet wet in the tea industry working as the tea sommelier for Jade Leaves Tea House.  In 2010 he moved to China to pursue an environmental research position with the Chengdu Urban Rivers Association.  While there, he expanded his love of tea in the land of its birth and developed friendships with several tea farming families.  He started West China Tea Company upon his return in 2013 to share this farm-direct tea with the Austin community.

>Tamara Spach was born in Brazil and moved to Israel at age 10.  When she turned 18 she began traveling the world, working on different community-oriented projects. She came upon Chinese tea culture at a party in Portland in 2011.  She was immediately captivated and began taking her tea set with her on her travels, pouring tea for whomever she met.  When she spotted West China Tea Company's booth at Archaic Revival festival in 2013, she was thrilled.  She and So-Han became fast friends and she helped West China Tea start the Tea Spot in 2015.  Having experienced first hand the connective and transformative powers of tea, she has dedicated herself to growing tea culture in Austin.

>
Christopher Caballero is a Texas native with roots going back 8 generations.  He discovered the healing powers of tea through nutritional research while caring for his ailing grandmother.  In 2014 he co-founded the non-profit environmental Wild Rice Festival in San Marcos, which employed West China Tea Company to serve tea.  He and So-Han bonded over their mutual love of tea and water. Chris began serving tea at local gatherings in San Marcos with his friends as the SMTeaX collective.  In 2015 he traveled to China to source gong fu teaware for the rapidly-growing Texas tea community.  SMTeaX has partnered with West China Tea Company for local and out-of-state events to bring the rarefied environment of the Tea House to the Texas party and festival scene.

>Tea is what brought us together, and after hosting more than a thousand tea services, we discovered that the magic of tea is that it brings EVERYONE together.  What we had previously suspected was our personal nerdy obsession quickly became a movement. We had never anticipated that a seemingly-obscure Chinese cultural practice would become a major social outlet for thousands of Texans.  Soon the Tea Spot, at a humble 200 square feet, was crowded wall to wall with people huddled on cushions.  Dozens of San Martians would gather by the river in San Marcos on a sunny day to sip tea with SMTeaX.  We had tea dance parties that went all night long, tea sits where we discussed spiritual texts and social issues, jam sessions, poetry readings, workshops and classes.  After serving tea at large festivals, sometimes with as many as 6 tea servers at once, we realized that the only thing limiting the number of people who come to drink tea is space.

> We realized something else as well:  that when people gather for tea, something amazing happens.  Tea provides a perfect focal point for conversation, with the server and with the people drinking tea with you, many of whom were previously strangers.  People drop their guard and begin to feel comfortable with each other.  And when people feel comfortable, they start sharing.  They share stories, they share their thoughts, and they share their unique perspective by expressing themselves artistically.  A community centered around tea quickly snowballed into being.  People took gong fu cha classes, bought tea sets, and served tea at their own gatherings to their friends.  Tea is more than just a beverage, it's a safe space and a healthy, beautiful practice.  It's connection, an invitation to be present and express, a vehicle for discussion and a catalyst for community.  Now all we need is a place to do it.

> Located in central Austin, this beautiful wood-floored building has more than 3,000 square feet and enough space for more than 100 people to sit together for tea.  In addition to a large reception room and an intimate private tea studio, it features a courtyard, ample parking, and one large hall big enough to host yoga classes in.  This is our opportunity to create an exquisite oasis in the middle of Austin, a world where people can not only gather over tea but express themselves and connect in ways that we can't even begin to anticipate.  We've already signed a 3-year lease and the space is waiting for us to fill it with tea and life.  This is where you can help us!

> We're stepping into a new space 15 times the size of our old one, and this increase in space necessitates an order of magnitude increase in our tea and teaware inventory.  To fully stock the tea house with our entire catalog of more than 130 teas, as well as enough Chinese and locally-made teaware to meet the growing demand, will require $30,000 in initial inventory.  This will ensure we have everything in sufficient quantities that we won't be constantly running out.  The Tea Spot operated out of 200 square feet and hosted one tasting per day, for three hours, with a maximum occupancy of 15 and a single server.  In the new space we will need more tea to serve as well as sell, and a whole fleet of brand new tea sets for use by staff, customers, and gong fu cha students.  We'll need kettles, water filters, tables, chairs, cushions, yoga mats, rugs, tablecloths, tapestries, paint, decorations, and shelving.  We want a library, a record collection, a sound system, and lighting to accommodate both intimate gatherings and epic dance parties.  And wherever possible, we'd like to use locally-made goods by skilled craftspeople in our community instead of manufactured products.  We don't just want a tea house, we want a beautiful tea house.  A growing company boot-strapping into an unprecedented expansion, we can share not only the finest tea but also create an elegant and unique environment, with community support.

>$20,000 buys us 135 pounds of tea, enough to serve and sell without running out before we can secure more tea to replace it.  Farm-direct tea is a seasonal product, and once a small-batch tea runs out we can't get it again until the next year.  This coming spring is our opportunity to stock up to ensure tea-thirsty Austinites have a dependable supply.
>$10,000 will get us 20 tea sets for our staff and customers to use in-house, as well as a diverse selection of high quality imported and local wares for sale and for outside events.
>$12,000 will make sure we have shelves to store and display our merchandise,  floor-level and raised tables, cushions, and chairs.
>$3,000 will get us a sound system for performances, dance parties, lectures, workshops, and funky tea house music.
>$3,000 buys us a professional array of lighting to create diverse atmospheres in our Great Hall.

>$8,000 has been earmarked for acquiring beautiful decorations, from tapestries and paintings to scrolls, screens, rugs, and curtains.  Where possible we will source second-hand, eco-friendly, and locally-made goods to minimize our footprint and create a distinctive environment.

>$1,000 will be for operational expenses, including office supplies, cleaning supplies, scales, scoops, gloves, canisters, bags and labels for selling tea, as well as business cards, literature, signage, and branded Wei Long Dong merchandise.

>And finally we've budgeted $3,000 to payroll.  In general, payroll is a recurring expense that is funded by the income of the tea house.  But $3,000 gives us a buffer to make sure that we can pay our employees a living wage while we build up momentum.

column1: <h3 style=""text-align: center

column2: >Some of our perks are self-explanatory - a t-shirt, a bumper sticker, etc.  But some of our most special perks are experiential.  These include tea tastings, tea classes, and a very special once-in-a-lifetime journey to the homeland of tea.  People who have been to the Tea Spot or experienced gong fu cha elsewhere will have some idea of what these are, but here's an explanation of what gong fu cha is and what these perks will entail.

>Our $10 perk is free admission to one tea tasting at Wei Long Dong.  A tea tasting is one of our most basic services offered at Wei Long Dong, and is at the foundation of tea culture.  With its beautiful tools, elegant gestures, and ritualistic atmosphere, gong fu cha is often mistaken for a tea ""ceremony"".  On the contrary, a tea tasting is a casual gathering where people sit together to drink tea prepared by a practitioner skilled in the art of gong fu cha, or the Chinese tea service.  This centuries-old tradition emphasizes steeping tea with attention and practice to bring out the unique and complex flavors, fragrances, and qi of artisan tea.  The gathering itself is social, stimulating, and relaxing.  Each tea is steeped multiple times, changing with each infusion, telling a story over the course of the tasting.  The server shares information and stories about each tea, and helps guide the participants to help them enjoy the tea, hone their palette, and understand the culture and philosophy behind Chinese tea.  The tea table is an environment where people who were once strangers can engage in meaningful discussion, form bonds, and build lasting friendships.  We will be holding three tea tastings per day at Wei Long Dong, many having different themes.  Some are focused on expanding knowledge and familiarity with tea and tea culture, focusing on different categories of tea, specific regions, or styles of tea service.  Others explore diverse topics or activities, including poetry readings, social and political dialogue, sacred text discussions, jam sessions, costume parties, dream weaves, and pretty much anything we can imagine.

>Spreading tea culture isn't just about serving tea to people, it's about giving people the tools and knowledge they need to share tea with their friends.  We offer training in the art of gong fu cha so that people can serve tea at home and cultivate their own skill, knowledge, and appreciation of tea.  Guests who know how to serve tea will also be able to rent tea sets from us and pour their own tea at the tea house.

>A Sip Ticket is a bundle of pre-paid tea tastings.  The more you buy at one time, the cheaper they are.  When you come to Wei Long Dong we'll simply stamp your ticket and you get access to any $10 tea tasting.  6 tastings for $50, 13 for $100, $350 for 50 or $600 for 100.

>Wei Long Dong isn't just a place of business, it's a place to congregate, socialize, express, share, and connect.  Wei Long Dong is meant to be a home away from home, where you can go any time and know that friends will be waiting for you gathered around tea.  Membership allows you to come any time and get free use of a house tea set and one pot of free tea per day.   Also come with guest passes so you can bring a friend to serve tea to.

>We travel to China to source tea and tea ware directly from tea farmers and craftspeople.  This year we're going to give 8 contributors the chance to join us for a very special tour through the homeland of tea and tea culture.   We'll go to mountaintop farms, ancient cities, and remote locations that normal tourists would never have the opportunity to visit.  The first week of the tour will take us to Eastern China, to Chaozhou, the home of gong fu cha and Phoenix oolongs, as well as Fuding, Fujian, the home of white tea, and Wuyi Mountain, home of Rock Oolongs and Black Tea.  The second week we will visit the beautiful karst mountains of Guangxi, home of Seven Immortals Green Tea and aged smoked Guyu Cha, used to make an ancient style of fried, pounded, and boiled beverage called you cha.  Then we'll travel to Yunnan, the biological home of the tea plant, to pick tea from the ancient tea trees of Nannuo Mountain.  We'll pick and process our own pu er tea, and press our own bings, or tea cakes, in the traditional style using stone weights.  Your hand-pressed tea cake, made of tea we picked ourselves, will improve with age, serving as a drinkable souvenir of this once-in-a-lifetime journey.

>Tea knives, or cha dao 茶刀, are special blades used to open cakes of tea, called bings 饼.  Our locally-made tea knives are hand-forged in Austin by Trystan Hegar.  These one-of-a-kind artisan knives are elegant and ergonomically designed, and perfectly curved to open tea bings and bricks without crushing the leaves.

>Our silver tea necklaces are made from actual dried tea leaves fired with precious metal clay to produce a pure silver pendant.  The resulting necklace captures all the beauty of the tea leaf, each serration, vein, and wrinkle in perfect relief.  The leaf is destroyed in the firing process, so each pendant is one-of-a-kind.  Made in Austin by local jeweler Emily Spykman of Clementine &amp
column3: Co., each necklace comes with an ounce of the tea it is made from and a description of the tea.

column2: >A gong fu tea set consisting of a white porcelain gaiwan, glass gong dao bei, bamboo cha pan, and 6 porcelain cups.  The porcelain pieces are branded with our name and logo, and are currently available only to donors to our crowdfunding campaign.

column1: ","When people come together over tea, powerful bonds are formed and a sense of community emerges. As our society grows more reliant on digital communication the importance of personal connection becomes more and more apparent. Tea provides a safe and stimulating environment in which people from all walks of life can connect.
Wei Long Dong is the brainchild of Texas tea ambassadors So-Han Fan, Christopher Caballero and Tamara Spach.

So-Han Fan is a Chinese-American born in New Orleans and raised in Texas.  His love of tea began in childhood, drinking aged pu-er while eating dim sum with his family.  After discovering the art of Gong Fu Cha while studying marine biology at university, he began teaching tea classes in Santa Cruz through the Free School.  He found that serving tea in the Gong Fu style was a perfect way to share his culture with others while providing a fascinating and social experience.  After graduating he moved to Austin in 2008 and got his feet wet in the tea industry working as the tea sommelier for Jade Leaves Tea House.  In 2010 he moved to China to pursue an environmental research position with the Chengdu Urban Rivers Association.  While there, he expanded his love of tea in the land of its birth and developed friendships with several tea farming families.  He started West China Tea Company upon his return in 2013 to share this farm-direct tea with the Austin community.

Tamara Spach was born in Brazil and moved to Israel at age 10.  When she turned 18 she began traveling the world, working on different community-oriented projects. She came upon Chinese tea culture at a party in Portland in 2011.  She was immediately captivated and began taking her tea set with her on her travels, pouring tea for whomever she met.  When she spotted West China Tea Company's booth at Archaic Revival festival in 2013, she was thrilled.  She and So-Han became fast friends and she helped West China Tea start the Tea Spot in 2015.  Having experienced first hand the connective and transformative powers of tea, she has dedicated herself to growing tea culture in Austin.

Christopher Caballero is a Texas native with roots going back 8 generations.  He discovered the healing powers of tea through nutritional research while caring for his ailing grandmother.  In 2014 he co-founded the non-profit environmental Wild Rice Festival in San Marcos, which employed West China Tea Company to serve tea.  He and So-Han bonded over their mutual love of tea and water. Chris began serving tea at local gatherings in San Marcos with his friends as the SMTeaX collective.  In 2015 he traveled to China to source gong fu teaware for the rapidly-growing Texas tea community.  SMTeaX has partnered with West China Tea Company for local and out-of-state events to bring the rarefied environment of the Tea House to the Texas party and festival scene.

Tea is what brought us together, and after hosting more than a thousand tea services, we discovered that the magic of tea is that it brings EVERYONE together.  What we had previously suspected was our personal nerdy obsession quickly became a movement. We had never anticipated that a seemingly-obscure Chinese cultural practice would become a major social outlet for thousands of Texans.  Soon the Tea Spot, at a humble 200 square feet, was crowded wall to wall with people huddled on cushions.  Dozens of San Martians would gather by the river in San Marcos on a sunny day to sip tea with SMTeaX.  We had tea dance parties that went all night long, tea sits where we discussed spiritual texts and social issues, jam sessions, poetry readings, workshops and classes.  After serving tea at large festivals, sometimes with as many as 6 tea servers at once, we realized that the only thing limiting the number of people who come to drink tea is space.

We realized something else as well:  that when people gather for tea, something amazing happens.  Tea provides a perfect focal point for conversation, with the server and with the people drinking tea with you, many of whom were previously strangers.  People drop their guard and begin to feel comfortable with each other.  And when people feel comfortable, they start sharing.  They share stories, they share their thoughts, and they share their unique perspective by expressing themselves artistically.  A community centered around tea quickly snowballed into being.  People took gong fu cha classes, bought tea sets, and served tea at their own gatherings to their friends.  Tea is more than just a beverage, it's a safe space and a healthy, beautiful practice.  It's connection, an invitation to be present and express, a vehicle for discussion and a catalyst for community.  Now all we need is a place to do it.
Enter Wei Long Dong Tea House.

Located in central Austin, this beautiful wood-floored building has more than 3,000 square feet and enough space for more than 100 people to sit together for tea.  In addition to a large reception room and an intimate private tea studio, it features a courtyard, ample parking, and one large hall big enough to host yoga classes in.  This is our opportunity to create an exquisite oasis in the middle of Austin, a world where people can not only gather over tea but express themselves and connect in ways that we can't even begin to anticipate.  We've already signed a 3-year lease and the space is waiting for us to fill it with tea and life.  This is where you can help us!

We're stepping into a new space 15 times the size of our old one, and this increase in space necessitates an order of magnitude increase in our tea and teaware inventory.  To fully stock the tea house with our entire catalog of more than 130 teas, as well as enough Chinese and locally-made teaware to meet the growing demand, will require $30,000 in initial inventory.  This will ensure we have everything in sufficient quantities that we won't be constantly running out.  The Tea Spot operated out of 200 square feet and hosted one tasting per day, for three hours, with a maximum occupancy of 15 and a single server.  In the new space we will need more tea to serve as well as sell, and a whole fleet of brand new tea sets for use by staff, customers, and gong fu cha students.  We'll need kettles, water filters, tables, chairs, cushions, yoga mats, rugs, tablecloths, tapestries, paint, decorations, and shelving.  We want a library, a record collection, a sound system, and lighting to accommodate both intimate gatherings and epic dance parties.  And wherever possible, we'd like to use locally-made goods by skilled craftspeople in our community instead of manufactured products.  We don't just want a tea house, we want a beautiful tea house.  A growing company boot-strapping into an unprecedented expansion, we can share not only the finest tea but also create an elegant and unique environment, with community support.
The breakdown:

$20,000 buys us 135 pounds of tea, enough to serve and sell without running out before we can secure more tea to replace it.  Farm-direct tea is a seasonal product, and once a small-batch tea runs out we can't get it again until the next year.  This coming spring is our opportunity to stock up to ensure tea-thirsty Austinites have a dependable supply.
$10,000 will get us 20 tea sets for our staff and customers to use in-house, as well as a diverse selection of high quality imported and local wares for sale and for outside events.
$12,000 will make sure we have shelves to store and display our merchandise,  floor-level and raised tables, cushions, and chairs.
$3,000 will get us a sound system for performances, dance parties, lectures, workshops, and funky tea house music.
$3,000 buys us a professional array of lighting to create diverse atmospheres in our Great Hall.

$8,000 has been earmarked for acquiring beautiful decorations, from tapestries and paintings to scrolls, screens, rugs, and curtains.  Where possible we will source second-hand, eco-friendly, and locally-made goods to minimize our footprint and create a distinctive environment.

$1,000 will be for operational expenses, including office supplies, cleaning supplies, scales, scoops, gloves, canisters, bags and labels for selling tea, as well as business cards, literature, signage, and branded Wei Long Dong merchandise.

And finally we've budgeted $3,000 to payroll.  In general, payroll is a recurring expense that is funded by the income of the tea house.  But $3,000 gives us a buffer to make sure that we can pay our employees a living wage while we build up momentum.
Our Perks

Some of our perks are self-explanatory - a t-shirt, a bumper sticker, etc.  But some of our most special perks are experiential.  These include tea tastings, tea classes, and a very special once-in-a-lifetime journey to the homeland of tea.  People who have been to the Tea Spot or experienced gong fu cha elsewhere will have some idea of what these are, but here's an explanation of what gong fu cha is and what these perks will entail.
Tea Tasting

Our $10 perk is free admission to one tea tasting at Wei Long Dong.  A tea tasting is one of our most basic services offered at Wei Long Dong, and is at the foundation of tea culture.  With its beautiful tools, elegant gestures, and ritualistic atmosphere, gong fu cha is often mistaken for a tea ""ceremony"".  On the contrary, a tea tasting is a casual gathering where people sit together to drink tea prepared by a practitioner skilled in the art of gong fu cha, or the Chinese tea service.  This centuries-old tradition emphasizes steeping tea with attention and practice to bring out the unique and complex flavors, fragrances, and qi of artisan tea.  The gathering itself is social, stimulating, and relaxing.  Each tea is steeped multiple times, changing with each infusion, telling a story over the course of the tasting.  The server shares information and stories about each tea, and helps guide the participants to help them enjoy the tea, hone their palette, and understand the culture and philosophy behind Chinese tea.  The tea table is an environment where people who were once strangers can engage in meaningful discussion, form bonds, and build lasting friendships.  We will be holding three tea tastings per day at Wei Long Dong, many having different themes.  Some are focused on expanding knowledge and familiarity with tea and tea culture, focusing on different categories of tea, specific regions, or styles of tea service.  Others explore diverse topics or activities, including poetry readings, social and political dialogue, sacred text discussions, jam sessions, costume parties, dream weaves, and pretty much anything we can imagine.
Gong Fu Cha Classes

Spreading tea culture isn't just about serving tea to people, it's about giving people the tools and knowledge they need to share tea with their friends.  We offer training in the art of gong fu cha so that people can serve tea at home and cultivate their own skill, knowledge, and appreciation of tea.  Guests who know how to serve tea will also be able to rent tea sets from us and pour their own tea at the tea house.
Sip Tickets

A Sip Ticket is a bundle of pre-paid tea tastings.  The more you buy at one time, the cheaper they are.  When you come to Wei Long Dong we'll simply stamp your ticket and you get access to any $10 tea tasting.  6 tastings for $50, 13 for $100, $350 for 50 or $600 for 100.
Membership

Wei Long Dong isn't just a place of business, it's a place to congregate, socialize, express, share, and connect.  Wei Long Dong is meant to be a home away from home, where you can go any time and know that friends will be waiting for you gathered around tea.  Membership allows you to come any time and get free use of a house tea set and one pot of free tea per day.   Also come with guest passes so you can bring a friend to serve tea to.
Tea Journey Through China

We travel to China to source tea and tea ware directly from tea farmers and craftspeople.  This year we're going to give 8 contributors the chance to join us for a very special tour through the homeland of tea and tea culture.   We'll go to mountaintop farms, ancient cities, and remote locations that normal tourists would never have the opportunity to visit.  The first week of the tour will take us to Eastern China, to Chaozhou, the home of gong fu cha and Phoenix oolongs, as well as Fuding, Fujian, the home of white tea, and Wuyi Mountain, home of Rock Oolongs and Black Tea.  The second week we will visit the beautiful karst mountains of Guangxi, home of Seven Immortals Green Tea and aged smoked Guyu Cha, used to make an ancient style of fried, pounded, and boiled beverage called you cha.  Then we'll travel to Yunnan, the biological home of the tea plant, to pick tea from the ancient tea trees of Nannuo Mountain.  We'll pick and process our own pu er tea, and press our own bings, or tea cakes, in the traditional style using stone weights.  Your hand-pressed tea cake, made of tea we picked ourselves, will improve with age, serving as a drinkable souvenir of this once-in-a-lifetime journey.
Locally Made Tea Knife

Tea knives, or cha dao 茶刀, are special blades used to open cakes of tea, called bings 饼.  Our locally-made tea knives are hand-forged in Austin by Trystan Hegar.  These one-of-a-kind artisan knives are elegant and ergonomically designed, and perfectly curved to open tea bings and bricks without crushing the leaves.
Silver Tea Necklace

Our silver tea necklaces are made from actual dried tea leaves fired with precious metal clay to produce a pure silver pendant.  The resulting necklace captures all the beauty of the tea leaf, each serration, vein, and wrinkle in perfect relief.  The leaf is destroyed in the firing process, so each pendant is one-of-a-kind.  Made in Austin by local jeweler Emily Spykman of Clementine & Co., each necklace comes with an ounce of the tea it is made from and a description of the tea.
Wei Long Dong Branded Tea Set

A gong fu tea set consisting of a white porcelain gaiwan, glass gong dao bei, bamboo cha pan, and 6 porcelain cups.  The porcelain pieces are branded with our name and logo, and are currently available only to donors to our crowdfunding campaign.",4.0,0,"1 Campaign

Tandem Bedding is a wholly
column2: >Canadian company, inventor of a new set of specialized bedding for couples who don’t have the same tolerance for temperature when it comes to bedtime. To satisfy the two occupants of the same bed, the fitted sheet and the flat sheet are specially manufactured so that one side of the bed is made of warm flannel, while the other side is made of light and fresh cotton.

column1: A great adventure began for two sisters who decided to come together to create  a  business  plan based on a dream and an idea. They invested an enormous amount of time in Tandem Bedding sets, devoting energy and money to the development, research materials, and design of the product. “We have revolutionized the world of bedding with a product to the greatness of our requirements, higher level design, high quality bedding and at an affordable price.”

A year and a half has passed since the beginning of that adventure and we have had our final product for a year now. However, despite our boundless energy and our incredible willingness to move forward, our project has stalled due to lack of financial resources. A product as unique as ours is cannot claim its place in the market without an advertising campaign to support it and make it known to consumers. Since advertising costs are very high, we are looking for financial backing to help us achieve the visibility required to emerge Tandem Bedding sets from obscurity.
!!!!I’M TOO HOT!!!!! YOU’RE TOO COLD!!!!
... No more bedtime arguments...
The Tandem set of flat and fitted bed sheets offers 2-in-1 comfort.

This new innovation in bedding sheets allows each individual in the same bed to enjoy comfort based on their tolerance to heat or cold. Tandem bedding sheets have a longitudinal seam joining two fabrics specially selected for their varied characteristics
column2: in our case a light and cool COTTON, and a warm and comforting FLANEL to meet the needs of conflicting preferences.

column1: <ul>
• On one side of the bed, the flat sheet and the fitted sheet are made of 100% COTTON permitting light, fresh air circulation and moisture to keep you cool.
<ul>
• On the other side of the bed, the flat sheet and the fitted sheet are made of warm and comforting FLANNEL that envelops you and keeps you warm.
<ul>

• Each individual maintains his or her own comfort level regardless of their tolerance to cold or heat while sharing exactly the same environment at bedtime. Both sheets are reversible in order  to meet your preferred side.

column1: DESIGN  E

It all started over 15 years ago by one of the two founders of the company, Josée. She was in a relationship and when it came time to sleep, it was like Groundhog Day ... During the winter her spouse was always opening the window for cool and fresh air and did not want to replace the cotton sheets by a set of flannel ones. This was the only way he was able to sleep and enjoy a full night's sleep. It was the same story in summer ... the air-conditioning was ever present in the room and lightweight cotton sheets kept everything cool at night. The problem then became that Josée was chill all year long. Despite the addition of warm blanket over the sheets, the comfort just wasn’t there. There was more heat as her body acclimated to the sheets but the initial brush of the cotton was still cold. The sheets moved throughout the night and made it difficult and tedious to make the bed in the morning. As a result, Josée slept poorly. One frustrated morning, an idea hit: “One day I'm going to invent sheets that are half and half so we both sleep well!""

That day has finally come fifteen years later. The desire to start up the company was intriguing but nearly impossible to accomplish on her own.  In 2011 Josée discussed the concept with her sister Manon who decided to join the project has a financial partner. Josée, who is already working full-time in her trade, jumped into overdrive. Manon had worked in sales for 23 years, and had a bachelor and a master's degree in microbiology. Josée had a diploma in mechanical building and worked in the industry for 18 years, but in recent years, was known as a art painter sold across Canada.
Josée Forest - President                                Manon Forest  -  Vice President
Literie Tandem est une compagnie entièrement
column2: >québécoise, inventeur d’un tout nouvel ensemble de literie spécialisé pour les couples qui, quand vient l’heure du coucher, n’ont pas la même tolérance au froid et à la chaleur. Afin de satisfaire les deux occupants d’un même lit, le drap contour et le drap plat d’un côté du lit sont en flanelle chaude, tandis que l’autre côté du lit est en coton léger et frais.

column1: D’une idée, vient un rêve et le début d’une grande aventure pour deux sœurs qui décident de s’affilier pour créer un projet d’entreprise. Énormément d’investissement de temps, d’énergie et d’argent a été consacré à la mise en place, la recherche des matières, l’élaboration et la conception des ensembles de literie Tandem. Nous avons révolutionné le monde de la literie avec un produit à la grandeur de nos exigences, de niveau de conception supérieure, une literie de très haute qualité, et ce, à prix abordable.

Un an et demi s’est écoulés depuis le début de notre belle aventure et nous avons en main notre produit final depuis maintenant un an, mais malgré notre énergie débordante et notre étonnante volonté de foncer, notre projet stagne faute de ressource financière. Un produit, aussi exceptionnel qu’il soit, ne peut trouver sa place sur le marché sans une campagne de publicité pour l’appuyer et le faire connaître aux consommateurs. Puisque les coûts de publicité sont très élevés, nous sommes à la recherche de fond pour nous aider à obtenir la visibilité nécessaire pour faire sortir les ensembles de literie Tandem de l’ombre.
!!!! J'AI CHAUD !!!!! TU AS FROID !!!!
... Fini les problèmes de couple…
Les ensembles de draps plats et contours TANDEM vous offrent les 2 conforts en 1 .

Ce nouveau concept de literie Tandem est un produit innovateur et révolutionnaire adapté au confort de chacun dans le couple. Il permet aux occupants d'un même lit de dormir dans un confort unique en fonction de leurs tolérances à la chaleur ou à la fraîcheur. Une couture longitudinale assure la jonction de deux tissus spécialement sélectionnés pour leurs caractéristiques différentes l'un de l'autre soit
<ul>
• Le drap plat et le drap contour d’un côté du lit EN COTON 100 % léger et frais permettant la circulation de l’air et de l’humidité pour vous garder au frais.
<ul>
• Le drap plat et le drap contour de l’autre côté du lit EN FLANELLE chaude et réconfortante vous enveloppe et vous garde bien au chaud.
<ul>

• Chaque individu conserve ainsi son propre confort peut importe sa tolérance au froid ou à la chaleur, tout en partageant exactement le même environnement à l’heure du coucher. L’ensemble étant réversible du coté droit ou gauche afin de respecter votre côté préféré.

column1: Schéma de la literie                          Étiquette d'emballage de la literie

Notre objectif est clair, nous voulons combler par une approche simple, mais avant-gardiste, les lacunes que l’on retrouve dans les ensembles de literie standard. Aucune progression n’a jamais été faite dans ce domaine et pourtant, tous autant que nous sommes, rejoignons notre lit soir après soir pour un repos bien mérité, et très souvent accompagné de l’être cher. Chaque individu possède sa propre tolérance au froid et à la chaleur, tout en partageant exactement le même environnement à l’heure du coucher. Selon nous, plus de confort égal un sommeil plus profond donc plus réparateur pour affronter une nouvelle journée bien remplie.
FABRIQUÉ AU QUÉBEC
Vous pouvez retrouver tous les détails en parcourant notre site internet au www.literietandem.com
Nous sollicitons votre support financier afin
d’atteindre un montant de $50 000.00.

Nous avons déjà investi plus de $ 70 000.00 dans notre projet de literie Tandem. Notre ensemble de literie est au point, mais notre plus grand défi  reste à venir. La publicité, l’une des étapes les plus cruciales et également l’une des plus coûteuses est primordiale afin de faire découvrir ce nouveau produit aux caractéristiques unique au grand public.
Nous avons usé d’ingéniosité et de tous nos charmes afin d’obtenir le maximum de publicité gratuite.
<ul>
• Nous avons conçu notre site internet, incluant un système de livraison rapide à travers le Canada ainsi qu’un service de paiement facile et sécuritaire par Paypal. www.literietandem.com
<li>Nous avons créé notre page Facebook que vous pouvez visiter sur <span style=""text-decoration: underline
column2: >literie tandem, afin de vous tenir au courant des évènements auxquels nous prenons part, ainsi que les nouvelles les plus récentes concernant notre literie

column1: • Nous avons rejoint et fait connaître notre literie à diverses émissions radiophonique et télévisuelle. Plus d’une dizaine d’entre eux en ont parlé dans le cadre de chronique de nouveauté, d’idée cadeau originale ou de trouvaille.
• Nous avons également approché plusieurs journaux et revues qui ont avec plaisir partagé l’information sur notre nouveau produit.
• Puisque que nous sommes en processus de brevet avec notre invention, nous avons également été invités à participer à différent salon de l’habitation afin de promouvoir gratuitement notre produit.
Nous avons également tenté d’obtenir des subventions gouvernementales, mais aucune ne s’applique.

Malgré tous nos efforts, nous avons besoin d’une plus grande visibilité pour créer « la » demande assez forte pour faire progresser notre entreprise. Nous sommes au point où nous devons faire des publicités qui toucheraient à un très large auditoire.

Cette somme nous permettrait de faire produire notre première publicité télévisée et de la faire diffuser pour une période d’environ un mois. Nous espérons que le roulement ainsi apporté nous permettrait ensuite de poursuivre nous même notre promotion avec notre propre fonds de roulement.

column1: Nous avons vraiment besoin de vous, votre soutien nous permettra de lancer notre compagnie à travers tout le Canada.

Donnez ce que vous pouvez – chaque dollar compte ! Démontrons ensemble le pouvoir de la collectivité. En supportant notre petite entreprise, vous lui donnez la chance de devenir plus grande, et ainsi nous pourrons également redonner au suivant en créant de nouveaux emplois dans notre communauté tout en augmentant la richesse de notre pays !!

Vous pouvez également nous soutenir en parlant de notre produit à vos parents, collèges et amis ! Une simple discussion entre ami ou sur les réseaux sociaux est une belle publicité pour nous. Une personne qui en parle à deux, ces deux derniers qui en parlent à quatre, quatre personnes qui en parlent à huit, c’est exponentiel et excellent pour nous faire connaître.
Merci infiniment à vous tous.
En échange de votre don, vous obtiendrez :

Notre ensemble de literie Tandem est une idée originale que vous ne retrouverez dans aucun autre ensemble de literie toutes marques confondues. Les tissus ont été soigneusement sélectionnés pour sa conception unique… De couleur unie et neutre, ils s’agencent à toutes ambiances. Ils ont des lignes pures pour une allure sobre et urbaine.

Nous tenons à vous remercier de votre grande générosité en vous offrant un cadeau particulier, et ce, disponible uniquement pendant la durée de cette promotion. Ce cadeau n’est pas disponible sur literie Tandem en temps normal. Nous voulons ajouter un brin de folie à vos ensembles de literie afin qu’ils se distinguent encore plus !!
Nous avons tout spécialement créé pour l’occasion une série de taies d'oreiller peintes à la main par une artiste peintre professionnelle Canadienne, en édition limitée.

En fait, nous avons créé cinq motifs uniques et les avons peints individuellement à la main sur chacun des coffres des taies d’oreiller que vous recevrez en cadeau. Elles deviennent un élément de décoration artisanale unique sur votre lit. Vos oreillers se mêleront maintenant à vos coussins, plus besoin de les ranger le matin venu, vous pouvez les laisser sur votre lit comme élément de décoration.

column1: MOTIF  E

Tout a commencé il y a plus de 15 ans par une des deux fondatrices de la compagnie, soit Josée. Elle est en couple, et quand vient l’heure du couché, c’est le jour de la marmotte…en hiver son conjoint qui a toujours chaud ouvrait la fenêtre pour plus de fraîcheur et ne voulait pas remplacer les draps de coton par un ensemble de flanelle. Il n’y avait que de cette façon qu’il arrivait à bien s’endormir et à profiter d’une nuit complète de sommeil réparateur. Un peu le même principe en été…l’air climatisée très présente dans la chambre et les draps de coton glacés et légers le garde au frais la nuit. Le problème se transfert donc du côté de Josée qui est frileuse. Malgré l’ajout de couverture chaude par-dessus les draps, le confort n’y est pas. Il y a plus de chaleur mais les draps de coton restent quand même glacés. Les draps se déplacent, c’est long à faire le lit le matin, elle dort mal et ne profite pas au maximum de ses heures de sommeil. Elle lui lance… « un jour j’vais inventer des draps qui seront moitié moitié pour qu’on dorme bien tous les deux !!!»

Ce jour est donc venu une quinzaine d’années plus tard. L’envie de se lancer est intéressante, mais seule c’est impossible. Elle en discute en 2011 avec sa sœur Manon qui décide de devenir sa partenaire financière. Josée, qui travaille déjà à temps plein dans son métier, met les bouchées doubles. Manon travail dans la vente depuis 23 ans, elle possède un DEC, un BAC et une maitrise en microbiologie. Josée a un DEC en mécanique du bâtiment, domaine dans lequel elle a travaillé pendant 18 ans, mais est depuis quelques années, artiste peintre vendu dans 5 galeries d’art à travers le Canada.
Josée Forest - Présidente                             Manon Forest  -  Vice Presidente
","La version française suit la version anglaise

Tandem Bedding is a wholly Canadian company, inventor of a new set of specialized bedding for couples who don’t have the same tolerance for temperature when it comes to bedtime. To satisfy the two occupants of the same bed, the fitted sheet and the flat sheet are specially manufactured so that one side of the bed is made of warm flannel, while the other side is made of light and fresh cotton.

A great adventure began for two sisters who decided to come together to create  a  business  plan based on a dream and an idea. They invested an enormous amount of time in Tandem Bedding sets, devoting energy and money to the development, research materials, and design of the product. “We have revolutionized the world of bedding with a product to the greatness of our requirements, higher level design, high quality bedding and at an affordable price.”

A year and a half has passed since the beginning of that adventure and we have had our final product for a year now. However, despite our boundless energy and our incredible willingness to move forward, our project has stalled due to lack of financial resources. A product as unique as ours is cannot claim its place in the market without an advertising campaign to support it and make it known to consumers. Since advertising costs are very high, we are looking for financial backing to help us achieve the visibility required to emerge Tandem Bedding sets from obscurity.
Project Description :
!!!!I’M TOO HOT!!!!! YOU’RE TOO COLD!!!!
... No more bedtime arguments...
The Tandem set of flat and fitted bed sheets offers 2-in-1 comfort.

This new innovation in bedding sheets allows each individual in the same bed to enjoy comfort based on their tolerance to heat or cold. Tandem bedding sheets have a longitudinal seam joining two fabrics specially selected for their varied characteristics
column2: in our case a light and cool COTTON, and a warm and comforting FLANEL to meet the needs of conflicting preferences.

column1: On one side of the bed, the flat sheet and the fitted sheet are made of 100% COTTON permitting light, fresh air circulation and moisture to keep you cool.
On the other side of the bed, the flat sheet and the fitted sheet are made of warm and comforting FLANNEL that envelops you and keeps you warm.

Each individual maintains his or her own comfort level regardless of their tolerance to cold or heat while sharing exactly the same environment at bedtime. Both sheets are reversible in order  to meet your preferred side.
Overview of the bedding                       Close up of the bedding
Include : one fitted sheet
one flat sheet
two pillowcases
Bedsheet schema                                     Label packaging

Our objective is clear: we want to fill the gap currently found in bedding set standards with a simple but avant-gardist approach. No progress has been made in this area and yet, every one of us climbs into bed night after night for well-deserved rest - and we are often accompanied by loved ones. Each individual has their own tolerance to cold and heat, while sharing exactly the same environment at bedtime. We believe that comfort affords us a deeper sleep and therefore a more restful night to face each new busy day.
MADE IN CANADA
You can find all the details by browsing our website at www.literietandem.com
We ask for your financial support in order to reach a total of $50, 000.

We have already invested more than $ 70 000.00 in our Tandem bedding project. Our bedding is developed, but our biggest challenge is yet to come. Advertising, one of the most crucial steps and also one of the most expensive is essential in order to discover this new product to the general public only features.
We used ingenuity and all our charms to get the most of free advertising.
We have developed a website, including a system for fast delivery across Canada, as well as a payment service which is easily and securely accessible through Paypal. www.literietandem.com
We have created a Facebook page that can be visited at ‘literie tandem’ to keep fans informed of events in which we participate, as well as the latest news about our bedding products.
We have been promoted in various radio and television programs. More than a dozen of them have spoken about Tandem bedding free in the context of chronic novelty, original idea or discovery.
We also approached several newspapers and magazines
column2: they have gladly shared information about our new product.

column1: Because we have reached the patent stage with our invention, we have also been invited to participate in different home shows, free of charge, to promote our product.
We have also tried to obtain government grants, but currently none apply.

Despite our best efforts, we need greater visibility to create a demand strong enough to grow our business. We are at the point where we need to make ads that will affect a wide audience. Our aim is to have the financial capability to produce television advertising which will air during primetime over an extended period. This amount would allow us to produce our first television advertisement and air it for a period of about one month. We hope that this television advertising will entice potential customers and will allow us to continue to promote our product with the capital generated from the presumed increased sales.
We truly need and appreciate any help you can offer. Your support will allow our company to be known across Canada.

Give what you can - every dollar counts! Demonstrate the power of the whole community. Supporting our small business and giving us the chance to grow will allow us to pay it forward in the future by creating new jobs in our community and increasing the wealth of our country as a whole!

You can also support us by talking about our product to your family, colleagues and friends! Word of mouth can do wonders for a small business like ours. A simple discussion between friends or on social networks is a great way for us to become known. If one person speaks to two, the latter two will reach four and those four people may reach eight… this can easily become exponential exposure for us.
Thank you very much to all of you.
In exchange for your donation, you will receive

Our Tandem bedding set is an original idea that you will not find in any other bedding set. The fabrics have been carefully selected for their unique features... Available in a solid neutral color, they match any decor. They have clean lines and an urban look.

We are pleased to thank you for your great generosity by offering you a special gift, only available for the duration of this promotion. We want to add a touch of flair to your bedding sets so they stand out even more!
For this occasion, we have specially created a limited edition hand-painted pillowcase made by a professional Canadian art painter.

We have created five unique designs and have individually hand-painted the cuffs of each pillowcase that you will receive as a gift. With this design element, the cases become a decorative element for your traditional bed. The pillows can now mingle with your decorative cushions and eliminate the need to store them in the morning.
DESIGN A
DESIGN  B
DESIGN  C
DESIGN  D
DESIGN  E
Our history:

It all started over 15 years ago by one of the two founders of the company, Josée. She was in a relationship and when it came time to sleep, it was like Groundhog Day ... During the winter her spouse was always opening the window for cool and fresh air and did not want to replace the cotton sheets by a set of flannel ones. This was the only way he was able to sleep and enjoy a full night's sleep. It was the same story in summer ... the air-conditioning was ever present in the room and lightweight cotton sheets kept everything cool at night. The problem then became that Josée was chill all year long. Despite the addition of warm blanket over the sheets, the comfort just wasn’t there. There was more heat as her body acclimated to the sheets but the initial brush of the cotton was still cold. The sheets moved throughout the night and made it difficult and tedious to make the bed in the morning. As a result, Josée slept poorly. One frustrated morning, an idea hit: “One day I'm going to invent sheets that are half and half so we both sleep well!""

That day has finally come fifteen years later. The desire to start up the company was intriguing but nearly impossible to accomplish on her own.  In 2011 Josée discussed the concept with her sister Manon who decided to join the project has a financial partner. Josée, who is already working full-time in her trade, jumped into overdrive. Manon had worked in sales for 23 years, and had a bachelor and a master's degree in microbiology. Josée had a diploma in mechanical building and worked in the industry for 18 years, but in recent years, was known as a art painter sold across Canada.
Josée Forest - President                                Manon Forest  -  Vice President

Literie Tandem est une compagnie entièrement québécoise, inventeur d’un tout nouvel ensemble de literie spécialisé pour les couples qui, quand vient l’heure du coucher, n’ont pas la même tolérance au froid et à la chaleur. Afin de satisfaire les deux occupants d’un même lit, le drap contour et le drap plat d’un côté du lit sont en flanelle chaude, tandis que l’autre côté du lit est en coton léger et frais.

D’une idée, vient un rêve et le début d’une grande aventure pour deux sœurs qui décident de s’affilier pour créer un projet d’entreprise. Énormément d’investissement de temps, d’énergie et d’argent a été consacré à la mise en place, la recherche des matières, l’élaboration et la conception des ensembles de literie Tandem. Nous avons révolutionné le monde de la literie avec un produit à la grandeur de nos exigences, de niveau de conception supérieure, une literie de très haute qualité, et ce, à prix abordable.

Un an et demi s’est écoulés depuis le début de notre belle aventure et nous avons en main notre produit final depuis maintenant un an, mais malgré notre énergie débordante et notre étonnante volonté de foncer, notre projet stagne faute de ressource financière. Un produit, aussi exceptionnel qu’il soit, ne peut trouver sa place sur le marché sans une campagne de publicité pour l’appuyer et le faire connaître aux consommateurs. Puisque les coûts de publicité sont très élevés, nous sommes à la recherche de fond pour nous aider à obtenir la visibilité nécessaire pour faire sortir les ensembles de literie Tandem de l’ombre.
Description du projet :
!!!! J'AI CHAUD !!!!! TU AS FROID !!!!
... Fini les problèmes de couple…
Les ensembles de draps plats et contours TANDEM vous offrent les 2 conforts en 1 .

Ce nouveau concept de literie Tandem est un produit innovateur et révolutionnaire adapté au confort de chacun dans le couple. Il permet aux occupants d'un même lit de dormir dans un confort unique en fonction de leurs tolérances à la chaleur ou à la fraîcheur. Une couture longitudinale assure la jonction de deux tissus spécialement sélectionnés pour leurs caractéristiques différentes l'un de l'autre soit
Le drap plat et le drap contour d’un côté du lit EN COTON 100 % léger et frais permettant la circulation de l’air et de l’humidité pour vous garder au frais.
Le drap plat et le drap contour de l’autre côté du lit EN FLANELLE chaude et réconfortante vous enveloppe et vous garde bien au chaud.

Chaque individu conserve ainsi son propre confort peut importe sa tolérance au froid ou à la chaleur, tout en partageant exactement le même environnement à l’heure du coucher. L’ensemble étant réversible du coté droit ou gauche afin de respecter votre côté préféré.
Vue d'ensemble de la literie                 Vue rapprochée de la literie
Schéma de la literie                          Étiquette d'emballage de la literie

Notre objectif est clair, nous voulons combler par une approche simple, mais avant-gardiste, les lacunes que l’on retrouve dans les ensembles de literie standard. Aucune progression n’a jamais été faite dans ce domaine et pourtant, tous autant que nous sommes, rejoignons notre lit soir après soir pour un repos bien mérité, et très souvent accompagné de l’être cher. Chaque individu possède sa propre tolérance au froid et à la chaleur, tout en partageant exactement le même environnement à l’heure du coucher. Selon nous, plus de confort égal un sommeil plus profond donc plus réparateur pour affronter une nouvelle journée bien remplie.
FABRIQUÉ AU QUÉBEC
Vous pouvez retrouver tous les détails en parcourant notre site internet au www.literietandem.com
Nous sollicitons votre support financier afin
d’atteindre un montant de $50 000.00.

Nous avons déjà investi plus de $ 70 000.00 dans notre projet de literie Tandem. Notre ensemble de literie est au point, mais notre plus grand défi  reste à venir. La publicité, l’une des étapes les plus cruciales et également l’une des plus coûteuses est primordiale afin de faire découvrir ce nouveau produit aux caractéristiques unique au grand public.
Nous avons usé d’ingéniosité et de tous nos charmes afin d’obtenir le maximum de publicité gratuite.
Nous avons conçu notre site internet, incluant un système de livraison rapide à travers le Canada ainsi qu’un service de paiement facile et sécuritaire par Paypal. www.literietandem.com

Nous avons créé notre page Facebook que vous pouvez visiter sur literie tandem, afin de vous tenir au courant des évènements auxquels nous prenons part, ainsi que les nouvelles les plus récentes concernant notre literie

Nous avons rejoint et fait connaître notre literie à diverses émissions radiophonique et télévisuelle. Plus d’une dizaine d’entre eux en ont parlé dans le cadre de chronique de nouveauté, d’idée cadeau originale ou de trouvaille.
Nous avons également approché plusieurs journaux et revues qui ont avec plaisir partagé l’information sur notre nouveau produit.
Puisque que nous sommes en processus de brevet avec notre invention, nous avons également été invités à participer à différent salon de l’habitation afin de promouvoir gratuitement notre produit.
Nous avons également tenté d’obtenir des subventions gouvernementales, mais aucune ne s’applique.

Malgré tous nos efforts, nous avons besoin d’une plus grande visibilité pour créer « la » demande assez forte pour faire progresser notre entreprise. Nous sommes au point où nous devons faire des publicités qui toucheraient à un très large auditoire. Notre objectif est d’avoir la capacité financière de faire produire une publicité télévisée, et également de la faire voir sur des chaînes télévisées de grande écoute, et ce pour une période prolongée. Cette somme nous permettrait de faire produire notre première publicité télévisée et de la faire diffuser pour une période d’environ un mois. Nous espérons que le roulement ainsi apporté nous permettrait ensuite de poursuivre nous même notre promotion avec notre propre fonds de roulement.
Nous avons vraiment besoin de vous, votre soutien nous permettra de lancer notre compagnie à travers tout le Canada.

Donnez ce que vous pouvez – chaque dollar compte ! Démontrons ensemble le pouvoir de la collectivité. En supportant notre petite entreprise, vous lui donnez la chance de devenir plus grande, et ainsi nous pourrons également redonner au suivant en créant de nouveaux emplois dans notre communauté tout en augmentant la richesse de notre pays !!

Vous pouvez également nous soutenir en parlant de notre produit à vos parents, collèges et amis ! Une simple discussion entre ami ou sur les réseaux sociaux est une belle publicité pour nous. Une personne qui en parle à deux, ces deux derniers qui en parlent à quatre, quatre personnes qui en parlent à huit, c’est exponentiel et excellent pour nous faire connaître.
Merci infiniment à vous tous.
En échange de votre don, vous obtiendrez :

Notre ensemble de literie Tandem est une idée originale que vous ne retrouverez dans aucun autre ensemble de literie toutes marques confondues. Les tissus ont été soigneusement sélectionnés pour sa conception unique… De couleur unie et neutre, ils s’agencent à toutes ambiances. Ils ont des lignes pures pour une allure sobre et urbaine.

Nous tenons à vous remercier de votre grande générosité en vous offrant un cadeau particulier, et ce, disponible uniquement pendant la durée de cette promotion. Ce cadeau n’est pas disponible sur literie Tandem en temps normal. Nous voulons ajouter un brin de folie à vos ensembles de literie afin qu’ils se distinguent encore plus !!
Nous avons tout spécialement créé pour l’occasion une série de taies d'oreiller peintes à la main par une artiste peintre professionnelle Canadienne, en édition limitée.

En fait, nous avons créé cinq motifs uniques et les avons peints individuellement à la main sur chacun des coffres des taies d’oreiller que vous recevrez en cadeau. Elles deviennent un élément de décoration artisanale unique sur votre lit. Vos oreillers se mêleront maintenant à vos coussins, plus besoin de les ranger le matin venu, vous pouvez les laisser sur votre lit comme élément de décoration.
