A World in Transition and the Need for Food Security

There are many reasons why our near-term future will not look like the always-on, cheap energy world most of us consider to be “normal.” All around the world, the lights are already going out. As fossil fuel energy fades and our cheap energy-dependent food producing systems falter, we will still need to grow and eat safe, nutritious and delicious food.

Fruit-Full is building “food security nodes” using off-grid food processing centers and passive solar dryers colocated on organic farms. These nodes can go a long way toward helping people eat well when there is no longer fuel at the gas station, water coming out of the tap, or food at the grocery store.
We want you and your family to have a lightweight, nutritious, portable source of food all the time. When you support Fruit-Full, you will become part of the food security revolution.

We’re on the ground in Central America right now building our prototype, and we’d like your help to bring our “food security nodes” and the delicious solar-dried fruit they produce to the United States.
Play above video to watch how Fruit-Full solar-dried fruits are made.
A New Culture — Healthy Food, Healthy Planet
Locally produced solar-dried fruit is a step toward realizing a new culture upon the Earth in a post-carbon world — a future where people eat natural and organic because that’s all there will be.

Yes, if you live in the US, the tropical solar-dried fruit we will send you as our way of saying “thanks” will come on a truck or a plane. But get some friends together and sponsor a solar dryer or two
column2: place them in your home garden, orchard, or small organic farm. Before long, you’ll be enjoying locally-grown dried fruits of your own!

column1: Support us now to help us build this network while it is still cheap and easy to do so. With your support, we will expand the Fruit-Full program into the United States. If we raise our goal of $62,000, we can get the tropical fruits we grow and dry in Central America to the US, and we can make our solar dryers available to small-scale organic farmers who could help establish a food security network in the US.
Support the emergence of a new culture that reveres the living planet and takes care of her by eating what she can provide today without taking it from tomorrow.
The living planet needs our help. Let’s eat the fruits that are available here with the energy coming onto the Earth right now.
Fruit-Full. Nothing added but the sun.

Hello and welcome to my campaign page!

My name is Filimon, I am from Ethiopia, and I am asking for your support to grow my local fairtrade business and create opportunities for youth to connect, be inspired, innovate, create, and become agents of change in our society.
column4: '>I was born in Eritrea right after the Derge regime fell—for 14 years, half of my life and my entire childhood, I lived in a refugee camp. From there, I found my way to where I am now. I have a BA in Marketing Management, I am a founding member of the Green Club Ethiopia
column5:
as a young entrepreneur I have initiated and joined a lot of youth programs and hosted events. All this allowed me to travel to over 15 countries to present our projects. Right now we are affiliated with a lot of international NGOs and movements like the Nile Forum (who are the hosts of this campaign), also the Global Eco-village Network, the Africa Eco-village Network where I served as GEN Ambassador Ethiopia, the Transformer Ethiopia and Terra Nova movement from Tamera Portugal, just to name a few of the networks I have been connected to.

What is this Dream of the Coffee Bean about?

Allow me to take you on a journey of a few things you probably didn’t know about the coffee you drink on a daily basis…

Perhaps it’s simple: the coffee company buys beans from a farmer, sells it to a roaster, and then sells you coffee
column6: they all get a fair share of the profit, and everybody is happy! However, this is what actually happens: over the last decades the price of your coffee went up radically but do you know that only about a maximum of 4% of the money you spend on your coffee reaches the coffee farmers? And while the price went up for you, for those people growing and picking your coffee it actually went down.
column7:
>TRADITION MEETS THE FUTURE

Coffee is not something new for us Ethiopians. We gave birth to coffee
column8:
it is a heritage of Ethiopia, an ancient practice and a ritual that happens every day. We brew it using indigenous handmade clay pots called ‘Jebbena’. It is served with either kolo, popcorn, or snacks. It is unique for the fact that it brings people together for deeper and meaningful conversations—we drink it until 3rd round (there are even some Ethiopian tribes that drink until the 7th round)!

So for me, this Dream of the Coffee Bean begins a few years back. In 2011, while I was in Turkey doing my internship, I was luckily assigned to a company called Topper which manufactures coffee processing machinery. Since then I have been exposed to the world of coffee
column9: selling coffee processing machinery, consulting and meeting a lot of people, working on coffee consulting and affiliating with farmers, farmer unions and associations. I was introduced to the global coffee movement and reconnected to a ritual that happens every day in my home. This is where I came to realize the richness of a coffee bean and a coffee culture, and its energy and capacity to bring people together.
column10: >Connecting Purpose and Passion - Building Community
column12: '>Almost one and a half year ago I started
column17:
'>, a coffee company registered in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, where the Ethiopian coffee bean can be roasted, packed and exported. We started small, as with all dreams: we rented an abandoned warehouse in the outskirts of Addis, which was in a totally bad shape, and with a lot of help from the community and friends we cleaned and refurbished it and managed to buy the machinery necessary to roast, grind and pack coffee. The next step we took was transforming the warehouse into an open roasters coffee shop where people can see the process the coffee bean passes through before it reaches their cups. 

 The dream of the place is not just any coffee shop: we want it to be a hub for innovators, entrepreneurs and change-makers to meet, exchange ideas, make partnerships, and have meaningful conversations that can bring real change to our lives. Consider it like a home for the pioneers and beautiful dreamers, where they can connect and start realizing their projects, over a delicious, Ethiopian, freshly roasted cup of Filicoffee ! This inspired us to introduce the fortnight poetic-jazz nights with Kemekem band, a group of young and talented students who were looking for a place to showcase their work. But we wanted more to make it like a home for the pioneers and beautiful young dreamers: therefore, we are planning to expand the poetic-jazz nights to include inspirational speakers to motivate the youth.

We managed to manifest all this through creativity, resourcefulness, and collaboration, through voluntary efforts, and resources of the community, friends, and family. Mainly we used recycled materials, thrown-away pallets, jute bags which were used as containers of raw coffee beans.

Filicoffee and our story is unique in the market and has the potential to inspire a lot of young people - which is why we are reaching out and asking for your support. We need your help to grow and build solid foundations!

Why are we raising funds?

With a collective effort, upcycling, recycling and volunteering, we managed to put the foundations of the dream. Now, to actually manifest its true potential and grow, we need your support: we are asking the local and international community to help us bring the dream of the coffee bean into reality!

For Filicoffee to grow and become a fully sustainable social enterprise, we need:

  • A van to transport raw beans to our warehouse and distribute orders to our customers: Currently we have a very small car to deliver to the nearest location and smaller batches only, so our own van will allow us larger orders, helping with the sustainability of our business! Additionally, now to buy the green beans we always have to pay for rent, but if we have the van we can buy raw beans at a reduced cost (in bulk by reducing middlemen).
  • Organic &
column19:
Export-standard packaging: Right now we are selling our coffee mainly here in Ethiopia. To export, we need international standard and bio-degradable packaging bags, as well as organic and fair-trade international certifications.
  • Coffee Roasting &
column20: cupping training center: We want to establish a coffee lab in our warehouse so that we can control the quality of our coffee
column21:
we can provide more blend options to our esteemed customers and train cuppers in our facility, thus spreading our knowledge and creating more opportunities for youth!
  • Refurbishing the warehouse: We need sturdier furniture and an overall refurbishment to make the place safer, more comfortable, and more resilient in time!

For all this, and in addition, the platform fees, campaign management costs, and costs of perks, we are asking for your support to raise €40,000 as our seed capital to help us grow and become fully sustainable!

What do you get?

Some acts of kindness and generosity work as acupuncture points: by doing one act, the effect is multiplied in many other areas. I believe Filicoffee works as such point: by supporting us, you are supporting the dreams, ideas, and innovations of many other young African leaders - who in turn, will inspire change in others. 

We also created a lot of fun and interesting perks for you!

THANK YOU from the bottom of my heart - I am truly grateful to share my journey with all of you.

We can't do it without your support!

Whether or not Filicoffe will grow to all that it can be, depends on you! If you share this dream, please contribute to our campaign - even the smallest amount counts (really!).

There are other ways you can help:

If you believe in this dream as much as I do, please share this campaign link with people who will be interested in supporting it. Think about the optimists, dreamers, and doers in your life, and let them know about this campaign!

We believe Filicoffee will be a way for a lot of young people to reach their goals and inspire them to make their dreams a reality. A deep bow in gratitude to all of you who will become part of it!

Hello,

  My name is Robert. I am 25 years old. I have stumbled upon something that I have never thought would happen and now I am seeking help. I am an individual that would bend my back for just about anyone, just to get the satisfaction that I was able to help said individual. I have never asked for anything in return as I always get a good feeling of helping others.

  My issue currently involves me being without a home in  less than two weeks. I have not had that great of luck in finding employment, besides interim positions, which definitely helped out at the time of employment, but it was never anything that would last due to certain seasons that the year has to offer us. I normally post on Craigslist offering computer or electronic repairs, however I have not been receiving any replies or calls. I can go on about how rough my life is currently, but the truth is, I am a 'Glass half full' kind of person. There is and will always be other individuals that have life worse that I currently do. But I would have never thought about doing this sort of thing, as I am an individual that likes to help myself. I have a lot of pride in myself and I cringe at the thought of 'cyber-begging'. But this is my last option as I've exerted everything else that I know how to do.

  I currently reside in Florida and have an opportunity to move to the North Carolina for shelter until I am able to get back on my feet. I do have a vehicle, though it is not the greatest vehicle in the world. I have been scraping every penny that I have in order to save to do repairs on my vehicle so that it would be a reliable piece of transportation for the 400 mile drive. I do majority of all the work myself, as I love to learn and get hands on experience. The repairs are from replacing the timing belt, valve adjustment, replacing a few coolant hoses and finding an exhaust leak. It is typical maintenance on a 20 year old vehicle but as it sits, it is in no condition to make the trip. My insurance is also about to lapse, which I HAVE to have insurance before I even think about driving my vehicle.

  I really have no other person to turn to. I have been trying to get rid of the majority of my possessions in order to make the move. But there really isn't that big of a market for the items that I have. I will have to leave them behind anyhow, due to the limited space that I will have in my car hauling items that I absolutely need. I am not worried about losing the items that I have purchased over the years (furniture, etc) as I will eventually get new items once I am financially stable. I have a very good lead on an employment position in North Carolina and I have been doing everything in my power to get ready to make the trip, however my plans are not coming together at all.

  Again, I absolutely cringe at the thought of me doing this, but it is time for me to swallow my pride and ask for help. I have created this page, as I have used Indiegogo in the past (very cool gadgets and independent films are found there). I chose Indiegogo, as they have a 'goal' amount in which donators are able to see. I am not looking to get rich from this, as I genuinely need help in order to help myself. The slightest donation would go a very long way in my case. I sincerely thank each and every one of you for reading this.

Since its founding in 1850, Oakland has remained true to its original vision as an active cemetery, but is equally well-loved as a greenspace where locals come to walk dogs, or just take in the gothic fairy-tale environment. But when a tornado ripped through the area in March 2008, Oakland’s original six-acres lay directly in its path. Many of its storied trees and shrubbery were damaged beyond repair, gravestones and statuary were shattered into pieces, and the soil has languished in various states of decline.

Landscaping and restoration efforts are ongoing, but to this day, much of the tornado’s damage can still be seen. As part of Creative Loafing’s inaugural Do Good Campaign — a series of grassroots partnerships with various neighborhoods and nonprofits throughout the city to help them raise funds for projects they might not have the resources for otherwise — the Atlanta-based news organization is partnering with the Historic Oakland Foundation to raise $2,500 to revitalize a public gathering area that’s part of the cemetery’s original plot. Do Good sponsor the Home Depot Foundation will match donations dollar for dollar up to $2,500.

Separated by Oakland’s main thoroughfare, Old Hunter Street, the original six-acre plot encompasses two public gathering areas called the North and South Public Grounds that sit just inside the cemetery gates. Renovations to North Public proper began in 2011. Restoration of South Public is underway as well, but much of the area is still in dire need of landscaping, which is where this Do Good project, dubbed “South Public Grounds Replanting,” comes into play. Money raised for the project will fund an extensive effort to open up the area: clearing out brush, uprooting plants, and repairing a wall, followed by planting new shrubbery that will enclose the area and restore the soil.

Read more about this project on CLATL.com: http://clatl.com/atlanta/help-restore-and-revive-oakland-cemetery/Content?oid=7858257

Pride House AFH
<h3 style=""margin-left: 30px
When Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual and Transgendered people are faced with the need for assistance with daily living, they deserve to be treated with dignity and compassion.
These are the very people who fought dearly for the rights and cultural changes we now take for granted every day.

I'm Beth Davis. In the course of my 25 years in the Hospice and Home Health field, I've seen our LGBT elders forced back into the closet as they enter mainstream care facilities, and this breaks my heart.
I have earned all the certifications needed to open an Adult Family Home, and I'm 100% committed to creating a positive environment for our aging community.
We need startup funds
Adult family homes are strictly regulated and licensed by the state, and it will take about $40,000 for us to get up and running. Here's what the money will be spent on:
<ul>
• Regulation ramps, hand-rails and access equipment
• Emergency supplies for 5 days for each resident
• Bathroom modifications
• Security and safety devices such as fall alarms
• A backup gas generator
• Comfortable furnishings, including lift-type recliners
The funds will also cover house operating expenses for up to 90 days (The waiting period for state license inspection to be completed.)
We are offering incentives
The biggest incentive we offer is the knowledge you'll have that, with your donation, you are solving a growing problem. Even so, we'd like to share our gratitude with a token of our appreciation.

The Zocalo Project / Town Centre Regeneration

Hello my name is Jonathan Varty and  I am a the founder of Wiredtowns Limited in the UK, I live in Dunfermline which used to be the ancient captial city of Scotland before Edinburgh and the resting Place of King Robert the Bruce.

Dunfermline is a picturesque place with a fascinating history, unfortunately due to the trend for town edge shopping at hypermarkets/superstores and online shopping many of the small niche shops and businesses find it impossible to compete.

This situation creates a problem in ancient market cities like Dunfermline because it leaves many shops in the town centre unoccupied and this results in a decline in tourism as the town centre becomes a depressing place to be.

Wiredtowns Limited is a small start-up business with extremely limited financial resources,  we have obtained a small grant from the local council to cover the initial purchase of our software and development cost. (Now Purchased).

By funding this early stage of the development process contributors will also be helping to regenerate a beautiful and historic town, improve the local economy and increase local employment opportunities.

Our plan is then to roll out the system to other towns around Scotland, as our core system is cloud based we can then deploy the system for any location around the world, helping to turn the internet into a meaningful local resource,
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

Our campaign is to raise funds to cover the initial 6 months costs of marketing, SEO, staff costs, domain purchase costs, production of promotional goods,  by this time it should become self funding and generate funds via advertising, but initially a great deal of time must be spent creating brand recognition.

We will be offering excellent perks including Bumper stickers, Window stickers, Banner advertisements and various advertising packages unlike a normal static advert the contributors will have their own portal access and can change the advert at any time during the package life time.

All funds raised will be used to promote and run the project during the start-up period. It will then be rolled out to other towns in the area including Kirkcaldy, Glenrothes, St Andrews, Leven and hopefully many other areas.
<div>
The Impact

My vision is to help  reverse the decline in town centres by creating a vibrant online community which showcases the area and encourages visitors to shop in the town centre by offering special deals from every shop and restaurant. Deal vouchers can be obtained from The Zocalo site and used to redeem the special offers when visiting the town centre, each business that participates will offer a minimum of 2 exclusive deals per day via The Zocalo, which they can manage and monitor online via their own portal login.  This will encourage more visitors to visit the town centre, increase growth and stability for the smaller niche companies in the town centre and make the town an interesting and active heart of the community.

We have been working with the local Business Improvement District company and the Local Council and they have shown a great deal of interest in the project, however the assistance they can offer is limited and so we have turned to this community in order to help save another, ""think local act global"" used to be the buzz, we want to start a revolution to save the cultural hearts of communities wherever they are in the world.
We know that some people can't contribute financially, however spreading ideas which then take on a life of their own can change the world so we encourage links to social networks.
If you live in a community that could benefit from our portal solution we would love to hear from you.
Use the indiegogo share tool to make a noise and we can all help to save our cultural diversity.

","The Zocalo Project / Town Centre RegenerationHello my name is Jonathan Varty and  I am a the founder of Wiredtowns Limited in the UK, I live in Dunfermline which used to be the ancient captial city of Scotland before Edinburgh and the resting Place of King Robert the Bruce.

Dunfermline is a picturesque place with a fascinating history, unfortunately due to the trend for town edge shopping at hypermarkets/superstores and online shopping many of the small niche shops and businesses find it impossible to compete.

This situation creates a problem in ancient market cities like Dunfermline because it leaves many shops in the town centre unoccupied and this results in a decline in tourism as the town centre becomes a depressing place to be.

Wiredtowns Limited is a small start-up business with extremely limited financial resources,  we have obtained a small grant from the local council to cover the initial purchase of our software and development cost. (Now Purchased).

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Crafting the best

As a regular kombucha drinker and someone very coscious about foods, diet and nutrition I felt that there was a shortage of high quality, refreshing, pure kombucha. Kombucha that is easy on the palate, mixes well with cocktails and most importantly, was brewed locally keeping sustainability in mind.

I started brewing my own kombucha and lliterally have never stopped. It transformed my life overnight. Almost, a year and a half later in October 2012 the editors at Food and Wine Magazine called me up. They had heard about Pure Kombucha and wanted me to send over some for an article they might run. They told me they loved it. I was honored and felt my countless time spent perfecting flavors, blends and techniques had finally paid off!
The best part, this is only the beginning!
You could say I am the 'Mother' of Pure Kombucha. A little SCOBY pun there. Why did the SCOBY cross the road? To get to the other tea. Ha!

I am Brett Casper, I love nature and food and the energies associated with the life force we gain through eating and drinking raw living foods. Pure Kombucha is a living beverage brewed with sping water. Rich with probiotics and beneficial acids, it is said to center your chi by creating a positive environment in your digestive system. I personally want to feel good and healthy all the time. Drinking pure kombucha every day really helps me do that.

I spent the last 15 years traveling the world as a professional photographer. Tea has always been a passion. I've been everywhere from afternoon tea in London, to tea houses, shops and ceremonies in Hong Kong, Japan, China, Thailand and Singapore. For thousands of years, these ancient cultures have been drinking tea as a way for people and communities to come together and to also maintain health.

Living in New York City, it's a certain lifestyle to be here. Work obligations, social obligations, drinking obligations, pollution, noise, landlords... Toxins and stress everywhere. It's no good for your skin, health or total well being.

I started drinking kombucha when I was hungover or over ate. It really helped me to feel better, positive and energized. I lost that weighted down feeling and people told me my skin looked younger. Actually, I subsequently stopped over eating and am now mostly vegetarian. I could never give up sushi and raw oysters though! You know, that feeling you get like an aphrodisiac, good kombucha has the same affect. As soon as you drink it you can feel it. Positivity, health and sustainability are the reasons I founded PURE LUCK in the first place. Kombucha is one more piece of the bubble.
Have you heard of The Plant, in Chicago?
Detox Before You Retox

Kombucha is an effervescent fermentation of sweetened tea that is used as a functional food. This sour tasting beverage effectively helps you eliminate toxins before they can be absorbed into your body. It helps you to detoxify before you re-toxify.
Live a Symbiotic Lifestyle
The best kind of culture is symbiotic. Our SCOBY's (Symbiotic Culture of Bateria &
We ask that you support our campaign so we can:
<ul>
• Employ more people!
• Produce, educate and distribute to a larger area within NYC = More kombucha drinkers!
• Sign a long term lease on a larger space, which requires 4 months rent upfront.
• Do the necessary plumbing, RO sytem/ water heater install, electrical work and general construction.
• Bokashi Cycle compost system - We want to make compost tea out of tea!
We have outgrown our present commercial space and cannot produce enough to meet demand. We will increase production by 6 fold so you can find Pure Kombucha in places like Whole Foods, Dean &
column2: Deluca as well as Roebling Tea Room, Lodge, Brooklyn Kitchen, Black Brick cafe etc.

column1: For your much appreciated generous support you have choices to the right here. We are offering amazing deals on tea, kombucha and even coffee!  --->
PURE LUCK's mission is to perpetuate ideas of healthy communities and sustainable, innovative, living techniques for the new century.
Please support PURE LUCK. If you can't contribute financially we love, love word of mouth. Tell your friends about us. We will give out some free kombucha in your honor. :)
We think if everyone in the world drank kombucha tea. It would be a better place!

Everyone deserves a surprise, a taste of luxury and the satisfaction of putting a smile on a loved one’s face. Please help us by contributing to our venture so that we can surprise you.
Surprise Box Shop guarantees everyone a surprise based on a concept whereby the purchase is based on the elements of mystery and anticipation.

By means of an online shop, the customer will answer a questionnaire outlining their age, gender and size (or that of the person the surprise is intended for) along with the value of the gift, which is tailored to how much they are willing to spend. We will then take it upon ourselves to prepare a surprise package, which will contain various 100% authentic luxury brand name products including, but not limited to products such as clothes, cosmetics and accessories. However, the contents of each package will be unknown until the receiver opens it. This guarantees a surprise every time.
<div>
What We Need
In order to make this concept a reality, we will need $30,000, which covers the inventory, the creation of a website/e-shop, and the perks for our contributors.
What You Get

If you contribute $1, you will receive a thank you email, a link to our website when it is launched and will be placed on our mailing list.  If you contribute $10, you will receive all of the above plus a $20 gift voucher. If you contribute $20, you will receive a thank you email, a link to our website when it is launhed, will be placed on our mailing list and a $40 gift voucher. If you contribute $50, you will receive a mystery gift.
The following contribution levels guarantee a package whereby the retail value will be double the contribution value.
<ul>
• $100 = bronze level
• $250 = silver level
• $500= gold level
• $1000 = platinum level
• $2000 = diamond level

Brands: Galliano, Ferre, Dolce and Gabbana, Hogan, Replay, Anthony Morato, Fendi, Calvin Klein, Dondup, Laura Biagiotti, Pinko, Blauer, Gucci, Chanel, Diesel, Braccialini, Bruno Magli, Burberry, Moncler, Tommy Hilfiger, Armani, Moschino, Pierre Cardin, Versace, Louis Vuitton, Valentino, Saint Laurent, Just Cavalli, Prada, Belstaff, Frankie Morello, Lolita and many more.
Please note that with your contribution you will have to provide your gender, age, size (clothing and shoes) and specify which countries size, eg: EU, US, AU etc.
Estimated Delivery: May 2013
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Please, spread the word and share so that we can make this venture a reality.

This summer, join a consortium of non-profits and neighborhood advocates as we seek to rebuild one of the city’s most historic neighborhoods—at the intersection of Benton and Linwood Boulevards—in Kansas City’s East.

Once home to some of Kansas City’s elite and most historic names—such as Satchel Paige, Walt Disney and Buck O’Neil—the historic neighborhoods that meet at this prominent intersection have endured decades of strife. But thanks to neighborhood advocates, this once-blighted intersection is undergoing a transformation into a beautiful neighborhood garden that seeks to erase blight and announce to neighbors, “We’re back and rebuilding!”

Starting in 2011, the U.S. Green Building Council Central Plains Chapter organized a design competition, which provided the plans for the start of the community beautification project. In 2012, more than $45,000 of infrastructure was put into the site, including a 2,500-gallon underground rainwater cistern, native plantings and walkways made of low-carbon concrete. This year, with your help, we seek to provide another $25,000 of improvements and set the stage for more work at the adjacent corners of the intersection.
Please help us meet our initial fundraising goal of $2,000 in contributions from supporters in order to receive the full $20,000 in grant funding from Community Capital Fund
Your gift will help to:
<ul>
• Re-invigorate the community to its historic charm.
• Establish a neighborhood vegetable garden.
• Plant a rain garden that addresses the stormwater runoff.
• Plant a small orchard.
• Add more planters and plantings.
• Host neighborhood workshops on gardening and canning.
• Create new plans to terraform adjacent blighted corners of the Benton-Linwood intersections.
Thank you for your generous gift and don’t forget to tell your friends!

/>

The Children’s Leukemia Foundation of Michigan (CLF) is thrilled to announce that we now have boots on the ground in Grand Rapids and will be opening up our office in the McKay Towers on May 1, 2013!

The only trouble is… we don’t have chairs to sit on, staplers to staple with, filing cabinets for our files or workstations. Help us make our office a home to complete our work of helping patients and families in the journey from diagnosis through treatment for leukemia, lymphoma and other blood-related cancers.
Be a key player by donating to our campaign to get our office up and running in Grand Rapids and help the 800 patients and their families that we serve in West Michigan.

column2: >What will the funds be used for?

column1: Our goal is to raise $12,500, which covers a portion of the expense required to furnish and supply the office with things like desks, chairs, conference tables, office supplies and everything that makes an office work. As the office gets built, we will share photos of how the office is evolving, and all contributors will be personally invited to the grand opening celebration! See how your contributions are helping our office grow from four walls to an inviting oasis that is here to provide comfort and help each person that walks through our doors. For your generosity, we offer different levels of “Thank You” gifts that will showcase how you’ve helped make a difference in the lives of our patients and families. Each contribution is 100% tax-deductible and will go directly to helping Michigan families battling blood-related cancers.

column2: >Why are we opening an office in Grand Rapids?

column1: CLF currently serves over 4,400 patients and their families across the state of Michigan.  While the organization was founded in Detroit 60 years ago, it now serves patients and their families across the entire state, with the largest concentration outside of metro Detroit in West Michigan. In order to serve more patients and families in the best way we know how – personal interaction – we will have a dedicated service worker in Grand Rapids to help provide assistance, in addition to coordinating activities like art therapy, respite events and volunteer projects.

column2: >Who is CLF, and what do they do?

column1: CLF is a non-profit organization that provides information, financial assistance and emotional support to Michigan families affected by leukemia, lymphoma and related blood cancers. For the past 60 years, CLF has worked to serve the practical and emotional needs of Michigan families as they navigate through their cancer journey – from diagnosis through treatment and beyond. We are a registered 501 (c) (3) organization that provides financial assistance, emotional support and recreational programs to patients and families. Donations made to CLF are tax-deductible!
We’re excited to be joining the West Michigan community and feel so welcomed by Grand Rapids. Check out some of the recent press we’ve received!

column2: sty=20200"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">WGVU Public Radio interview with CLF CEO/President Bill Seklar

column1: Grand Rapids Business Journal shares CLF Grand Rapid office opening news
Rapid Growth Media welcomes CLF’s Grand Rapids boots on the ground

If you have any questions regarding our new Grand Rapids satellite office or CLF’s services and mission, please contact Kristen West, Vice President of Patient Services, at kwest@leukemiamichigan.org. You can also visit our website or follow us on Facebook and Twitter.

You may not physically be here, but you’re touching the lives of everyone that walks through our doors. From the bottom of our hearts, and on behalf of the patients and families we serve, thank you for your support!

An online marketplace for bartering goods and services exclusively through barter/trade.
<div class=""full-description"">
“Every human benefit and enjoyment, every virtue, and every prudent act, is founded on compromise and barter.” – Edmund Burke

Mission Statement: It is the mission of A Barter World to provide an alternative economy of barter and trade to conventional monetary transactions while encouraging responsible habits of consumption and self-sustainment.
Purpose: A Barter World is a free public site that offers users a method of trading in goods and services on a local and global scale exclusively through barter and trade.

column3: >Legal services (Terms of service, tax services, copyrights and trademarks): $9,000

column1: Please visit the temporary site @ www.abarterworld.com for more information.

The idea to make this website came to me last November and since then I have been discussing it with anyone and everyone that would listen. I've taken feedback and criticisms, asked questions and taken advice. I have had the help of a great production crew and web development team who have helped me work out the functionality of the site, promotion techniques, and logistics. I have full confidence that we can produce a site that will help people and help make the world a better place.

As for the Barter World celebration show: I have booked local Bands: Hoot Hoots, The Torn ACLs and possibly a third band (tbd). This show will take place at the Jewelbox Theater in downtown Seattle, date is still TBD (End of July-Beginning of August). If you would like to come to this show please rsvp to me (abarterworld@gmail.com). *Note: Please rsvp only if you plan on being there as space is limited!

Purpose: A Barter World is a free public site that offers users a method of trading in goods and services on a local and global scale exclusively through barter and trade.
Costs:
Building of site: $10,000
Legal services (Terms of service, tax services, copyrights and trademarks): $9,000
Crowdfunding fees: $2,000
Incentives and Promotion: $1000
Please visit the temporary site @ www.abarterworld.com for more information.

The idea to make this website came to me last November and since then I have been discussing it with anyone and everyone that would listen. I've taken feedback and criticisms, asked questions and taken advice. I have had the help of a great production crew and web development team who have helped me work out the functionality of the site, promotion techniques, and logistics. I have full confidence that we can produce a site that will help people and help make the world a better place.

As for the Barter World celebration show: I have booked local Bands: Hoot Hoots, The Torn ACLs and possibly a third band (tbd). This show will take place at the Jewelbox Theater in downtown Seattle, date is still TBD (End of July-Beginning of August). If you would like to come to this show please rsvp to me (abarterworld@gmail.com). *Note: Please rsvp only if you plan on being there as space is limited!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","seattle, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/a-barter-world--3/pica

Short Summary
<ul>

• My name is Martin Kibera, I am born and raised in Kenya.  My home is a slum called Kawangware, which is home to more than one hundred thousand people.  Imagine how many kids live in this small village, almost all whose parents are making less than $5/day.  I make a living by performing as a freestyle footballer, which has given me the opportunity to travel within and outside of Kenya.  I started a soccer and empowerment program for kids in my village as a way to give back to the society.

• The kids in my program lack opportunity due to little money and limited education by their parents.  My program surrounds the kids with positive role models, encourages them to work hard, and nurtures their talent.  We are now raising funds for our boys and girls soccer team to travel to two East Africa tournaments 8-12 hours outside of Nairobi.  This is an opportunity for the kids to learn new soccer and life skills, see their beautiful country, and get mentorship that can guide them through life.  .  ,

• We will deeply appreciate any support because it will make our kids dreams become a reality.  By providing the incentive of travel and competition it teaches them the value of discipline and hard work.
<h3>What We Need &amp
Break it down for folks in more detail:
• We aim to raise 1000 dollars,which will cover the cost of food,  transport ($20/child * 25 children), accomodation ($5/night per child), food and water.
The Impact
<ul><li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >The Gatina Youth and Empowerment program is a valued program in the community because it  supports the needy and disadvantaged kids, helps them  achieve their unfulfilled dreams and keeps them out of bad company.  Our program keeps kids out of drugs, crime and corrouption and instead transforms them to become educated and hard-working youths who contribute to the society.

column1: Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
• Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!

And that’s all there is to it.

Oui Desserts is the start of a new retail concept where charity and profit are equals...
Like most ambitious people, we all want to be successful, but at what cost? We all want to give back to the community and the world, but how?

After being in the retail business for over a decade, it was time to give back. We are not necessarily creating a nonprofit, but a more balanced business structure where owners, shareholders, employees, customers, and the community all win.
Simply put, we will donate 75% of our profits to a fund where we can all pick our charity or directly fund impacting projects.
What We Need

Our concept is to give back, so let’s start the circle with you! We will use $50,000 for the basic startup of a kitchen bakery build out. The capital will be used to purchase equipment, construction cost, and inventory purchases.
We have already invested our own capital to secure the lease, hire architects and designers, and initiate permitting and construction. Now we need you.
What You Get
Whatever you fund, we will match it with goods!
If we do not reach our goal, funding will still go towards concept and our perk still stands.
The Impact

Having own a couple of restaurants, we know firsthand the business as well as its margins, profit that is. Let’s just say profits could get ridiculously high. As business owners, what is enough? When is satisfaction? It is our responsibility to make the change.

Responsible ownership means simply spreading the wealth. We are still making money, just at a slower rate. This is our beta. With your help, we would like to implement this to all of our future concepts.
You as the consumer can make a difference by simply choosing where you spend. Call it indirect giving.

This is just the beginning. Now imagine if all businesses adopted this, from the small entrepreneur to the large multinational corporations. A new capitalism where the Forbes list would consist of who donated the most. Imagine a fund so large, we can solve anything.
Spread the word. It has to start somewhere…

Since
1979, Tu Casa, Inc. has served child and adult victims of domestic and sexual
violence from throughout the 6 rural counties of the San Luis Valley,
Colorado.<span>  In order to fully reach
its vision of <i>empowering children and
adults to live healthy, violence-free lives, Tu Casa and more than 24 of
its area partners have come together the create the Children’s Advocacy Center
of the San Luis Valley (SLV CAC), a program specifically <b>designed to ensure child abuse victims (primarily child sexual abuse)
are not revictimized by the systems designed to protect them.
Although
Tu Casa’s building still needs to be renovated to house all of the SLV CAC’s
services under one child-friendly roof, the need for the program’s services was
too great to wait – since 2013, Tu Casa’s family advocate and forensic
interviews have served <b>over 90 children
(primarily victims of sexual abuse) and their non-offending caregivers from
throughout the 8,000+ sq. mile region! Support of this program ensures that
children who may or may not have been abused have a VOICE and receive the care
that they NEED and DESERVE.
What We Need &
In
order to create and SUSTAIN the SLV CAC, over $840,000 is needed.<span>  GREAT NEWS!  We have already raised 96% of this and NOW need your help to
raise the remaining funds needed to make this VISION A REALITY FOR
OUR CHILDREN.  We have some perks
that might encourage your investment, but hopefully you will get a sense of
being an investor in the healthy lives of the children that need us most.
The Impact
In 2011, Alamosa County
child abuse rates were 3 times the Colorado state average!  Child abuse victims were forced to
undergo a repetitive interviewing process of up to 6 interviews per disclosure
at either a police department or department of social service, both places that
often time carry negative or scary connotations for children. The nearest
Children’s Advocacy Center was in Pueblo, almost  hours away and often unreachable during winter months.  Couple these inadequate existing
conditions with the fact that the number of adult victims of domestic and
sexual violence continues to increase in the region – as much as 18% per year,
and that 75% of these adult victims reported that their experiences of child
physical, sexual and/or emotional abuse influenced their propensity to engage
in unhealthy adult relationships – <b>WE
HAVE A SERIOUS PROBLEM!!!!!
Tu
Casa has a strong history of serving those most vulnerable through the San Luis
Valley region since 1979. <b>Our staff,
volunteers and Board of Directors are dedicated to crossing county lines and
cultural barriers to ensuring victims have access to the services and resources
they so desperately need.
Child abuse victims
are more likely to suffer from a variety of physical, emotional and behavioral
problems as a result of their abuse.<span>
These issues are often further exacerbated when children never receive
mental health care or validation regarding their lack of blame in relation to
their abuse.  <b>We don’t want the children of our community to carry the burden that is
child abuse – we want them to know that they did nothing wrong and that they
can heal and go on to live healthy, violence-free lives.  YOU can help us do that.
Other Ways You Can Help
We
understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but that doesn’t
mean you can’t help:
<ul>
<li>Help us spread
the word! Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by
sending it to your friends and family. Try out the Indiegogo share tools!
<li>Be an advocate
for children – get informed about child abuse and how to prevent it by
visiting our website (www.slvtucasa.net) or the website
of a Children’s Advocacy Center in your area.<span>
Alone we can do so little
column2: together, we can do so much. – Helen Keller

Short Summary

My name is Cheryl Graham and I recently graduated from Life Chiropractic College West in Hayward, California. I am living the dream! I have made a career change at 42 years old to serve people and communities to the highest power. I am eager to share the gift of chiropractic with as many people as possible. I want to share the chiropractic philosophy about innate intellegence and the ability to heal from the inside without drugs and surgery, and show how peoples lives can change physically, emotionally, and spiritually under chiropractic care. Part of living this dream involves travelling to Treasure Beach in Jamaica this June to a retreat where i will not only get the opportunity to serve a community but also rejuvenate and heal myself after 4 years of intense grad school. I am beyond excited and inspired about this trip and could really use some help manifesting this dream.

Globalivity is the group of chiropractors and chiropractic students that I will be joining on this retreat. Feel free to check out Globalivity on line if you would like to learn more about this amazng group that brings the much needed chiropractic care to a community in need of this service.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

Since I recently graduated and I'm living off student loans, I almost decided not to go on this trip because of the financial stress but realized I have to go. I am being called to do this and must make it manifest. Thank you for credit cards. lol. I would be beyond grateful for any help and support I receive from this campaign.

My entire trip will cost me around $2800.00 ($1,200 for flight and $1600 for ground transport, food, and lodging), so I have set a goal of $2300.00, which still sounds like a lot of money to ask for because it is hard for me to ask for help. Twenty three is my favorite number and brings me good luck, so that how I decided on $2,300.

I am so inspired and excited about travelling to a country I have not been to, sharing my craft of chiropractic with appreciative families, and to rejuvenate myself with yoga, meditation, delicious organic meals in beautiful Jamaica.
<div>
The Impact

I know everyone is probably financially struggling right now, but any amount you can donate with be so appreciated and will be going to a cause of spreading healing to a much need community which I will then come home rested, on fire, and ready to serve locally. This gives me the opportunity to really honor the choices I have made, truly step into the art of chiropractic, and do what I love-serving and loving.
<div>
If you are unable to donate please share this campaign with anyone you feel may be interested through any social internet form.
Or...send me positive energy, or strength, love, hugs, or anything you can.
I appreciate all of you more than words can express and I am so thankful for you taking the time to read my campaign.
Share, love, connect, and honor your true essence!
Much love!

Our Goal
our fundraiser, we, the Bolivian skate club ""Asociación de
Skateboard de La Paz"", and ""MAKE LIFE SKATE LIFE"", a
registered German NGO, aim to construct the Skate-House Community
Center for the upcoming Pura Pura Skatepark. All funds raised will be
used for local building materials along with the workforce for the
construction of the Skate-House.
The Pura Pura Skatepark
Pura is a forested ecological and recreational park in La Paz,
Bolivia, accessible to both the City of La Paz and the adjacent City
of El Alto. The skatepark will be built from the 28th of March until
the 19th of April 2014 with the help of an international team of
volunteer skatepark constructors, and which could not have been
possible without the vital support of Levi’s Skateboarding and the
City of La Paz.

column2: >Why the Skate-House Community Center at the Pura Pura Skatepark?

column1: feel that skateboarding can positively impact the life of young
people and children. At the Pura Pura Skatepark, we want to combine
skateboarding with a variety of activities that involve subjects such
as languages and literacy,
arts/craftsmanship, and environmental awareness.
column2: >A Skate-House for a Lasting Impact at the Pura Pura Skatepark!

column1: the Skate-House we can ensure that a safe, open and inspiring
environment is established at the Pura Pura Skatepark. We will have
trained personnel present to manage the Skate-House, and we will
provide free-use skateboards and protective gear. This structure will
also be crucial to the establishment of the first official
skate-school in Bolivia. With this building as a home-base, we will
be able to enhance the development of individuals, youth clubs,
communities, and more, along with creating employment opportunities.
to donors, we are offering original t-shirts, skateboards, and
various traditional Bolivian clothing, textiles and accessories (e.g.
hats, purses, scarves, finger puppets for children, alpaca wool
sweaters and ponchos).

column2: >A special thank you goes out to The Directorate of

column1: Sports of the Autonomous Municipal Government of La Paz - who shares
our vision for the Pura Pura Skatepark, to Levi’s Skateboarding -
the sponsor of the “Builder’s Jam” for the skatepark build, to
skate-aid - who is making skate and safety gear available, and to
Lovenskate from the UK - who is producing our Pura Pura Campaign
t-shirts and skateboards.

column2: >Thank you very much for your interest in our

column1: campaign, for your contribution, for volunteering on site, for
supporting our cause in any imaginable way, and for spreading the
word.
We are looking forward to your involvement in
this project and hope to see you in La Paz!
Skatepark Pura Pura Centro Comunitario - Bolivia

<h4><i><a href=""https://vimeo.com/86192849"" rel=""noopener nofollow""> <div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fplayer.vimeo.com%2Fvideo%2F86294181&amp
nosotros, el club boliviano de skate ""Asociación de Skateboard
de La Paz"", y ""MAKE LIFE SKATE LIFE"", una ONG
registrada alemana, compartimos la meta de construir la ""Casa
del Skate Centro Comunitario"" para el proyectado Skatepark de
Pura Pura. Todos los fondos recaudados serán utilizados para los
materiales locales de construcción, junto con la mano de obra para
la construcción de la Casa de Skate.

column2: >Pura Pura es un parque ecológico y

column1: recreativo ubicado en La Paz, Bolivia. El lugar es accesible tanto
para la ciudad de La Paz como para la ciudad de El Alto. El skatepark
se construirá a partir del 28 de marzo de 2014, esperando concluirlo
hasta el 19 de abril del mismo año, con la ayuda de un equipo
internacional de constructores voluntarios expertos en la
construcción de skateparks, y que no podría haber sido posible sin
el apoyo vital de Levi's Skateboarding y el Gobierno Autónomo
Municipal de La Paz.
¿Por Qué la Casa del Skate Centro Comunitario en el Skatepark de Pura Pura?
puede impactar positivamente en la vida de los jóvenes y los niños.
En el Skatepark de Pura Pura, queremos combinar el skate con una
variedad de actividades que involucran temas como idiomas y la alfabetización, artes/artesanía,
y la protección del medio ambiente.
La Casa del Skate, ¡Para Mantener un Impacto a Largo Plazo en el Skatepark de Pura Pura!
podremos establecer un ambiente seguro, abierto e inspirador en el
Skatepark de Pura Pura. Tendremos un personal capacitado para la
gerencia de la Casa del Skate, y le proporcionaremos gratuitamente
las patinetas y equipos de protección. Esta estructura también será
esencial para la creación de la primera escuela oficial de skate en
Bolivia. Con este edificio como base, vamos a poder mejorar el
desarrollo de individuos, clubes juveniles, comunidades, y más, así
como la creación de oportunidades de empleo.
Regalos, Participación y Apoyo

column2: >Como un gesto de agradecimiento a los donantes, les estamos

column1: ofreciendo camisetas originales, tablas de skate, y diversas prendas
bolivianas tradicionales, textiles y accesorios, (por ejemplo,
gorros, bolsos, bufandas, títeres de dedo para los niños, suéteres
de lana de alpaca y ponchos).
Nuestro especial agradecimiento a la Dirección de Deportes del
Gobierno Autónomo Municipal de La Paz - que comparte nuestra visión
para el Skatepark de Pura Pura, a Levi's Skateboarding - patrocinador
del ""Convenio de Constructores"" (Builder's Jam) para la
construcción del skatepark, a skate-aid - quién está donando
patinetas y equipos de protección, y a Lovenskate del Reino Unido
- que está produciendo nuestras tablas y camisetas para la campaña de
la ""Casa del Skate"" en el Skatepark de Pura Pura.

column2: >Muchas gracias por su interés en nuestra campaña, por su

column1: contribución, por el voluntariado durante la obra de construcción,
por apoyar este emprendimiento en cualquier forma imaginable, y por
la difusión de esta causa.
¡Anticipamos su participación en este
proyecto y ¡esperamos vernos en La Paz!

With
the Skate-House we can ensure that a safe, open and inspiring
environment is established at the Pura Pura Skatepark. We will have
trained personnel present to manage the Skate-House, and we will
provide free-use skateboards and protective gear. This structure will
also be crucial to the establishment of the first official
skate-school in Bolivia. With this building as a home-base, we will
be able to enhance the development of individuals, youth clubs,
communities, and more, along with creating employment opportunities. Rewards, Participation, and Support
As a thank you
to donors, we are offering original t-shirts, skateboards, and
various traditional Bolivian clothing, textiles and accessories (e.g.
hats, purses, scarves, finger puppets for children, alpaca wool
sweaters and ponchos).
A special thank you goes out to The Directorate of
Sports of the Autonomous Municipal Government of La Paz - who shares
our vision for the Pura Pura Skatepark, to Levi’s Skateboarding -
the sponsor of the “Builder’s Jam” for the skatepark build, to
skate-aid - who is making skate and safety gear available, and to
Lovenskate from the UK - who is producing our Pura Pura Campaign
t-shirts and skateboards.
Thank you very much for your interest in our
campaign, for your contribution, for volunteering on site, for
supporting our cause in any imaginable way, and for spreading the
word.
We are looking forward to your involvement in
this project and hope to see you in La Paz!
Skatepark Pura Pura Centro Comunitario - Bolivia
Nuestra Meta
Con la recaudación de fondos,
nosotros, el club boliviano de skate ""Asociación de Skateboard
de La Paz"", y ""MAKE LIFE SKATE LIFE"", una ONG
registrada alemana, compartimos la meta de construir la ""Casa
del Skate Centro Comunitario"" para el proyectado Skatepark de
Pura Pura. Todos los fondos recaudados serán utilizados para los
materiales locales de construcción, junto con la mano de obra para
la construcción de la Casa de Skate.
El Skatepark de Pura Pura
Pura Pura es un parque ecológico y
recreativo ubicado en La Paz, Bolivia. El lugar es accesible tanto
para la ciudad de La Paz como para la ciudad de El Alto. El skatepark
se construirá a partir del 28 de marzo de 2014, esperando concluirlo
hasta el 19 de abril del mismo año, con la ayuda de un equipo
internacional de constructores voluntarios expertos en la
construcción de skateparks, y que no podría haber sido posible sin
el apoyo vital de Levi's Skateboarding y el Gobierno Autónomo
Municipal de La Paz.
¿Por Qué la Casa del Skate Centro Comunitario en el Skatepark de Pura Pura?
Sentimos que la actividad de skateboard
puede impactar positivamente en la vida de los jóvenes y los niños.
En el Skatepark de Pura Pura, queremos combinar el skate con una
variedad de actividades que involucran temas como idiomas y la alfabetización, artes/artesanía,
y la protección del medio ambiente.
La Casa del Skate, ¡Para Mantener un Impacto a Largo Plazo en el Skatepark de Pura Pura!
Con la ""Casa del Skate""
podremos establecer un ambiente seguro, abierto e inspirador en el
Skatepark de Pura Pura. Tendremos un personal capacitado para la
gerencia de la Casa del Skate, y le proporcionaremos gratuitamente
las patinetas y equipos de protección. Esta estructura también será
esencial para la creación de la primera escuela oficial de skate en
Bolivia. Con este edificio como base, vamos a poder mejorar el
desarrollo de individuos, clubes juveniles, comunidades, y más, así
como la creación de oportunidades de empleo.
Regalos, Participación y Apoyo
Como un gesto de agradecimiento a los donantes, les estamos
ofreciendo camisetas originales, tablas de skate, y diversas prendas
bolivianas tradicionales, textiles y accesorios, (por ejemplo,
gorros, bolsos, bufandas, títeres de dedo para los niños, suéteres
de lana de alpaca y ponchos).
Nuestro especial agradecimiento a la Dirección de Deportes del
Gobierno Autónomo Municipal de La Paz - que comparte nuestra visión
para el Skatepark de Pura Pura, a Levi's Skateboarding - patrocinador
del ""Convenio de Constructores"" (Builder's Jam) para la
construcción del skatepark, a skate-aid - quién está donando
patinetas y equipos de protección, y a Lovenskate del Reino Unido
- que está produciendo nuestras tablas y camisetas para la campaña de
la ""Casa del Skate"" en el Skatepark de Pura Pura.
Muchas gracias por su interés en nuestra campaña, por su
contribución, por el voluntariado durante la obra de construcción,
por apoyar este emprendimiento en cualquier forma imaginable, y por
la difusión de esta causa.
¡Anticipamos su participación en este
proyecto y ¡esperamos vernos en La Paz!",4.0,1,"1 Campaign
|","La Paz, Bolivia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pura-pura-skatepark-community-center-bolivia/pica

<h3><span style=""font-size: 10px
<div>

Hello, I am Amie Cuhaciyan a single mom and an avid traveler who has worked and played in Japan. After getting the itch to travel to Japan again I was shocked to see how much tours in Japan cost and decided that I could offer a much deeper experience at a far friendlier cost. I hate guided tours, so I wanted to offer something different. My staff and I will be there for you but we will give you enough room and time to explore on your own. I believe that a bit of the unknown is a really important aspect of immersing yourself in an experience. By having a guide take you somewhere, but giving you the freedom to explore what interests you makes a richer more personalized experience. It also puts the explorer in touch with the locals more and you never know who you might bump into or what you may find!

The first tour I would like to offer would take you from Tokyo to the Mountain town of Hida Takayama where the beef is the best you can get (move over Kobe beef!) and the atmosphere is of the Edo period. Then we go to Shizuoka prefecture to see great views of Mt. Fuji, see where Tokugawa used to reside and have a relaxing day at a seaside hot spring resort before heading back to Tokyo. All breakfasts and half 2 dinners and traditional sweets and tea at Tora-ya included.
Travel Itinerary
Day 1: Your arrival to Narita Airport! Welcome to Japan. You will be met at the airport and taken to the hotel. The night is yours to explore.
Day 2: Spend the morning in Asakusa and visit Senoji Temple. We will then head to the Ginza, and Tora-ya for some Wagashi and tea.  After which you will have free time to do as your heart desires.
Day 3 : We will see faith full Hachiko at Shibuya station before taking the bullet train as we head to Gero onsen.  Once we get to the onsen, the day is yours to rest and walk around as you please.

Day 4: Take a short jaunt to Hida Takayama. You will be given a layout of the town and given the option to head out on your own or follow your guide as she checks out the local sake shop, temples, merchant’s houses and shops. (Don't miss out on the Hida Beef Buns!) Other options include hiking, seeing the floats museum and visit Shirakawa-go a beautiful world heritage site. At night you can enjoy the onsen and local delicacies.

Day 5 : Head out to the morning market before heading to Shizuoka. In Shizuoka we will take in Sunpu Park the home of Shogun Tokugawa Ieyasu. We will head to Miho no Matsubara the home of the Tennyo Legend. There you will see grand Mt.Fuji in its entire splendor. The afternoon will be spent in Shimizu exploring the Ginza and getting some of the freshiest Sushi. Shimizu is known for its Maguro Tuna.

Day 6: We will head to Okitsu or Abe-kawa, depending on people's preference. I am trying to secure some time to visit Shizuhatayaki ( a famous potter in the area known for its demon and goddess cups). In the early afternoon we will head for out last stop
column2: Izu kogen and stay at a beautiful Ryokan and have delicious Kaiseki. Enjoy the atmosphere and the onsen.

column1: Day 7: Head home.
Tours in the works:
I am happy to now offer a day trip to Shizuoka, the prefecture that is home to Mt. Fuji, with host mom and guide Keiko, who will take you around to a couple of hot spots and make you dinner!
<ul>
• Pick up and drop off from Shizuoka station limited to 4 people once a month
<ul>
• A food tour including the major 5 foods tempura, sushi, soba, udon and ramen. Plus much more
• A handi-capable tour for thoes with special needs especially wheel chair accessable.
• A spiritual tour: includes spending the night at temples, some of the most holy spots in Japan and possible Reiki healings
• Also regional tours including a northen tour, a southern tour and a grand tour of Japan from top to bottom!
What We Need &

Funding will be going towards set up cost of the business such as website development, advertising, and the upfront cost to travel with the first tour group I put together.  I will also need to be in Japan to hire a tour guide and want to pay them a livable wage.
Our unique perks include a small gift, travel consultations, and heavily discounted travel.
If the goal of $4000 isn't reached the funds will be going to licensing and liability insurance in addition to website development if possible.
The Impact

Japan is a country I fell in love with and I want to share that love with others in an affordable way. The shocking 2011 Earthquake and Tsunami has taken a toll on tourism in Japan and I have had people ask me if it is safe enough to visit. The answer is YES! We should visit and show our support which will help Japan economically to rebuild what was lost. With that I would like to donate a percent of my profit to Peace Winds Japan as I have personally donated with them before and believe in their work to help Tohoku recover.
Other Ways You Can Help
Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Indiegogo has great share tools so please take a second to tell everyone you know about us!
I also would love to hear where you would like to visit in Japan and the things you would like to do there, so I can plan for more interesting tours in the future.
We also have a Youtube channel you can watch and share: http://youtu.be/YOndBBCcSSY
or visit us on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/travelingsakura?fref=ts
I will also be having a monthly travel clinics in Meridian Idaho.

Short Summary

By way of introduction, I’m a retired USAF non-commissioned officer who is passionate about mass media. For the last 12 years I had been involved in the  publishing business, but last year I decided I wanted to do something about helping people save money on their prescription drug cost.

I found a major PBM (Pharmacy Benefits Manager) who agreed to provide their Pharmacy Discount Card to consumers at NO cost, NO Sign-up, NO restrictions, and of course, NO gimmicks. To date, we’ve saved consumers over $30,000.

I am especially excited about this opportunity with Indiegogo and this campaign to provide 1,000,000 Free Pharmacy Discount Cards at No Cost to consumers. These cards are not insurance. But, they allow cardholders to save up-to 85% off the cost of their prescriptions.

This campaign allows humanity to stand up for things we believe in – like, helping those who can least afford to pay for their prescriptions. I remember an aunt, cutting her pills in half because she couldn’t afford the whole pill on a daily basis. My aunt has long since died, but the memory haunts me.
What We Need &

To meet our goal of making 1,000,000 Free Pharmacy Discount Cards here’s what we need: $12,500 for the printing of high quality UV coated 14 pt cards. Another 12,500 for about 1,200 man hours in fabricating our Free Take-one Card holders which we will place in hospitals, medical centers, doctor offices, dental clinics, rec centers, Senior day care centers and the like. Finally, we’ll need about $25,000 to pay trained distributors, $1 for each card holder they place.

These 1,000,000 cards will be available in some 25,000 locations when completed. Should this campaign fall short of our goal, all the funds raised will be put to use on the same basis as $1,000 per 20,000 Free Pharmacy Discount Card.
The Impact

Healthcare is a hot-button issue these days, and millions of people find it increasingly difficult to address rising medical and insurance costs. Yet many are unaware that help is readily available in the form of a Free Pharmacy Discount Cards. Cards that are free, require no forms, have no limits, are available to all, and could net an average savings of 24 percent or more on a card holder’s annual prescriptions is all about telling-not selling. The [Neylandville Healthco] Free Pharmacy Discount Cards created by our PBM partner – is not an insurance plan, as is similar pharmacy benefit cards but like other similar pharmacy benefit cards they are accepted at over 60,000 pharmacies nationwide. There are no age or income restrictions. It cannot be used in conjunction with a cardholder’s insurance plan, but it can provide significant savings on prescriptions that insurance doesn’t cover. This is particularly good news for everyone, especially for seniors as the prescription card can help fill gaps left by Medicare.

Our success has been made evident is the progress we have made over the last year. With over 200,000 Free Pharmacy Discount Cards in 8 states across America, we’ve not waited to be about our business of helping people.
As a former airman, I understand the importance of team building and commitment to a task. If you donate over $100 we will send you a blue baseball cap with our logo.
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute financially, you can still help others save on their prescription cost by sending them to our website at: www.rxdiscount123.com/hta222

I am Debra Knapp Rinaldi.
Although a citizen of the United States of America, for health and economic
reasons I am currently living in Bali, Indonesia. I have a background in
Accounting, Business Management, Teaching, Website Creation and Management, and
have written and published a travel memoir.
After several trips to
Amed, East Bali, I feel compelled to help a family of 11 that I have met in desperate
need of assistance. At the age of 32, Wayan is solely responsible for
providing for his family. A family of eleven: himself, his wife, and 3
daughters, his mother and father, his grandmother and grandfather, and his
younger brother and sister.  It is up to him to provide food for all, as well as, money to pay for his brother’s and his daughter’s education.
Wayan is a fisherman without a
boat. The other fisherman, in his small village in economically depressed East Bali, keep his space on
the beach open in the hopes that he will someday be able to buy another fishing
boat and be able to once again provide a humble existance for his family.
Fishing is not only his
livelihood, but his passion.  He proudly told me how he could pull in
sometimes as many as 150 fish in a day.  In addition to having fish to
sell at the market, his family would have fish to add to their usual dish of rice
and sambal (chili sauce). In really tough times, they may eat rice with just

salt for a month at a time.

You may read more about Wayan and his family, as well as, see pictures of their living condition: no indoor plumbing, no refrigeration for food, they cook on an open fire pit, on Facebook at: www.facebook.com/FishermanFunds
Testimony
from a supporter: ""I've met Wayan, and he's the real thing, true to the
heart, and worthy of anyone's donation. A few dollars will go a long way. One
grand total will buy him a boat and a living for his whole family.” C.J.,
Canada
Thank you! Suksema! Debra
\
column7:
What You Get

We can collectively change their lives and help them to become self-sufficient once again. How? By making a donation to purchase a new fishing boat (Jukung).  The cost of a new boat is 25 million Rupiah or approximately USD 2,500. I have raised Rp 2.000.000 Rp or 200.USD via my Facebook Page, “Funds For A Fisherman.”  It will take 3 months to build the boat for Wayan.  I have met the boat maker and hope to return to Amed, East Bali with funds in hand to start construction as soon as possible. If I raise more than needed for Wayan's boat, I will purchase small pigs at the cost of Rp 500.000 or approximately USD 50. and give one to each family in the village.  After 6 months , they will have reached the size where they may be sold in the marketplace for Rp 3.000.000-Rp 6.000.000 or approximately USD 300.-600.! Wayan's neighbors have been helping to support him and his family for the past year.  It is my hope to  give back to the entire village! To read more about Wayan and his family, and alternative means of making a donation please visit: www.facebook.com/FishermanFunds 

If I don't reach my goal, Wayan has several alternatives. Currently he is trying to provide for his family by renting snorkeling gear to tourists,he has 2 sets.  We may   take the funds raised to purchase more snorkeling gear, or a beach chair set that he may rent to tourists. We may also purchase a small pig or two. But I am praying for funds for the boat and pigs for the other villagers.


The Impact

All over Bali the villagers share what they have, not only with their extended families, but with all in the village.  By helping Wayan and his family, we help the entire village. Eastern Bali, in particular, suffers from a lack of water, and most other ills of a third world country.  The children, some as young as 4 years, sell their wares on the beach for money for school books. The women (if not working in the home) work was masseuses on the beach, their husbands fish and work at serving the tourists in the form of guides, drivers, and renting beach chairs and snorkeling gear.
column9: >Wayan has no boat, no car, no scooter, no trekking boots.  He is managing to support his family by renting 2 sets of snorkeling gear, and with aid from his fellow villagers.  As Bali continues to loose its rice fields and beach front land to tourism, it is important to preserve the integrity
column10: > of Bali and to help all traditional Balinese become self-sufficient and to keep their children in school.
column15:
>Other Ways You Can Help

Please help Wayan and his fellow villagers by making a donation.  Any and all donations are helpful and greatly appreciated. Please share Wayan's story with your family and friends.

We may also purchase a small pig or two. But I am praying for funds for the boat and pigs for the other villagers.The ImpactAll over Bali the villagers share what they have, not only with their extended families, but with all in the village.  By helping Wayan and his family, we help the entire village. Eastern Bali, in particular, suffers from a lack of water, and most other ills of a third world country.  The children, some as young as 4 years, sell their wares on the beach for money for school books. The women (if not working in the home) work was masseuses on the beach, their husbands fish and work at serving the tourists in the form of guides, drivers, and renting beach chairs and snorkeling gear.    Wayan has no boat, no car, no scooter, no trekking boots.  He is managing to support his family by renting 2 sets of snorkeling gear, and with aid from his fellow villagers.  As Bali continues to loose its rice fields and beach front land to tourism, it is important to preserve the integrity of Bali and to help all traditional Balinese become self-sufficient and to keep their children in school.Other Ways You Can HelpPlease help Wayan and his fellow villagers by making a donation.  Any and all donations are helpful and greatly appreciated. Please share Wayan's story with your family and friends.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Amed, East Bali, Indonesia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/funds-for-a-fisherman/pica

DESCRIPTION:
When we go to see a Broadway Play, such as Peter Pan
column2: the actor is ‘flown’ around the stage using wires and pulleys. All this rigging is usually hidden from sight, much practice is needed, and equipment is subject to breakdown. Our company, Digital Theatrics not only solves the short comings of mechanical rigging, but is also a prerequisite for true development in to further dimensions.

column1: By utilize real-time, streaming, holographic technology, we can give a live stage actor (such as Peter Pan) supernatural powers!
Imagine an actor split in half, from head to toe
column2: the left side walks around the left side of a tree, the right side walks around the right side of a tree on stage
column3: on the other side their body seamlessly recombines back into a full actor! This cutting edge technology applied to the Performing Arts industry is sure to captivate audiences worldwide.

column1: Anything is possible
column2: we can bring late artist back to perform on a live stage, give actors the ability to morph into a different creature (like a centaur), besides characteristics such as: flying, invisibility, enlarging, shrinking, shoot out flames, and much more.

column1: ULTRA HIGH HOLOGRAPHIC STREAMING WILL REPLACE THIS MECHANICAL WAY OF CREATING A CENTAUR LIVE ON STAGE.
Divine and celestial entities can easily be incorporated into live plays. This opens up
column2: not only an easy translation from film to stage, but also a brand new form of entertainment.

column1: PURPOSE
Digital Theatrics is a start-up company which is bootstrapping from crowd sourcing that will enable us to register our business, create a web presence, and sell future stock.
We plan on opening the World’s 1st Holographic Performing Arts center at Niagara Falls, New York. This prototype will enable future licensed venues to be built globally.
Our team consists of myself, a Theatre Preservationist &
column3: acclaimed award winning Hollywood Producer, Mr. Paul David Rosenberg
column4: and we have partnered with many other entertainment professionals, to bring this cutting edge  technology to life.

column1: FUNDING

Entrepreneurs are much like ‘starving artists’ in so much as we have to support ourselves while still trying to fund our projects. To do so, we depend upon the generosity of people who we will serve in the future. Our start-up plan is raise enough money on Indiegogo to register our business and sell stock on Early Shares. This year, the Security &
column2: Exchange Commission (SEC) has allowed businesses to sell up $1,000,000 in stock dividends.

column1: The first $2,500 will go towards registering our business.
The next $5,000 is to file a design patent.
And any subsequent funds will be used as start up capital for building our prototype.
INCENTIVES

column2: >With the exception of Broadway plays, most businesses are started by high net worth individuals and corporations. Crowd Source Funding changes the status quos, by giving the general public an opportunity to join ground floor company development. As a service orientated company, we can offer certain incentives (like presently awarding plaques, but waiting for the seats to be built) that have future tangible rewards. This is some what like stock, and something like Broadway theaters offer patrons.

column1: Our incentive program is tailored as a remembrance of those visionaries who sought to further the future of Performing Arts, in which we are always indebted. It’s a small way of showing our appreciation for your support.
WE ENCOURAGE ALL VEIWERS TO ASK QUESTIONS~!
All of our supporters will receive our free e-newsletter, unless you opt out.
Thank You so much,
Jim Missall
Founder &

Digital Theatrics
