column1: ","Who We Are

Island Tree, LLC was established in 2011 by U.S. Navy veteran and entrepreneur Antonio Harris and Brandon Allen. The company was created to develop energy drinks and brands that cater to those that seek a healthier alternative to the highly caffeinated, and overly sugared products that have flooded today’s market. With more and more people understanding that what we put in our bodies can affect our moods, mental and physical health consumers are seeking products that fuel the body, mind and spirit in a healthier, more natural way. Our company is dedicated to providing functional beverages that satisfy our customers’ needs, while understanding the need to promote health. It is our commitment to ensure that product quality, customer service, and health awareness are goals that are constantly met in each product we create.
What We Sell

Island Tree’s primary focus is to create great tasting, market friendly, all natural beverage brands. Komodo Natural Energizer will be the first of many great brands to be developed by Island Tree, LLC. We strongly believe it is important consumers have beverage options that are truly healthy and appealing in taste. The Island Tree team is convinced that our products will resonate with those who chose to live a health conscious lifestyle. We are confident that this strategy will create a market trend that employs a focus on beverage functionality, natural ingredients, and overall calorie consumption. We also feel that since our first product Komodo Natural Energizer will be made from all natural ingredients, such as coconut water and carbonated spring water, our product will minimize certain risks associated with “over consumption”. Island Tree will operate as a Limited Liability Company, and will be managed by Antonio Harris (CEO) and Brandon Allen (COO).
Who We Sell To

The Komodo brand will concentrate on the downtown areas in the Chicago, IL region and also the Minneapolis, MN region. We chose these specific areas because of the ample amount of resources with store owners, and distributers in the region. We would also like to utilize the tourism sector in the region, which will play a vital role in the best type of advertising ""word of mouth"". We have verbal commitments from stores such as Walgreens, CVS, LA Fitness, and Target along with various independently owned stores. Our main focus is adults between the ages of 21-32yrs old who are active, working professionals seeking a healthier lifestyle.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Mankato, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-komodo-project/pica

A woman works in the morning as home care attendant. She rides the ""Hotel 22"" bus all night long for safety and security. Her sleep is interrupted each time the bus gets to the end of the line.  20 minutes shivering outside in the cold  and then back on the bus to sleep. She gets to WGP eats lunch and retreats to the fireside room for a couple of hours of uninterrupted sleep,

column2: >Sadly another comes with bruises on her arms and neck and tells her story of going to a motel room with someone she didn't know very well because she was so exhausted. When she refused his advances her exhaustion was replaced with a lifelong trauma. We offered her support and paid for a motel to give her time to disengage and connect with a DV shelter.
>A woman is saving her GA money to return home to Arizona. It will take her months but we were able to pay her way and give her a second chance.

>A woman comes to WGP with only the clothing on her back. Her possessions were stolen at her encampment and she hasn't been able to bath in a week. She is able to take a shower, shop at the Ooh La La Boutique and receive a Street Survival Backpack to start afresh.

column1: <span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
column5: >The Women’s Gathering Place where a woman without a home can find the support of other women, connect to vital services, and find respite, spiritual renewal, and joy when there is nowhere else to go but the street

column1: <div><span style=""font-family: 'Benton Sans', Helvetica, sans-serif
column3: >Women who are homeless, newly housed and lonely can come to WGP to:

column1: <ul>
• find a safe place and respite 3 afternoons a week
• get access to laundry and shower services through Dignity on Wheels
• shop in the Ooh La La  boutique
• take care of medical needs during weekly visits by the Garner Homeless Medical van
• participate in workshops that nourish the mind and heart
• share a communal meal donated by local caring women
• access vital community services such as homeless outreach
• leave refreshed and rejuvenated.
To request a receipt for your tax-deductible donation, please contact us at womensgatheringplace@gmail.com

She gets to WGP eats lunch and retreats to the fireside room for a couple of hours of uninterrupted sleep,

Sadly another comes with bruises on her arms and neck and tells her story of going to a motel room with someone she didn't know very well because she was so exhausted. When she refused his advances her exhaustion was replaced with a lifelong trauma. We offered her support and paid for a motel to give her time to disengage and connect with a DV shelter.
A woman is saving her GA money to return home to Arizona. It will take her months but we were able to pay her way and give her a second chance.

Amazing news! After some negotiation, we only need $11,000! I managed to convince the contractor/plumber to give us their house rate, instead of the apartment rate (for extra labor for transporting materials/working in an apartment)!
---
Short Summary
column3: >Aloha! I am a young Native Hawaiian woman, and I am asking for your help. I come from a very modest background, when my parents divorced my mother sold everything she owned - and within a week she had a job and managed to put a down payment on an apartment in the building she lives now. It's something that I still can't imagine that she managed to do, and it continually inspires me. Unfortunately, this place of love has been damaged badly.

column1: She eventually remarried several years later, but it wasn't meant to be. Her husband stopped working, began to drink, was mentally and emotionally abusive, and eventually became sexually and physically abusive. When I moved home, I threw him out, and we began repairing everything and everyone he had broken.

They are divorced, but the damage to the house remains and is a constant reminder. He ripped a hole in the bathroom ""intending to fix the plumbing"", but never did. This gaping hole has been here for over six years, and because of that we can't take showers for longer than 5 minutes otherwise the entire apartment will flood and it will go into the apartment below. The mirror is falling out of the wall, and the shelves inside it are broken because of his tantrums, the pan beneath the bathtub is busted (the original plumbing problem he was ""going to fix""). Essentially, the entire bathroom needs to be ripped out and redone.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Since we finally have a reasonable quote (after getting several others), we need at least $15,000 to account for the job itself and incidental work. Anything raised above that amount, will go towards paying off my mother's renal cancer medical bills. Even if we can't reach our goal, it will go towards repairing the bathroom anyway, in a savings account.

column1: Unfortunately we can't afford to give you anything in return, aside from unending gratitude.

The Impact

This home she made for us, started out with very little. We didn't have any furniture, we slept on the floor, sometimes we didn't have food, but we had a home. We have come very far - although her quality of life hovers just above poverty. Unfortunately, I can't stay here forever, I have to leave again. I want to leave knowing that my mom won't have this terrible reminder woven into her every day. I have to leave knowing that she'll be okay.

I stayed so that she would feel safe again, and through the few years I replaced her stove (as the previous one had only one working burner), her refrigerator (which could barely keep anything cool), and helped repair her transportation situation since her ex-husband also completely destroyed her first car, and then her second car. It has been a real struggle. You would be making a huge, real difference in our lives - in her life.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

The biggest risks are if we are unable to cover extra labor for working in a building. It is a challenge getting the materials up and down floors, as well as disposing of the excess. There's also the concern if something goes wrong with the plumbing, we may run into an emergency situation.

column1: The biggest challenge is getting it done on time. Since we won't have anywhere to bathe, it will be really difficult since we both work fulltime. The best time to do this would be in two months when she's on a business trip, and I will be able to bathe in the locker rooms at school.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please share this if you can! It would mean the world to me. And, please don't think certain amounts are too small to donate! From a few cents, to $20, it all makes a real difference!

Short Summary

Hi Everyone!

My name is Rande James and I am in the Makeup &
column2:
Skincare business

I am looking to further my education in the beauty field so that I can provide my customers with the cutting edge anti-aging and skincare treatments.  With this new level license I will be able to perform a higher level facial services to add to my current makeup and skincare expertise.

By helping me fund this campaign, you will not only be affording me a higher level education but you will also be contributing to providing a better service to you, my customer.


What I Need &
column3:
What You Get

Here's what I need to accomplish this goal.

I am looking for $6500.00 to complete the schools requirements needed to gain my new licensure.

What's more exciting is what you will receive as gifts (perks) when you donate.

Based on the amount you donate you will receive some of my great skincare and makeup products and/or services that will leave you feeling nurtured, pampered and BEAUTIFUL!  It's just like you are paying upfront for your perks and helping me achieve my goal at the same time!

If by some far fetched chance I do not reach the goal, all donations will be put toward the next semester in 2015.  But It would be great if I could complete the requirements in November 2014 by reaching the goal.

Are you with me? YESSSSS!

The Impact

By completing this course I will be able to give a greater level of service to the public.
Here are just some of the added services that will be available:

column1: <ul>
• Microdermabrasion
• Photo Rejuvenation
• Hair Removal
• Aromatherapy
• Medical Esthetics
• Body Wrapping
• Red Light Therapy

Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
column2: >Spread the word and make some noise about my campaign to all of your friends and family.
column3: >Share the campaign on all of your social media: Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin etc.
column4:
>And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Thank  you in advance for your donation!

Short Summary

Creating a SUCCESSFUL website is EXPENSIVE! Who knew???? Probably everyone but me. I thought it would be alot of work but WOW. I CLEARLY had no idea what I was doing and had alot to learn and right now my website sucks compared to others on the same topic, I am a bookkeeper in my everday job, but after a looney arsonist burned down my place of employment TWICE in 6 months
column3: id=8737458 I thought ""hmmmm maybe I better concentrate a little more on my website""

column1: I became involved in clipping coupons to save my family much need money, and it worked! It became a wonderful hobby that also really helped me cut down on our grocery bills and every day use items. The more I learned the more I realized I would love to have my own website to help promote money saving ideas and hopefully make some extra income, some of these couponing websites are VERY popular. I learned everything I could about starting a blog/website (even read blogging for dummies lol) and soon I made a website www.extremequeenscouponing.com. I soon realized that running a website and keeping up with the competition was actually very time consuming (which I don't mind) but also very costly. I am a mother and I have a job (btw my office was burned down twice by arson in the last 6 month, so I have not had time to put 100% in my site, but I am trying to now) I do not mind putting the time into working on my site, but as time went on I became frustrated.....the idea was to hopefully save money and make a little extra money.....not cost an arm and a leg. I realized that I need to update my site and have apps and features that other successful websites have if I am going to ever make anything out of this.

When you go to my website or any coupon website to print a coupon you will be directed to install the coupon printer download, it is not a virus, it will not hurt your computer it just allows you to print the coupons, the coupon printer is what puts the barcode for the discount on your coupon.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp
For every 36 coupons prinited from my website I earn approx. $1.00, if a few people print I will have hit my goal in now time.

Here is where I am asking for support and help.......a monetary donoation is greatly appreciated, but the best way for me to raise the money to update my website and it will not cost anyone any money out of pocket is for the people to go to my web page www.extremequeenscouponing.com and print coupons, its free, you get a coupon for hopefully something you need and I am paid a small commission on every coupon printed,there are links on the sidebar of my site (the blue coupon bar is the best one) it really is only pennies but pennies add up and the more coupons printed the more money I earn to add costly features like printable lists, easier navagation buttons (some of these add on features are 400-500 dollars) and can update my site enough to be desirable, benefical and successful. Right now the site everages about $19.00 a month :(, a far cry from making enough for upgrades and make the site much more useful.

I would love to add coupon databases, a section for DYI crafts and projects, Recipes, and of course money saving links of all kinds, my passion is to see this webite graow and succeed to its best place possible.

I have read through so many of the campaigns, and they are all in great need of help, some are truly heartbreaking, I wish I could contribute to every one of them, so hopefully my campaign will raise money for my site, but not take away from some else in need, its just a click away and FREE
Thank you Thank you Thank you for any support!!!!
<div>
","Short Summary

Creating a SUCCESSFUL website is EXPENSIVE! Who knew???? Probably everyone but me. I thought it would be alot of work but WOW. I CLEARLY had no idea what I was doing and had alot to learn and right now my website sucks compared to others on the same topic, I am a bookkeeper in my everday job, but after a looney arsonist burned down my place of employment TWICE in 6 months http://abclocal.go.com/ktrk/story?section=news/local&id=8737458 I thought ""hmmmm maybe I better concentrate a little more on my website""

I became involved in clipping coupons to save my family much need money, and it worked! It became a wonderful hobby that also really helped me cut down on our grocery bills and every day use items. The more I learned the more I realized I would love to have my own website to help promote money saving ideas and hopefully make some extra income, some of these couponing websites are VERY popular. I learned everything I could about starting a blog/website (even read blogging for dummies lol) and soon I made a website www.extremequeenscouponing.com. I soon realized that running a website and keeping up with the competition was actually very time consuming (which I don't mind) but also very costly. I am a mother and I have a job (btw my office was burned down twice by arson in the last 6 month, so I have not had time to put 100% in my site, but I am trying to now) I do not mind putting the time into working on my site, but as time went on I became frustrated.....the idea was to hopefully save money and make a little extra money.....not cost an arm and a leg. I realized that I need to update my site and have apps and features that other successful websites have if I am going to ever make anything out of this.

When you go to my website or any coupon website to print a coupon you will be directed to install the coupon printer download, it is not a virus, it will not hurt your computer it just allows you to print the coupons, the coupon printer is what puts the barcode for the discount on your coupon.
What We Need & What You Get
For every 36 coupons prinited from my website I earn approx. $1.00, if a few people print I will have hit my goal in now time.

Here is where I am asking for support and help.......a monetary donoation is greatly appreciated, but the best way for me to raise the money to update my website and it will not cost anyone any money out of pocket is for the people to go to my web page www.extremequeenscouponing.com and print coupons, its free, you get a coupon for hopefully something you need and I am paid a small commission on every coupon printed,there are links on the sidebar of my site (the blue coupon bar is the best one) it really is only pennies but pennies add up and the more coupons printed the more money I earn to add costly features like printable lists, easier navagation buttons (some of these add on features are 400-500 dollars) and can update my site enough to be desirable, benefical and successful. Right now the site everages about $19.00 a month :(, a far cry from making enough for upgrades and make the site much more useful.

I would love to add coupon databases, a section for DYI crafts and projects, Recipes, and of course money saving links of all kinds, my passion is to see this webite graow and succeed to its best place possible.

I have read through so many of the campaigns, and they are all in great need of help, some are truly heartbreaking, I wish I could contribute to every one of them, so hopefully my campaign will raise money for my site, but not take away from some else in need, its just a click away and FREE
Thank you Thank you Thank you for any support!!!!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Texas, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/extreme-queens/pica

Background

When we opened our truck in 2010, we were the first gourmet food truck in Ontario.  We quit our jobs, invested our savings, and borrowed money from family and friends to stay afloat.  We couldn’t afford the bells and whistles you see on some trucks today, like plasma televisions, wifi, and custom-fitted quiet generators.  So, for the past three years, we’ve been lugging around a cheap, loud, heavy, ugly beast of a genny.  We’d like to apologize for that.  We want you to eat your fish tacos and gourmet street food in peace, and we’ve let you down.

We’ve put every penny we’ve earned back into the business and to lobbying for street food freedom in Ontario, which is why we need your help.  We'll hook you up with everything from free food to tees, secret recipes, private cooking classes, and an all-you-can-eat food truck feast for you and your friends!  You've kept us trucking longer than any other gourmet food truck in Ontario, and it's time for us to spread the love and shower you with perks!
What We Need &

A generator isn't glamourous.  You won't be able to see it.  You'll barely be able to hear it, but you will feel it!  We'll be free to move around to even more locations, participate in more events, and focus our energy on delivering the best gourmet street food possible.  In order to do that, we're asking for your help to raise $10,000.
. . . that's a lot of tacos.

To source and custom-fit the new generator, we'll work with the magical Mr. Mike Pitton, meat smoker extraordinaire and monkey wrench-wielding mechanic behind Hamilton's Southern Smoke Truck.  Mike's giving us a great deal on his hard work, but he can't control the cost of the genny and custom parts - a whopping $6,000 to $8,000!
So where's the rest of the $10,000 going, you ask?  Well, we want to reward your contributions with the best perks possible, and those cost real cash
column2: also, the truck will be off the road while Mike works his magic, which means no fish taco sales to help us pay the bills.

column1: So what will you get for helping us out?  Let's check out the perks:
Growling Howler! $10
You'll get a heartfelt thank you on twitter from @elgastronomo, and listed on our website as a true El Gastronaut!
Fish Tacos! Fish Tacos! $25
Choose any one item off the menu at the truck, and it's yours! You'll also get a heartfelt thank you on twitter from @elgastronomo, and listed on our website as a true El Gastronaut!
Perhaps you love fish tacos this much . . .
. . . or maybe you'd like to try something new, like our salmon avocado ceviche . . .
. . . or maybe you're craving something hearty like red curry beef cheek!  Whatever you like on the menu that day - it's yours!
El Gastronaut All Over! $50

Check out these sweet, sweet, El Gastronaut tees! Wear your El Gastro love on your sleeve!  Even better, you'll get hardcore El Gastronaut temporary tattoos that you can wear to skip the line at the truck! You'll strut to the front to pick up your free menu item!  Plus, we'll tweet a heartfelt thank you from @elgastronomo, and thank you on our website!
Food That Tastes Like Love! $100

Spice things up in your own kitchen with a selection of house spice blends, including fan favourites like dukkah and berbere! Plus, a signature El Gastronaut tee and temporary tattoos will get you to the front of the line for a free menu item, and a howler of a shout out will let your friends know we love you!
Secrets of a Food Truck Chef! $250

A collection of 12 of Adam's most coveted recipes, including tom yum soup and Thai coconut red curry beef!  You'll also receive a selection of house spice blends to use while you cook up a gourmet street food feast!  Wear your El Gastronaut tee and temporary tattoo to the truck to skip the line and collect your free menu item, and we'll give you a howler of a shout out on twitter and our website!
When I Grow Up I Want to Be a Food Truck Chef $500

We'll customize a gourmet street food dish with you, name it after you, and feature it on the truck for a WHOLE MONTH! Get inspiration from a cookbook of Adam's coveted recipes and a selection of house spice blends! Wear your El Gastronaut tee and temporary tattoo to the truck to skip the line and collect your free menu item!  Plus, we'll give you a shout out on twitter and our website, and a hug in person!
Cook It Like you Learned It! $750

Gather three of your closest allies for a private cooking class with our Chef Adam!  Be inspired by a cookbook of Adam's coveted recipes and a selection of house spice blends! Wear your El Gastronaut tee and temporary tattoo to the truck to skip the line and collect your free menu item!  We'll give you a shout out on twitter and our website, and give you and your friends a hug in person!  
*Cooking classes will be conducted in Niagara, Ontario, only.  Location can be provided. Class date, time, and menu to be determined based on consultation.
Truckin' Gourmet Goodness! $2000

Two hours of ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT private catering for up to 50 people! That's $1000 off the usual price!  We'll give you a massive shout out on the interwebs, and hugs and high fives in person!
**Private catering available in Niagara and Hamilton, Ontario areas only
column2: catering menu, date, and time to be determined based on consultation

column1: We hope you're all as excited about these perks as we are, but if we don't reach our goal, we appreciate your contributions to the mission, and will keep on trucking until we get there!
We have a commitment to being socially and environmentally responsible
column2: if we exceed our goal, we plan to invest in sustainable power sources like solar energy to power as much of the truck as possible!

column1: The Impact

We've missed out on feeding a lot of you because of how loud our genny is, and we want to change that.  A quiet, built-in generator will help us embrace our inner vagabundos and roam more freely to more locations and events.  Your contributions to our mission will allow us to focus on delivering the best gourmet street food possible.  We sincerely thank you for your support over the last three years - you're what keeps us trucking!
Other Ways You Can Help

We’re in this business because we love cooking for you – your faces at the truck are the actual power behind keeping us trucking!  If you can’t contribute to shutting us up, we totally get it! We just ask that you spread the word to your family, friends, coworkers, strangers, and anyone who will listen!
You can share the link to our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools, posting the link on facebook, and tweeting the link with the hashtag #ShhhElGastro!
Thank You!

We'd like to thank the team at Mitchell Reilly Pictures and W Sound Inc. for their generosity, creativity and hard work producing a song and video that finally gives fish tacos their due celebration!  Also, they look great in El Gastronaut tanks and tattoos, don't you think?
We'd also like to thank Mike Pitton at Southern Smoke Truck for his generosity and skills to make our goal a reality!
xo Adam and Tam

Andy is homesick and we miss him too!  My friends! Let's pool some dough together and fly the dude home for a weekend of topless debauchery!  We don't need $500 but that was the minimum amount on this thingy.  I think $300 is plenty so chip in please!  This is gonna be hilarious when he finds out!!  MERRY CHRISTMAS TO ALL !!!

My name is Silvia Sandoval, I am an advocate for the LGBTQ community in San Marcos, Texas.Since we don't have a place to gather, I created an event to bring the community together called Rainbow Night.

This event has gathered more than 200 locals together to share drinks, dance, and enjoy a drag show. Yet we have to move around because every bar we go to gets boycotted by the locals due the bars we go to are not Gay Bars.

I want to bring the community together without feeling like the doors will close on us.

I found a venue that will help us get started. We need a month in advance, construction, beer license, and materials.

Together we can make this happen. Just need the start up money.

Everything I receive will go directly into this lounge. I want it to succeed. Please help me make it possible. I will place your name on the wall of this venue as we go.

Let's take a step forward to change and make a difference!

Welcome to the new
online celebrity experience!
Online Celebrity Idol
is a social media website, a youth-friendly nightclub, and an interactive
experience all in one.
We want to focus on the user experience—with Online
Celebrity Idol, you can take part in talent shows, watch live performances from
your favorite celebrities, and participate in Q-and-A sessions with those celebrities.
Performances will take place at the Celebrity Idol
Entertainment Center night club, but every performance will be broadcast online
and will allow for worldwide participation in events.
Additionally, online users will be able to chat with one
another, upload photos and videos, and join groups for their favorite music
styles, creating a social community.
In addition to being an entertainment site, Online Celebrity
Idol also exists to promote positive messages for youth and will work actively
towards helping local causes. These include young single mothers struggling to
provide for children, veteran unemployment, and youth programs—donation buttons

will be present throughout the site and may include incentives. User accounts on our website will also be able to accumulate special features including virtual “credits” that can be exchanged for uniquely designed profile layouts, Celebrity Idol merchandise, and special account status.

Special account statuses will be identified by small graphics in the upper corner of a user’s profile. These status can be obtained by participating or winning certain events, donating to a certain cause, or being a contributor to this campaign—collecting them will be a main feature of the social media aspect of this website!
An online competition, registered users can submit videos
they’ve uploaded to Celebrity Idol talent shows, provided they’ve followed the
criteria. Community votes will decide the winner, and that person will get
site-wide exposure and a place on the wall of fame. Winners’ packages can also
include:
·
Opportunities to sing with celebrities
Have a professional video done to send to the
Major Record labels
Cash prizes
Competition-specific prizes
As mentioned in the introduction, this website’s main goal
is to steer youth away from violence by providing a safe environment and by
teaching about music and all walks of life. The online donation buttons are a
large part of this: Members can choose to have donation buttons on their
profiles that lead to specific causes.
Users can choose to have their donate button lead to have a certain cause, as well!
Online Celebrity isn’t only a social media website. A
youth-friendly nightclub will also be constructed and maintained – members
only. Here, local celebrity guests will perform on-stage and be broadcast to
the website for those who aren’t in the area. A safe alternative to clubbing,
the Entertainment Center will have a party atmosphere while still being very
much integrated into the website.
Celebrities will also engage in online Q-and-A’s,
collaborations, and be encouraged to interact with their fans in many unique
ways via Online Celebrity Idol’s social media features.
We’re looking to raise at least $800,000 to get the ball
rolling on this project. These funds will take care of the setup of the website,
SEO (Search Engine Optimization) so that people can find us, the renting and
furnishing of a space for our Entertainment Center, and finally, hiring local
celebrities to take part in our community.
As Online Celebrity Idol grows, we will progressively be
able to make our website bigger and better, our nightclub more exclusive, and
attract bigger celebrities to our services. For now, we need your help to get

started!

If you’re worried about what will happen if we don’t reach our goal, there’s no reason to be! The funding strategies behind this campaign will ensure that, even if we do not receive the full $800 000 we are aiming for, the project will go on, and all contributors will receive what they signed up for. Our dedicated team will ensure that, even if we have to build from the bottom up, Online Celebrity Idol will be built and implemented.

In the worst-case scenario (raising less than half of our goal), the construction of the Entertainment Center will be postponed until the website generates sufficient profit, but we are confident that with your help and our current funding strategies, we will be able to amass the funding we need to implement the whole project at once.

We’ve developed a brand-new funding strategy designed specifically for this type of social media. Projections show that the site will be able to gross up to $30 Million a month, playing off of the views brought from celebrity guests and using our previously mentioned strategies.

The user accounts of the website
Donating to this
campaign will get you exclusive membership perks once the service is live, as
well as various other merchandise and bonuses. Please take a look along the
right side of the campaign!
The brainchild of Mark Brown, aspiring entrepreneur from New
York, Online Celebrity Idol is backed by a team of determined supporters and
future staff.
We’re looking forward to undertaking the design,
construction, moderating, and organizing that this project will take to become
a reality. We hope that you’ll consider joining us!
Can’t contribute financially? No worries! Give us a tweet,
share, or blog, and you’ll have done enough. Consider linking our campaign to
your favorite celebrity or just letting your friends know about us.
Contribute, or check back on this campaign page, for future

updates. Thanks for reading, and we hope to see you on our site!

SEO (Search Engine Optimization) so that people can find us, the renting and
furnishing of a space for our Entertainment Center, and finally, hiring local
celebrities to take part in our community.
As Online Celebrity Idol grows, we will progressively be
able to make our website bigger and better, our nightclub more exclusive, and
attract bigger celebrities to our services. For now, we need your help to get

started!If you’re worried about what will happen if we don’t reach our goal, there’s no reason to be! The funding strategies behind this campaign will ensure that, even if we do not receive the full $800 000 we are aiming for, the project will go on, and all contributors will receive what they signed up for. Our dedicated team will ensure that, even if we have to build from the bottom up, Online Celebrity Idol will be built and implemented.In the worst-case scenario (raising less than half of our goal), the construction of the Entertainment Center will be postponed until the website generates sufficient profit, but we are confident that with your help and our current funding strategies, we will be able to amass the funding we need to implement the whole project at once.We’ve developed a brand-new funding strategy designed specifically for this type of social media. Projections show that the site will be able to gross up to $30 Million a month, playing off of the views brought from celebrity guests and using our previously mentioned strategies.The user accounts of the website
Donating to this
campaign will get you exclusive membership perks once the service is live, as
well as various other merchandise and bonuses. Please take a look along the
right side of the campaign!
The brainchild of Mark Brown, aspiring entrepreneur from New
York, Online Celebrity Idol is backed by a team of determined supporters and
future staff.
We’re looking forward to undertaking the design,
construction, moderating, and organizing that this project will take to become
a reality. We hope that you’ll consider joining us!
Can’t contribute financially? No worries! Give us a tweet,
share, or blog, and you’ll have done enough. Consider linking our campaign to
your favorite celebrity or just letting your friends know about us.
Contribute, or check back on this campaign page, for future
updates. Thanks for reading, and we hope to see you on our site!",18.0,0,"2 Campaigns

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Who Are We?

The story begins where self-taught inventor Aaron Imhof, meets Kate Wildrick, a down and out entrepreneur.  Together they find themselves starting over in a 300 square foot apartment above a theater in the inner southeast area of Portland, Oregon. As Kate struggles to deal with the loss of owning and operating a town (Service Creek, Population 2) in Central Oregon, Aaron soon finds himself on the roller coaster of finding steady employment, while struggling to learn how create inventions with limited resources.

One evening, Aaron challenged a friend (and physicist) around the concept of possible energy solutions.  After hearing the case, the friend exclaimed, ""that is not possible!  You don't know what you are talking about.  You need to go to school.  I have a degree and what you are saying is breaking the second law of thermodynamics.""

Frustrated, Aaron crowdsourced $60 to build a successful prototype.  What followed afterwards surprised both Kate and Aaron.  Inventors, engineers, electricians and countless others came out to see what he had created.  To their dismay, they watched as many scholars discounted what they saw saying it wasn't possible.  Folks that had no experience with energy were stoked and saw the possibilities.  It was at that point, Kate and Aaron decided to embark on a new adventure of building an innovation center to develop a new way to think and connect the community.
The Ingenuity Innovation Center

Ingenuity Innovation Center is creating community-based solutions that focuses on sustainable practices. Everything we develop and build is shared using an open source platform. We are situated on 20 acres in St. Helens, Oregon.  We moved here in September 2012.  We have two homes, two shops and one new building that now serves as the innovation center.  We believe that by bringing together from all backgrounds and generations, that together we can create and discover better ways to live and thrive.
Why Create a Community-Based Innovation Center?

Let's face it, a lot is happening in our world that is not sustainable.  Virtually every system (economic, educational, health care, environmental, etc.) is greatly impacting the health and well-being of all inhabitants of this planet.  In order to create effective solutions that are greatly needed now, we believe it is going to take every person to share their unique gift and insight to help dream and create better ways of living.  What better way than by creating a space where people of all ages and interests can gather to connect, learn and innovate?
Our Goal is to Develop “Whole-System” Thinkers

We recognize that people have received a lot of social programming around competition and scarcity.  However, what would our world look and feel like if collaboration and abundance were the norm?  What if our own personal value wasn’t tied to systems that are creating havoc in our health and well-being?  Where your participation felt like a contribution to health instead of selling out?  What if you could do what you love and be able to thrive?
We don’t have all the answers to these, but what does remain clear is that in order to make our world a better place, a new way of thinking
column2: whole systems thinking, is needed to ensure what we create is sustainable and designed to benefit all and not just a few.  To develop “whole” thinkers, we are developing a practice area around innovation, with a high level of trust, where it is safe to try on new ideas and learn how to collaborate and work together as a community.

column1: We are Building a Replicable Innovation Platform to Share

Starting with our St. Helens, Oregon location, our vision is to create a regenerative community-based innovation model that can be shared with any community.  Here, we will learn what is needed to create and support community innovation.  Everything we learn, will be made available to share with others using an open-source platform.
Starting with Food as a Whole Systems Teaching Model

Let's face it, a lot is happening in our food industry.  As genetically modified organisms (GMO's), labeling issues and access to healthy and affordable food become more and more of an issue, many ask what can they do?  If we are going to innovate, we are going to need nourishing food.  We felt by starting with aquaponics, (the merger of growing fish and vegetables), we could show what true abundance looks like.  For every pound of fish, you get 7 pounds of produce.  The harmonious balance creates optimum growing conditions that cut the growing time in half for most vegetables.

The aquaponics model will serve as our first teaching tool to show how whole systems thinking and design can create powerful, abundant solutions.   (After all, who doesn’t love food?)  On a micro level, people can see the direct impact that fish have on the health and well-being of plants.  From a macro perspective, we can explore how our food industry impacts the health and well-being of people and the planet.  Ultimately, people learn what they can do to restore health and well-being to themselves and the world by learning how their choices impact other systems and industries.

We have developed small and large scale aquaponic solutions.  From mini kits to a full indoor community garden growing space, people can come out and see how we did it and learn how to make their own by gaining access to our open source model.  For those that may not have the time or interest to build their own, we will soon have kits available for purchase.
We Need Your Help to Grow Big Time

Aquaponics is the first of many sustainable whole-system solutions we have slated for development.  Get involved to help us raise $100K to help build our open source platform and create sustainable solutions.  Funds raised from this campaign will go to:
<ul>
<li dir=""ltr"">
Establishing our community innovation center.
<li dir=""ltr"">
Building an online information exchange system to share what we create.
<li dir=""ltr"">
Providing resources for sustainable projects.
<li dir=""ltr"">
Supporting outreach to other communities interested in what we are doing.
What's In it for You?
Besides being able to have access to all of the knowledge and information via our open source forum around sustainable solutions, you can also get some nifty perks while PAYING IT FORWARD.

We have asked our friends and supporters to pledge their support by offering up their art, books, movies and coaching to help enhance your life.  Check out our perks to see what we have and who is involved.
What's In it for Everyone Else?

Your support will help make a difference by creating a community space for people to come together to share, learn, and build ideas that can and will make a better world. You will be helping people from all generations and backgrounds practice to learn how to collaborate and build solutions for their community.  Most of all, your support will help develop creative thinking and problem solving that can and will change the world for the better.
What if I love the Idea but Lack the Fundage?

No worries...  The best part about the Ingenuity Innovation Center is that we have other ways you can contribute.  We recognize that money is a resource, but not the only resource.  We have a need for tools, artists, musicians, fans and people to help us coordinate and promote who we are and what we do.  If you are inspired by who we are and want to help, get in touch with us, but most importantly SHARE this funding campaign with your network.
Sign up to receive updates by going to www.ingenuity.pro.  Find us on online at Facebook group by going to https://www.facebook.com/groups/IngenuityInnovation/.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
About Lauren

My name is Lauren Digioia and I am a 27 year old activist from New York.  For the past year I have been involved with the Occupy Wall St movement .  As a disenfranchised youth, my life before occupy did not involve activism, an interest in politics or world news.  It was not until I discovered Zucotti Park that my eyes were truly opened, not just to the reality of our corrupt political and economic sytem, but to the potential power of people from all walks of life coming together to start a conversation and imagine a better world.  It was through the fearless individuals that I met and the incredible stories, knowledge and energy they shared that I realized the potential of humanity to be alive and well, even in a world where apathy and complacency had become the preferred norm.
What I Have Learned

<h3><strong>     I have learned that despite having access to the endless information resource of the internet and higher education in America, the culprits involved in the destruction of our economy, our nation's health, and the wilderness are not widely known.  However, when we are faced with endless war, staggering numbers of incarcerated and homeless and an unessesary dependence on non-renewable resources, we are presented with a choice
column2: remain complacent and prefer ignorance as bliss, or allow ourselves the opportunity to learn and become active. It is our awareness of the truth, our buying power and our rights that are our greatest weapons against oppression and exploitation.

column1: Our Goal

With this traveling ""hub"" we are looking to achieve a positive lasting impression on the people we meet through our example and actions and see that impression in turn inspire more activism in their community.
HOW WILL WE DO IT?
We begin every stop with a tour of the bus-we will show those who come aboard how we are living the solution we teach.
~SERIES OF TEACH-INS

Below is a list of open-source knowledge that our team has to offer. This is not the final list and more will surely be added as we receive more literature and ideas. These steps aim at creating a more self-empowered collective.
~Power in our pocket: The system is dependent on our choices as consumers-raising conciousness in our decision making as buyers- our purchases become an extension of our views.
~Moving Our Money: Step-by-step how to on moving accounts from big banks to local credit unions. ~movie showing

~ Debt Resistance: Intro to taking collective action against predatory  collectors-support in breaking down stigma and shame around debt~use of debt resistor's operations manual for medical, student and housing debt.

~Living Sustainably: Beyond going green! Practicing diligence in our everyday lives to leave no trace and move to zero waste. Water catchment, start up gardens, solar panel reclamation, composting, grey water filtration systems.
~Making our own Green Alternative Products: Bath/body/cleaning products on a small budget and even smaller impact on the earth-they also smell amazing!
~Know Your Rights Training: Vital for everyone! Get to know the justice system and how we can protect ourselves and our civil liberties.
<h3><strong>     ~Artistic Expression=Liberation: A collection of concerts featuring poetry slams, improvisational musical jams, original works including political parody sing alongs, art &amp
column2: craft hours for kids of all ages, interactive drum circles.

column1: ~Book Reading: Select works read aloud from inspiring writers including economists, activists, and professors. Open discussions to follow.
~The People's Think Tank: Topics inspired by you! Engaging discussion on a variety of issues as well as what YOU think are possible solutions to those issues.
<h3><strong>    ~Meditation &amp
column2: Yoga for the People: Casual approach to healing: centering ourselves, decreasing stress and re-connecting with our own energy and the energy of the earth.

column1: Our skill-shares, teach-ins and performances will always be free and available to everyone. We believe in a ""know one, teach one"" principal. That way we set a standard for others to continue the work we begin.
~THE POWER OF INDEPENDENT MEDIA

Part of our campaign is the use of indie journalism to expose corruption, cover events large and small, draw attention to relevant issues and find incredible local stories of inspiration and hope. We are fortunate to have a live streamer on our team who will be filming, blogging, doing live local coverage as well as international news coverage.

~Community Hour: 1 hour segment broadcasting live interviews with community members and bringing local issues to light. This segment has the potential to reach a wide audience through our various social media outlets.
~Daily Live Stream Updates: Check in with where we are in the country, where we are heading next and the overall tour experience. Interviews with the crew.
Where Your Contributions Will Go

The majority of the funds we are asking for is going towards the purchase of an incredible bus, which will carry supplies, food and crew around the country.We need a enviromentally friendly vehicle with thea model for the lifestyle we would like to emulate and one with a cool history.  The key for this campaign being successful is being mobile.  The asking price for the bus is 22,500.  Please visit the link below for all details about the bus. You will quickly see why this is THE bus of our DREAMS!
http://www.squeakywheeladventures.org/for_sale.php
<h3>     Any funds remaining after the purchase of the bus will be allocated to fuel, medical supplies, disaster relief/daily meals, stocking our library, art &amp
column2: music supplies and multi-media equipment. To ensure full transparency all spending will be documented and open sourced on our facebook page and our website.

column1: THE IMPACT
<div>

The most influential thing we can offer is a chance to bring a more empowering message to people who might not otherwise hear it.  The open sharing of knowledge, experience and ideas can motivate even the most disenfranchised of individuals to come together and create feasible solutions.

<h3>     Having the ability to travel to various communities throughout the country is crucial. We are not satisfied with the disconnected means of the internet to  bring that message of love, acceptance and self-empowerment. Nothing compares to real human interaction
column2: the intimacy of one on one conversation And hands-on education. Give us that opportunity to share ourselves as a better model for our generation. This bus is the ultimate tool for us to do this work on a large scale.

column1: We know the way we live our lives today is not sustainable and that times are tough. No matter where you come from, that is something we can all agree on. It's our common thread-PEOPLE should be more important than PROFIT, but we know that is not the case when hard-working people continue to lose their homes, jobs and their lives. We need to continue taking a stand against all types of oppression, including the supression of truth.

By teaching people practical alternatives of living and broadcasting the people's voices, we provide the tools to help people help themselves. With this campaign we have the potential to inspire thousands, if not millions, to work together, despite our differences, through that common thread.  This is one of the first steps in grassroots organizing. All we have to do is look back at our history to see the testimony of success.

In the past year the most helpful education we received was from exposure to diverse groups of people and the causes they are passionate about. We strive to continue that process of evolving past conventional standards, breaking down stereotypes and joining the global fight to put the power back in the hands of the people.  Our work has just begun!
Other Ways To Help Our Cause

We understand more than most that not everyone can make a monetary contribution.  However, just as important is building a network of support and informational resources.  You can help us by getting the word out about our cause, and sharing any information you think would benefit us on our tour on our facebook. From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for taking the time to read our campaign.

Summary
I am a person who has tonnes of great business ideas, but lack the capital to start them.

So what I've decided to do, is create a Pinterest.com board which I've opened FOR YOU to advertise on.  The idea is inspired by some simple ideas we've seen in the past, such as milliondollarhomepage.com or the 'Big Red Paperclip' idea. As an individual you can put your photo, name, or both and where you are from and your favorite quote or even your Twitter handle or Facebook address.  As a small business or corporation, you have the opportunity to put your logo, slogan, internet addresses, and contact information on a 'virtual billboard' pin on my pinterest board.

This campaign will give me the funds necessary to get some of my ideas rolling.  I've had these ideas for awhile, but they are all still legit, relevant, and have the potential to become great successes.  I just need a few 'crowd angels' to help me get a little capital to protect my ideas, and to allow me to formalize them.  If my businesses get big enough, I'm hoping they create jobs as well as inpiration to those in need.
What I Need &
<div>

The $10,000 figure I came up with is a nice round number that will allow for expenses that I will incur as I begin my journey. If I fall short, I just have to pull back on some of the ideas and implement them at a later time.  If I exceed my goal, the funds will allow me to protect my ideas better, and give the potential to move a little faster as I won't have to source additional funding.

Alot of my ideas need to use a computer and other technology so the first purchase I would make is up to date technology.  I would be using the remainder of the funds for legal fees to protect my ideas.
More importantly, is what you get for funding me!

$5 - This if for individuals who want to express themselves.  You can post a photo of yourself (optional) and your name (real name or nickname), where you are from and what your life motto is or personal quote.  There will be zero tolerance for any hate or inappropriate words/images.

$10 - Everything you get in the first level plus a personal blog or website address, or any Twitter or Facebook account names added to your 'pin'.  Also I will do a thank you shout out on Facebook or Twitter for you.

$100 - Small business - You can put up your company name with logo, slogan, and website and/or physical address and any other contact information for your business. I will also mention your name on my Twitter and Facebook accounts for people to check you out.

$1000 - Corporate - You get all of the perks that a small business will get, plus I will ensure that  your company name gets credit in one of my web based ideas (with approval from you of course).  Depending on what industry you are in, I might be willing to do product placement under appropriate conditions.
$10,000 - Partner - You will become a 1% of ANY business that I start up. And I will take any suggestions into consideration.
Remember, although I am trying to raise money for myself, I also want to make sure that there is value in the perk level that you choose and I will do my best to ensure that you are 100% satisfied.
<div>
The Impact

When my ideas succeed, I'm hoping it will inspire other average people like myself to look for ways to start their own businesses.  As the world wide web evolves, it makes it increasingly easy for people to network and help one another in a variety of ways.  I look forward to creating jobs for people of all different backgrounds and with this campaign I'm hoping to create awareness of great individuals and great businesses alike.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

Individuals - Don't be shy, let's get as many as your friends to get 'pinned' to the wall.  A fun way to post a 'quote' or inside joke that will stay on the board for a VERY long time. (*at any point in time you feel that your pin has overstayed it's welcome, just send me a quick email and I will remove asap!)

Small Businesses - You probably go to at least a few networking events and what a great way to share an inexpensive way to advertise that could potentially be seen by several hundred, or possibly several thousand potential customers.
Corporations - Feel free to get all of your brands their own 'pin' on my board and help advertise your entire business.
And for everyone who reads this, please share, share, share!!!
","Summary
I am a person who has tonnes of great business ideas, but lack the capital to start them.

So what I've decided to do, is create a Pinterest.com board which I've opened FOR YOU to advertise on.  The idea is inspired by some simple ideas we've seen in the past, such as milliondollarhomepage.com or the 'Big Red Paperclip' idea. As an individual you can put your photo, name, or both and where you are from and your favorite quote or even your Twitter handle or Facebook address.  As a small business or corporation, you have the opportunity to put your logo, slogan, internet addresses, and contact information on a 'virtual billboard' pin on my pinterest board.

This campaign will give me the funds necessary to get some of my ideas rolling.  I've had these ideas for awhile, but they are all still legit, relevant, and have the potential to become great successes.  I just need a few 'crowd angels' to help me get a little capital to protect my ideas, and to allow me to formalize them.  If my businesses get big enough, I'm hoping they create jobs as well as inpiration to those in need.

 Joel L. Nitzkin of th (AAPHP) American Association of Public Health Physicians stated and I quote ""If we get all smokers to switch from regular cigarettes to electronic cigarettes, we would eventually reduce the U.S. death toll from 400,000 a year to less than 4,000, maybe as low as 400,""

This is a very powerful statement and I agree. We also will be helping find cures for cancer and this drives us to our soul.  He also stated ""Smokers could reduce their risk of future tobacco related death by 99.9% or better by switching to a nicotine -only delivery product like the e cigarette.""

I had given in to smoking after 30 years.I was going to smoke till I died or it killed me as it did other members of my family. Then I discovered vapor/smokeless market and have not smoked in 4 months. After research in the market I have found a way to promote a alternative to smoking while supporting Cancer Charities which in time we pray it will be  millions of much needed donations, and giving back to the customers as well, at a price up to 25% less than any competitor. Note . We are creating 8 jobs with a potential to create hundreds of jobs in the long run.

While providing a superior and less expensive vapor/smokeless service is important for clients,we also believe there is a growing awareness, especially in the cancer realm of the importance of philanthropy and charitable giving. The company believes that many users will appreciate, and become actively involved in, the opportunity to donate funds to charitable cancer causes they support if given a straightforward way to do so, especially if such donations are not perceived to be taking money from their own pockets. If users will be purchasing items at the store or on the internet anyway, why not use the less expensive service that also makes donations to a Cancer Charity? This will be know to all customers as this is our model. We will be looking to join with cancer charities to promote and spot light.

Our goal is to be the Supercuts of the vapor/smokeless  business.There is no leader in this market and with our philanthropic model we will be that leader with your help.We have put all we have into this and obtained 70% of the monies needed and are looking for the other 30% to execute our plans.

The $150,000 is not the full 30% needed to fully execute our plans but enough to get operational. So if you see us fully funded please keep donating. The value of our perks are more then the donation value so you wont be disapointed.These monies are for web development, marketing and product development. The more for marketing,  web and product development the faster we will meet our ultimate goals. This is a niche market expected to quadruple by 2014.

We have many more niches in our company profile model like customer loyalty, rewards and more that will insure our domination of the market.Here is a link for more info about the vapor market that has many answers to most peoples questions. www.tveca.com
I have our logo nearly complete and am working with a company to create our own unique product/s to make us that more special in comparison to our competitors.

On our perks we plan on sending them out much sooner than the date we are stating. We will be sending them out as soon as we are cash flow positive which we antisapate in a few months, but no later than the date posted.
I thank you in advance for any consideration.
I will be more than glad to answer any or all questions some one has, Feel free to call or email.

Hey there. I'm Miranda Stork, the owner of Moon Rose Publishing. I've got 6 books published, and I've worked as a proofreader and editor for over 7 years, both freelance and for publishers. So I've seen the publishing industry from different sides. And most importantly--I love books, the authors behind them, and the readers that make it all worthwhile.

I made the decision last year to publish my own books the indie way, as I wanted to retain control. But there are hundreds of authors who sign up with small indie publishers every day. But while most of these publishers feel the way I do about books, some of them don't think about the author as much as their own deal. Cheap covers, poor editing, and even letting the author know they would be doing all the marketing. Here at Moon Rose, we want authors to feel their book wouldn't look out of place amongst one of the Big 6's books.

We like great covers, perfect editing, and to help the author out every step of the process. They've written a great story, the least we can do as a publisher is give it a great bow. At Moon Rose, we want a partnership between ourselves and the publisher, one that works for both of us.

When I started the company in October, I didn't expect a lot of interest at first. We are a new publisher, and we're floating amongst a lot of fish in our pond. But we must be doing a good job, as we currently have 15 authors signed up to Moon Rose Publishing! The problem is that it's a lot of work, and we are, at the moment, a tiny team of three people. But we want to be able to welcome more authors to our little family, and get their amazing books out there for you, the readers, to enjoy and fall in love with. And we don't just publish ebooks like a lot of new publishers, we also do it the old-fashioned way--with print books.

But unfortunately, that takes up funds. We've already got another ten books lined up for when submissions open again in October 2013, but we would love to have more, and really expand Moon Rose into something truly exciting. With a little of your help, we would be able to pay for all these things for each book, rather than doing it ourselves, giving us more time to find those authors and get them out there to the world
Editing
Proofing
Formatting
Cover Design
Book Trailers
Book Tours
Marketing

We don't want any of these things to be anything less than perfect. A book is a big process. Some authors takes years writing one, scrunching up pages, spending sleepless nights tapping on a keyboard, and finally plucking up the courage to put it forward to a publisher. Then it's a minimum of a eight month process just to get it ready for publication. But the end result is amazing. A book becomes a portal to escapism, a place where a reader can lose themselves for a while between the pages. Nothing compares to a book, and few things even come close.

So we're passionate about this campaign because we're passionate about books. We're passionate about the future of Moon Rose Publishing, and where it's going to take us. We're passionate about bringing a world of excitement to readers that will change their minds about indie books. Helping us on this campaign will shape us from a small publisher into something larger, more exciting, and more equipped to bring hundreds more authors that tiny bit closer to their dream.
<div>
Okay, down to brass tacks, as they say. We're putting a lot of effort into this campaign because we want to reach a big total--£3000, to be exact. But we have some big ideas for the funds.

Every book that comes out needs a rigious going-over before it's published. Once an author takes that big step to put a manuscript forward, it first needs reading over to check it fits into Moon Rose. Then the next step, after contracts are signed, is to get it proofed and edited. This takes a few months, with first, second, and possibly even third edits taking place to get is as close to perfect as possbile.

Then a trailer needs making, to let more readers know about the book, and also to let the author tell all their friends and family about their upcoming publication. An author page must be made on the website, along with links, and a lot of information.

The next step is to format the book, a process taking a few weeks in some cases. Each e-reader is different, so version must be made for Kindles, Nooks, Kobo readers, and Sony readers. There also needs to be a print copy formatted, usually with each page carefully pored over to make sure it all looks correct.

The author also needs a book tour arranging, on reviewers' blogs, the best place to find exciting new books that are coming out. This in itself takes a long time to arrange between author and blogger, with guests posts, interviews, and character interviews to write, infomation about the book and author to be sent over to the blogger, dates to be arranged, and a multitude of details specific to each blog.
Authors also need a Facebook page setting up, as well as a Twitter page, and any other social media they use, along with banners made by Moon Rose Publishing if they ask.

The final step is to design a brilliant cover. This isn't as easy as it seems! Making a cover is a lot more than slotting a few pictures together. A cover needs a lot of imagination, the ability to hook a reader in one look, and it has to fit the book. All of this must be done by a artist who carefully checks colours, photos, images, fonts, and even blurbs. Covers should be a work of art in themselves, as book are judged by their covers. By the way, we thought we should show a few of our covers off here, so you know where we're coming from...

All of this doesn't even cover the tiny details, such as getting and filling out the paperwork for ISBNs, stocking each book, and filling out tax forms, business forms...a lot of work in one go! And we want to do this for many authors!
Then comes the really hard work
column2: letting authors know the book is out there. This is a blend of sharing on social media, blogs, selected paid adverts, reviews, sending postcards and bookmarks to bookstores, and spending time getting the book out to peopel via Street Teams and readers.

column1: Your funds will help to go towards every step in this process. We already know people we trust and would love to do some work on each book, but they need to earn a living too! So these funds will allow for more books to have the same care and dedication one of our books would have. And if you're an aspiring author, it'll give us more time to accept your book onto our virtual bookshelves.
BUT...what do you guys get for all this? We wouldn't ask for this kind of support without offering some amazing goodies in return!

Your support for our funding can start at just $5, with a big thank you displayed prominently on our website, and that warm fuzzy feeling when you tell people how you've helped out the publishing industry, and a small UK-based business.

The goodies only get better from there, with free ebooks, graphics packages from Moon Rose Cover Designs, free print books signed by the authors themselves (so super rare!), leading up to an amazing super prize of all our goodies and the chance to star as a character in one of my books! Not just as a minor character, but as a full member of the 'book cast'. You can choose the name, how they look, their mannerisms, and much more, worked out over email with me personally.

Even if we don't hit our full total, we're still going to use whatever funds we raise to go towards all the tasks we've mentioned above. We want to publish at least another 20 authors in 2014, but we'll still aim to help as many as we can with the funding we raise. So every tiny total of £150 is another author who can be proud of their work, and another unique book out there for all you readers to enjoy.
<div>

Okay, time to get a little soppy. This is a business campaign, but it's also something very close to our hearts. At Moon Rose, the message is simple. We love books. We love everything about them. The authors, the readers, the wonderful escapism of reading. You can invest in many businesses, but not many businesses that open up imagination as those little paper-filled (or digital page-filled!) tomes do.
I personally have read books since I was three, and reading was an escape from a troubled childhood. As I grew up, books become a fountain of learning
column2: for facts, life, and personal relationships. Books can change your outlook, how people are seen, or even the world. It sounds big and dream-like, but we all know it's true. Books can last for centuries.

column1: We don't just publish any old book that comes along to our inboxes. We publish the best. We want books that are dazzling, soaked in drama and brimming with vivid characters. Moon Rose Publishing aims to help create the kind of books that are referred to by others, that are referred to in films, that give birth to quotes and characters that last long after they were born on the pages.

On top of this, publishing is a changing animal, shifting and twisting its way into the 21st century. With e-books, reading has become easier and more accessible for us all. Storytellers who would normally have to wait years to even get a sniff at being published can now create their vision for anyone to read. We love this idea, but we also love paperbacks in our hands. So unlike a lot of indie publishers, we've decided to make print books of all our suitable books, allowing for the wonderful feeling of a book in your hands.

We want just one thing, and I know we've mentioned it a lot. We don't want to let our authors or their readers down. We don't want to become one of the publishers that had to remain small because we didn't have the funds to do otherwise. We want to be bigger, because we believe we're doing something right, and we want to be there when the next big thing comes along in the publishing industry...like reading from a hologram chip in your head! Maybe not, but we'll keep our eyes peeled.
<div>
Thank you for reading down our long pile of scrawl, and thank you even more for helping to support our campaign! But you can help us even more if you like, and you can have a virtual drink on us.
-Share on Facebook
-Share on Twitter
-Share anywhere on the internet where it fits, in fact!
-Tell all your friends and family, and anyone you know who is passionate about books.

And most important of all, an enormous and huge thank you from the bottom of our hearts (and books!). This means a lot to us, and it's wonderful that we have people behind us too who also believe in us. Hugs from Moon Rose Publishing!

column1: We don't just publish any old book that comes along to our inboxes. We publish the best. We want books that are dazzling, soaked in drama and brimming with vivid characters. Moon Rose Publishing aims to help create the kind of books that are referred to by others, that are referred to in films, that give birth to quotes and characters that last long after they were born on the pages.

On top of this, publishing is a changing animal, shifting and twisting its way into the 21st century. With e-books, reading has become easier and more accessible for us all. Storytellers who would normally have to wait years to even get a sniff at being published can now create their vision for anyone to read. We love this idea, but we also love paperbacks in our hands. So unlike a lot of indie publishers, we've decided to make print books of all our suitable books, allowing for the wonderful feeling of a book in your hands.

We want just one thing, and I know we've mentioned it a lot. We don't want to let our authors or their readers down. We don't want to become one of the publishers that had to remain small because we didn't have the funds to do otherwise. We want to be bigger, because we believe we're doing something right, and we want to be there when the next big thing comes along in the publishing industry...like reading from a hologram chip in your head! Maybe not, but we'll keep our eyes peeled.
Thank you for reading down our long pile of scrawl, and thank you even more for helping to support our campaign! But you can help us even more if you like, and you can have a virtual drink on us.
-Share on Facebook
-Share on Twitter
-Share anywhere on the internet where it fits, in fact!
-Tell all your friends and family, and anyone you know who is passionate about books.

And most important of all, an enormous and huge thank you from the bottom of our hearts (and books!). This means a lot to us, and it's wonderful that we have people behind us too who also believe in us. Hugs from Moon Rose Publishing!",5.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","North Yorkshire, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/moon-rose-publishing-wants-more-authors/pica

WAC, the Occidental College Women's Ultimate Team, needs support to attend Division I Conference Championships in San Luis Obispo in 3 short weeks.  For a small school, Occidental has a long history with Ultimate Frisbee.  The team has been around in one way or another since 1980!  For years women were part of the club, but it wasn't until 1994 that the school fielded its first all women team.  Since then there been a sustained women's frisbee presence, though not always an established team.  In recent years, we have taken a big step forward as a program.  The 2012-2013 club has 12 graduating seniors, and at various times has had over 30 women participating in practices and events.

The Conference Championship tournament is especially important as a culminating event for the large number of seniors on this squad, and a spring-board for the next generation of women's players at Oxy.  It is the most competitive tournament we will attend all season, with attendees like UCSB, UCSD, UCLA and USC that are perennial national powers.
Not only will these funds enable us to make the most of this final, special weekend, but any overages will help us ensure that experiences like this are available in 2013/2014 and beyond!

UPDATE 4/11/2013
Thank you for helping us meet our initial goal of $1,200!! Your support is invaluable and a real inspiration to WAC. We are excited to be going to the Conference Championships, knowing that we will finish the year on solid financial ground. We can’t wait to share the experience with you all!

Those of you that haven’t contributed yet, please consider pitching in. Our updated goal is $2,000!  Any additional money raised will go to support the club going forward. Club sports like WAC receive limited annual funding from the school and there are a number of things we would like to do that only happen once every few years, if at all. These include:
- update team uniforms/provide uniforms to new players
- buy practice equipment like new discs, cones, agility tools, etc.
- keep the first-aid kit stocked and up-to-date
- attend more tournaments, some that may require team air-travel
- print custom team discs

Thanks again, everyone. Much love from WAC!

column2: >August 19th 1981 I ran away from The Meridian Home for Girls in Royersford Pa to the Streets of Fort Lauderdale FL.
>By 2004 I ended up living under a Bridge, Addicted, Hopeless and Alone after  30+yrs of struggling...
>Then in 2005 I met Drug Court Judge Marcia Beach who Loved me until I could Love Myself..
>And Then finally cleaned up my act in 2006
>So on June 11th 2011 I Started Walking Home…
>I am Sandra Huffman and I walked 786 miles out of 1300 from Fort Lauderdale to Washington DC and then to Philadelphia to Celebrate National Recovery Month and my 5 yrs Clean and Sober in 2011.

column3: Recovery and Fighting  the ""Stigma"" Surrounding the Recovery Community

column2: >And now I plan to go Coast 2 Coast and do it all over again for my 7th year in 2013! This time we need a BUS/RV to haul our equipment and the 1000's of pounds of Resource Materials we have gathered from across the country..
>Okay in Reality it's going to be a very ""Short Bus"",RV or even Van but hey anything will work!

>Sowing a trail with 1000's of Mustard seed Necklaces of Hope to cultivate messages of hope, healing, and recovery to victims of Addiction,Abuse,Mental Illness and Homelessness. “Sandra’s Walk 2013”  will begin in June 2013 starting from the Seattle/Tacoma area of Washington State USA. Walking through 50 Major Cities and Countless Dozens of Small Towns across America.

>I will arrive in Washington, D.C. by September 2013 to participate in DC-based Recovery Month activities as well as PRO-ACT’s Recovery Walks in Philadelphia plus surrounding areas during the entire trip.

column1: ","August 19th 1981 I ran away from The Meridian Home for Girls in Royersford Pa to the Streets of Fort Lauderdale FL.
By 2004 I ended up living under a Bridge, Addicted, Hopeless and Alone after  30+yrs of struggling...
Then in 2005 I met Drug Court Judge Marcia Beach who Loved me until I could Love Myself..
And Then finally cleaned up my act in 2006
So on June 11th 2011 I Started Walking Home…
I am Sandra Huffman and I walked 786 miles out of 1300 from Fort Lauderdale to Washington DC and then to Philadelphia to Celebrate National Recovery Month and my 5 yrs Clean and Sober in 2011.
My walk was about Hope & Recovery and Fighting  the ""Stigma"" Surrounding the Recovery Community

And now I plan to go Coast 2 Coast and do it all over again for my 7th year in 2013! This time we need a BUS/RV to haul our equipment and the 1000's of pounds of Resource Materials we have gathered from across the country..
Okay in Reality it's going to be a very ""Short Bus"",RV or even Van but hey anything will work!

Sowing a trail with 1000's of Mustard seed Necklaces of Hope to cultivate messages of hope, healing, and recovery to victims of Addiction,Abuse,Mental Illness and Homelessness. “Sandra’s Walk 2013”  will begin in June 2013 starting from the Seattle/Tacoma area of Washington State USA. Walking through 50 Major Cities and Countless Dozens of Small Towns across America.

I will arrive in Washington, D.C. by September 2013 to participate in DC-based Recovery Month activities as well as PRO-ACT’s Recovery Walks in Philadelphia plus surrounding areas during the entire trip.
Please help us do this again!!",2.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Bally, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/sandraswalk-org-big-bus-dream/pica
