Who We Are and What We Do

TransForm Idaho Inc. is a registered Idaho non-profit. Our federal 501-c-3 status is pending.  As an advocacy organization, we educate Idahoans on issues that affect women and families – especially those concerning women’s rights, health care, pay equality, and quality of life.  We educate citizens on how to lobby their legislators, and promote voter registration and citizen involvement in politics.  We encourage and support political practices that are transparent and people-centered, to help everyone.

We came together in April 2012 as the Idaho State Legislature, with a legacy of some of the nation’s most restrictive anti-abortion laws, debated a bill that would require pregnant women considering abortion to undergo and pay for medically unnecessary ultrasound examinations. The bill was withdrawn, but a group of volunteers decided to form an organization to educate ourselves and others to address issues that affect women’s health and access to affordable health care, as well as economic issues that include equal pay for equal work.
<ul>
• We have worked together with other organizations to sponsor successful panel discussions on the state school referendum.
• We have traveled throughout the state to conduct discussion groups that help citizens be more effective in addressing local issues in their communities.
• We have conducted information and training sessions  on women’s rights at college campuses and public events throughout the state .
• We publish a monthly newsletter on our activities that reaches more than 5,000 people.
• Our Media Update Blog, at http://transformidaho.blogspot.com/, received more than 1,200 page views in a single day in November and more than 3,600 total page views during October.
• Our Web site, at http://www.transformidaho.org, includes current and accurate summaries compiled from reputable sources to help inform citizens and community leaders.
<div>
What We Do With Your Donation
Your generous support will help us fund the TransForm Idaho Citizen Lobby Corps and  continue our training and educational efforts throughout the state.

Donations will go to training citizen lobbyists who will communicate with legislators and educate and inform voters about issues that concern them, and will help support a group of college student interns who will engage and communicate with younger voters in 2013. Every contribution is appreciated.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't donate now, we welcome your support in other ways:

1. Come to our meetings, held on the first and third Wednesdays of every month, at noon at the Boise Public Library, 715 South Capitol Boulevard , and at 7 p.m., at the Boise Unitarian Universalist Fellowship at Garden City, 6200 North Garrett Street. During the legislative session we may meet more frequently. If you're not a regular attendee, please RSVP so we can inform you of any changes.

2. React and respond. When you learn of an action you feel strongly about, write your legislators and let them know where you stand. Write letters to the editor of your local newspaper. Respond to audience and reader forums on television and radio stations, on Blogs and Internet sites. Write to your lawmakers. Your opinions do matter, but only if you express them.

3. We’re first and foremost a volunteer organization. If you have time to spare – hours or days, we welcome your help. We welcome volunteers, speakers, experts in public service, educators, and everyday folks.
4. Help us spread the word: Tell your friends and ask them to tell their friends about TransForm Idaho, our advocacy work, and our goals.

In honor of the memory of Deyontray Clark his family has asked me to set up this fundraiser to assist with funds for the funeral. We are campaigning to raise as much money as possible for the funeral. Due to Deyontray being laid off from his job his insurance lapsed and left his family in disarray. Please help us in meeting our goal it will be greatly appreciated.
<h2><span style=""text-decoration: underline
All funds will go to paying funeral expenses including funeral home bills, medical bills, tombstone, flowers, etc.
<h3><span style=""text-decoration: underline
This would greatly aid Deyontray and his family during this extremely diffucult time.

<ul>

• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
• Post and share link on facebook, twitter, and all social media to assist with donations.

And that’s all there is to it.
